loans.name: Fausa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 5 ainda frequentam a Escola. Frequenta as aulas de alfabetização, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane porcurando melhores condicoes de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, batata, peixe, arroz, sumos,  e outros) para aumentar a a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, todos para o  negocio.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para melhorar a sua casa e ampliar a sua actividade comercial, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fausa was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of six children, five of whom go to school. She is taking literacy classes. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She left Maputo for Boane in search of a better life. She's had a business for more than 20 years and earns 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (oil, sweet potatoes, fish, rice, juice, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. Her other loans were in the amounts of 12,000, 15,000, and 20,000 meticals, which she also invested in her business.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to improve her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products (oil, sweet potatoes, fish, rice, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete”, está constituido  por 21  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayuda de las unas a las otras. Actualmente está en el cuarto ciclo, pero comentan que les gustaría poder seguir dentro del programa de la fundación.
Lilian es una de las miembros, ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Dice que sus prendas son muy vendidas y que le va muy bien en las ventas. Esta trabajo es el que la ayuda a mantener su hogar y a su familia, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, como ser pantalones, jeans, remeras, camisas, calzas y otros tipos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" is comprised of 21 members from the same area who are very active and supportive of each other.  They got together in an effort to help one another.  They are now in their fourth cycle but say they would like to continue working with the foundation's program.

Lilian is one of the members.  She has a used clothing business that she claims is going very well with a high sales volume.  This work allows her to help cover household expenses and support the family, so she would like to continue this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy used clothing such as trousers, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, stockings and other items which will help her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Margarita María

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Margarita María; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, viuda y tiene 3 hijos; la socia sigue trabajando en una  entidad pública de lunes a viernes desde las 08:00am hasta la 01:00pm y de 03:00pm hasta las 07:00pm,ella por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar viberes como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite para su uso personal.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Sra. Margarita María. She is 58 years old, a widow with 3 children. She works for a public company from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 1.00pm and from 3.00pm to 7.00pm. By means of this work she takes care of her children. The member wants to continue improving in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy food staples such as rice, sugar, milk and oil for personal use. 

She is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy staples such as sugar, milk and oil, for her personal use.

loans.name: Midedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIDEDJI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même entourage. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bernadine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bernadine est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Benjamin. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Bernadine n’a jamais été à l’école, mais assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Bernadine vend des condiments et divers autres produits dans son quartier. Bernadine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Bernadine exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bernadine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIDEDJI, un troisième crédit. Les deux crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Midedji group is composed of three people who live in the same environment. Bernadine is the representative of the group and is raising her hand in the picture.

Bernadine is 46 years old and is married to a mechanic named Benjamin. They have two dependent children, both attending school. The children live together with their parents. Bernadine has never been to school, but handles jointly with her husband the various family expenditures.

To support herself and her children, Bernadine sells condiments and other products in her neighborhood. She resupplies her stock at a market in Benin. She has been carrying on this business activity for nine years.

Seeking for customer satisfaction and wanting to increase her turnover and income, Bernadine is now requesting, together with other Midedji group members, a third credit loan. The two previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy condiments and various items.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He’s divorced, living with his only school-aged son and parents. 

Since he is the main income provider for his family, he started to work as a security in a local hotel in 2009 in addition to his job as a delivery man in one of the local restaurants for the past three years. 

Today, he decided to borrow $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his son’s educational fees until graduation. He’s devoting his life to his son and looking forward to offering him a respectable life.

loans.use: to pay his son’s educational fees until graduation.

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea, 44, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is on the staff of the Provincial Inspection Department. Her husband is a security guard in a hotel and also a farmer. Her child is on the staff of the Provincial Religious Affairs Department. 

Sokea requests a loan of $500 to purchase seed rice and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she can generate more income to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to raise animals in order to generate more income and build a new home.

loans.use: to purchase rice and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: La Buchicata Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Buchicata  esta conformado por  once integrantes todas personas trabajadoras que desde pequeñas han sabido lo que es ganarse el pan de cada día  y ganarse el amor de sus familias con esfuerzo.
El representante de este grupo es el señor Jacinto mejor conocido como  Don Chinto  por sus compañeras del grupo.
Don Chinto es un señor de cincuenta y dos años de edad , que desde pequeño a trabajado comenzó a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes y siempre quiso tener su propia tienda así que  trabajo y ahorro para poder tener una tienda pequeña y gracias a sus ganancias pudo hacerla crecer y ser su propio jefe.
El pidió el  préstamo para comprar  mas mercancía de abarrotes como es : galletas ,javon,café.leche,galletas, refrescos, yogurt, jugos  y licuados.
Las otras integrantes de el grupo son:
Rufa-quien se dedica a la venta  de ropa.
Tomasa-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Florida Martha-quien se dedica al de lavado de autos.
Norma Elena -quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Maribel-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
María de la  Paz-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Tereza-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Rosa María-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de articulos artesanales.
Sarai-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudarla  a salir adelante y darle la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños con su ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called 'La Buchicata'.  It has 11 members.  They are all hard-working people who, since they were very young, have known what it means to earn their daily bread and earn the love of their families through hard work.  The group's representative is Jacinto, who is better known as Don Chinto by his fellow group members.

Don Chinto is a 52-year-old man who has been working since he was very young.  He started out working in a grocery store and always wanted his own store.  He worked and saved so that he could own his own small store and, thanks to the profits he made, he was able to grow the business and become his own boss.

Don Chinto requested this loan to buy more groceries such as cookies, soap, coffee, milk, soft drinks, yogurt, juices and shakes.

The other members of this group are:
Rufa - who sells clothing
Tomasa - who sells Mexican snacks
Florida Martha - who washes cars
Norma Elena - who sells clothing
Maribel - who sells groceries
María de la  Paz - who sells groceries
Tereza - who sells groceries
Rosa María - who sells clothing
Elizabeth - who sells handicrafts
Sarai - who sells groceries.

The group's members thank Fundación Realidad for helping them to get ahead in life and for giving them the opportunity to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Fayzeh is a 41 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to maintenance of the rooms. In the future she wants to buy a home in the same of area.
Fayzeh prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for he home improvements

loans.name: Chuija Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena  es madre viuda, tiene 37 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la confección de delantales y chumpas, inicio este negocio cono una pequeña maquiladora y hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijos quienes la apoyan en el trabajo que realiza.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un  préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de materiales para su negocio, telas, cipers, hilos, adornos, y entre otras cosas, necesarias para su trabajo, espera en el futuro tener mas empleados y con exportación de otros productos de confección al exterior de Guatemala.
texts.en:
Sra. Magdalena, age 37, is a mother and a widow.  She did not have the opportunity to study.  Magdalena has four children, one of whom is in school.  She produces smocks and sweaters.  Magdalena’s business started out as a small workshop and now she has 10 years of experience.  She has the support of her children who help her with the work.  

Magdalena organized a group so that could request a loan.  She will use the proceeds to buy materials for her business such as fabrics, zippers, thread, ornaments, and other items that she needs for her work.  In the future, she hopes to have more employees and be able to export other manufactured goods to places outside of Guatemala.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 58 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Isabel is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Isabel has been in this business for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Translated to English:

My name is Gloria F. I on sell of products for the home such as plates, toasters, telefones, glasses, and plates.  I\'ve been running this business for about 4 years and I have great customers since I sell to private companies.  

My business generates income to me for the sustenance of my family,  My goal is to increase my inventory to obtain a greater sale and with the gains that it obtains to be able to remodel my house, to sustain my family and send my daughter to school.



Original Spanish:
Mi nombre es Gloria F. me dedico a la venta de productos para el hogar como ser planchas, tostadoras, telefonos, vasos, platos, tenedores. Tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas de empresas privadas y publicas, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para obtener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, sustentar mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hija.

loans.use: Compra de planchas, tostadoras de pan, platos vasos, tenedores, cucharas, telefonos, manteles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce Muthoni Mwangi intends to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
A. Florence was born in 1974 in Purongo Division , Anaka sub-county, Gulu district currently Amuru. She is a widow with five children. She served as a care taker with CHARITY FOR PEACE a night commuter center from 2003 up to date. However, when LIFE IN AFRICA came in she became interested in their programs and so she soon became a member and started making paper beads, straw bags to mention but a few. Through the programs at LiA she has learned to believe in herself.

Being a widow with five children brings many challenges. There are school fees to pay, medicine, food, and many other expenses. This becomes difficult because she is the only one to meet these needs but she is determined that as long as she has her health she will continue to do just that. However, she and her children share a great love for each other and they have learned that if they are to survive they all have to work together, and each child is doing their part to help sustain the family.

She intends to get a loan of 250,000= to invest in buying produce and selling in Cere-leno Market were she been doing the same though in small scale. She believes her biggest challenge will be the selling the goods when she is doing the LiA production work but she believes after getting the loan she will have the assistance of Min Olara(a lady who sits next to her stool in the market)as usual will be selling on her behalf with this she is sure her business will flourish and prosper. She believes she will earn 130,000Ushs as her monthly profit.

She plans to refund the loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget

Transport.....................25,000=

Beans.........................205,000=

off loading fee...............15,000=

Market due.....................3,500=

Feeding a lone way.............1,500=

Total..........................250,000Ushs

loans.use: buying produce

loans.name: Juana Inés

texts.es:
Juana is 36 and married. Her husband is a taxi driver and does not have a steady income. The have purchased a home, but the mortgage payments considerably reduce their income. To help her husband, Juana decided to start her own business and take advantage of her previous stylist studies. She opened her own beauty salon, offering her services first to neighbors and relatives, and now to a good clientele.

Juana would like to keep her business growing, and since she has many clients but few places for them to sit in her salon, she is asking for a $250 loan to purchase furniture and mirrors. These things will allow her to provide better service to her clients, and she will pay it back in just 3 months. Be a part of Juana's achievements and help her expand her business. She greatly appreciates your support.

Juana tiene 36 años de edad y está casada, su esposo es taxista y no obtiene un salario seguro, adquirieron su casa propia pero el pago de las hipotecas reducía considerablemente sus ingresos, para ayudar a su esposo Juana decidió iniciar su propio negocio, aprovechando sus estudios de estilista, abrió su salón de belleza ofreciendo sus servicios primero a vecinos y familiares, ahora ya tiene una buena clientela.

Juana desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y como sus clientes son muchos ya no se da abastos con los muebles que tiene en su local, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de muebles y espejos, que le servirán para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Juana y ayúdala a crecer con su negocio, ella agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Remodeling

Remodelación

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband was forced to seek employment out of the country and sends money every month to help with the family's most urgent needs. Maria was always involved in agriculture and is now working to prepare her land to plant citrus trees. She works from early in the morning with her children, and her main concern is the transport of water for irrigation purposes.

Maria's most urgent need is to have an irrigation well to water her crops and for this purpose she's requesting a loan in the amount of $875, to be repaid over a 6-month period. Her hopes are pinned on our help to secure this most vital element of this year's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una señora de 37 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos; por motivos de trabajo su esposo tuvo que viajar y establecerse fuera de su país y desde su lugar de residencia envía dinero para los gastos más urgentes de su familia mes a mes, María siempre estuvo ligado a la actividad agrícola, es por eso que ahora está llevando a cabo la preparación del terreno que utilizará para la siembra de diversos productos cítricos, ella trabaja desde muy temprano con sus hijos y su preocupación latente es por el traslado de agua para el riego de los cultivos; por ello su necesidad más urgente es contar con un pozo tubular que instalará bajo tierra a fin de otorgarle a su siembra el agua necesaria y para llevar a cabo este proyecto María solicita 875 dólares que devolverá en un lapso de 6 meses.Tiene depositada sus esperanzas en nosotros para poder contar con el vital elemento para la siembra de este año.

loans.use: To build a well for irrigation of her crops

loans.name: Ikah

texts.en: Ikah is 45 years old and married. She has a small shop which sells snacks, and a few household goods. She usually earns $10 per day with a small profit. Her husband has no fixed income. Ikah would like a loan of $125 (IDR 1,000,000) to buy more goods and complete her shop. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and expand her shop

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 28 year old man who lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. He is a very ambitious young man. Mustafa owns a workshop that services industriA. equipment. This is the fourth time Mustafa is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He is requesting $1200 to expand his business and open a new workshop.

loans.use: to open a new workshop

loans.name: Meda

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Meda M.. She is single with three children, ages 16, 19, and 22. In 2000 Meda established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James employs four workers in his brick-making business, which has been in operation for three years. Each of his workers can produce 500 bricks per day which he sells to retail customers, mainly to build their homes. He has had two previous loans that he has used to increase his workforce.

James 25 years old and is married with a six-month-old daughter. He also supports his 18-year old sister, who is still at school, as well as his 4-year-old nephew, who has just started school. His wife sells fruit that she buys from local farmers at a kiosk from their home. Some of the loan amount will be used to improve her business as well.

James hopes to grow his business and eventually buy some land to build a hostel to house locals students. His dream for his children is for them to finish school and further education, and find professions of their own.

loans.use: James is seeking a loan to enable him to employ two more workers in his brick-making business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina considers herself a loving, friendly and very hard-working person. She is married to Francisco Rodríguez Peralta who works as a security guard at a local restaurant. They have three children: Alondra Soley, aged 12, and a secondary student; Liliana Itzel aged 10 and at primary school and Anahi, aged 2.

She started her business because there was a time in which her husband was unable to find work and they had a lot of expenses, so that she put herself to work in any and every area, including cleaning houses. Later on their situation improved when her husband found a good job and they were even able to obtain a small social-interest house, which motivate her even more to establish a business in order to be able to cover all the household expenses.

Beginning in May 2004, as the woman she used to work for already used to give her used clothes in good condition which she would sell to her neighbours, she saw that it would be a good idea to begin to sell in the walking markets in nearby neighbourhoods. So she investigated where you could buy clothing in bulk and a neighbour contacted her with the name of someone in the town of Reynosa. This contact sends clothing packs to her when she needs stock.

Delfina is asking for a loan of $300 USD, which she will repay in 4 months in order to buy more clothes that she will be able to sell in the local markets and in this way increase her income.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Delfina se considera una persona amable, amigable y muy trabajadora. Está casada con el Sr. Francisco Rodríguez Peralta quien se desempeña como vigilante en un Restaurante de la localidad. Tienen 3 hijos Alondra Suley de 12 años, estudiante de Secundaria; Liliana Itzel de 10 años, estudiante de primaria y Anahí de 2 años.

Inició el negocio porque hubo una temporada en la cual su esposo no encontraba trabajo y tenían muchos gastos, fue por eso que se puso a trabajar en cualquier cosa, inclusive haciendo la limpieza en casas, pero después su situación mejoró cuando su esposo encontró un buen trabajo y hasta pudieron obtener una casita de interés social, razón que la motivó mas aún a poner su negocio para poder cubrir todos los gastos. Además deseaba obtener un ingreso extra para no depender totalmente de lo que le daba su esposo, y le gustan mucho las ventas por lo que empezó a vender ropa y zapatos de temporada.

Comenzó en Mayo de 2004, ya que la señora con la que trabajaba le regalaba ropa usada en buenas condiciones la cual vendía con vecinas de la colonia, y como vio que le iba bien empezó a ir a los mercados ambulantes de colonias cercanas a su casa y se puso a investigar donde podía comprar “pacas” de ropa y una vecina la contactó con una persona en la ciudad de Reynosa. Esta persona le envía las pacas cada vez que necesita.

Solicita un crédito por US $ 300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más ropa que pueda vender en los mercados de la localidad y de esta manera aumentar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate E. is a creative woman. Her creativity is seen in her skill, which is the designing of clothes. She acquired this skill by training. Kate is 37 years old, and she is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Kate needs a loan of $600 to buy more clothes, tailoring materials and provisions for sales. Kate has been borrowing form LAPO microfinance for 5 years. Kate needs the loan to enable her to increase her sales so as to meet with her increasing customer demands.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, tailoring materials and provisions for sales

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar S. is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan that has helped him expand and diversify his business. He purchased a second-hand refrigerator and was able to sell cold drinks to the public, especially during the summer. He generated a good income and purchased a desktop computer for keeping records for his business. Abubakar was also able to pay his distance-learning course in business management. With more income, he purchased a photocopier to provide photocopying services to schools around Kabala town. Abubakar now has many customers both for drinks and for photocopying services, but he cannot cope with the demand. He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000 to purchase one more photocopier and reams of A4 papers.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier and reams of A4 papers

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap V., 47, and her husband, Mr. Sary Ma, 42, who live on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in local school.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for over 20 years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her silk products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh, Mr. Sary drives a horse cart and is also a Khmer traditional musician. Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mor Anta

texts.fr:
Mor Anta S. is a young entrepreneur in computing services, the sale of cell phones, motorcycle taxi services, etc. He is asking for this loan to strengthen his working capital. With his business, Mor supports his family and has created two (2) jobs in his multiservice area situated in the Boucotte business district in Ziguinchor.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon

Ce jeune entrepreneur est dans les services: cyber, vente de téléphones portable, moto taxi etc Il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Avec ses activités Mor soutient sa famille et a créé deux (02) emplois dans son espace multiservices situé au quartier des affaires Boucotte de Ziguinchor

loans.use: For various services

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam V., 44, is a housewife. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for the family members. Her husband, Chan Thoeun, 46, has been a blacksmith since 1993 and is able to make $10 each day. This couple has five children, three of whom are students, one of whom is too young to go to school and one other is married and no longer lives at home. Mrs. Saom would like a loan to purchase more blacksmith tools for her husband. (Mr. Chan Thoeun is pictured because Soam is not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more blacksmith tools for her husband

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es uno de los hombres más trabajadores de su localidad, esta característica lo diferencia de los pobladores de la zona y lo hace un hombre altamente importante y respetado dentro de su comunidad.Visitamos la chacra donde cultiva maíz, donde se le encuentra gran parte del día, pero una de las dificultades, es la lejanía de su terreno, le toma horas de caminata para llegar hasta ahí, cuya ruta es muy conocida para don Esteban, pues la camina diariamente  para ir a trabajar.Esteban ahora  requiere de  una cantidad de dinero para comprar el abono y fertilizantes necesarios para su producción. Espera de tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Esteban is one of the most hard-working men in the area where he lives, which differentiates him from other local residents and makes him stand our as a well-respected and very important member of the community. We visited the plot of land where he grows corn and where he spends most of his day. The problem is that his plot is very far from where he lives, and Esteban spends several hours each day walking to and from his farm, a route he know very well by now.

Esteban is requesting this loan to buy the fertilizers he needs for his farm. He hopes you will support him.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn farm

loans.name: Shindana's Group

texts.en:
Shandana has been selling firewood and kerosene in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works for 12 hours everyday and earns a profit of approximately $70 each month. Having previously taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid on time, Shandana is requesting her second loan in order to open a new business as a tailor to have in addition to her fuel business.

Shandana, 40 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 20, will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanashawa and Semem. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To open a tailoring business.

loans.name: Kurbonkhon

texts.en:
A. Kurbonkhon is a widow living in Shahrituz, Tajikistan with her daughter and grandson. Kurbonkhon runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the local market. She has been involved in this trade for 15 years. 

She recently moved her vending facility to a different location, which has promoted an increase in her sales. Kurbonkhon has many loyal customers. She is very friendly and amiable with each client, thus giving her a unique talent of attracting new customers. Kurbonkhon purchases clothing wholesale every week. She is hoping to use the loan of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD) to purchase winter clothing for women. She hopes to see her venture grow big enough so that she can afford to buy a new vending facility in the future.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for her business, in the hopes of later purchasing a new vending facility in the future

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s EL MAMON viven en la comarca buena vista  en la zona rural de Nindiri,   a pesar de ser humilde y de escasos recursos este grupo ha salido adelante por ser personas bien emprendedoras y luchadoras sus negocios son ambulantes en los barrios de Masaya y Nindiri 
Doña María vende ropa usada ella comenzó comprando ropa por unidad, con los créditos que adim les ha proporcionados ahora compra por pacas las que le generan mayores ganancias.
Doña Linda vende productos plásticos del hogar ella compra en el mercado oriental por docenas y los coloca en las pulperías y barrios de nindiri.   Sus mayores sueños es poder remodelar su casa ella lo va a lograr ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y de adim atreves de los créditos
Este g/s ha sido capacitado por desarrollo empresarial en los temas de autoestima y manejo del negocio, para lo cual se siente bien agradecidas con adim, y prometen no quedar mal para gozar de sus beneficios.
texts.en:
The members of the group El Mamon ** live in the Buena Vista region in the rural area of Nindiri. Despite being of humble and limited resources, this group has succeeded by being hardworking and enterprising people with their traveling businesses in the Masaya and Nindiri neighborhoods. Mrs. Maria sells used clothing. She began by buying clothing by the piece; with loans from Kiva partner ADIM, she now buys packages of clothing, which generates better profits. Mrs. Linda sells plastic products for the home, which she buys by the dozen at the oriental market and sells in the local stores in the Nindiri neighborhoods. Her greatest dream is to be able to remodel her home. She is going to do this with the help of her husband and Kiva partner ADIM's loans. This group is headed for success in their businesses because of their self-esteem and business management. They are very grateful to Kiva partner ADIM, and they promise they will not do badly so that they can enjoy the benefits. ** Translator's note: Mamon is a type of green fruit known to Nicaragua. It looks something like a lime.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses to serve more customers

loans.name: Naziran Begum M.yaar Group

texts.en:
Naziran begum baji is 54 years old widow. Her husband died from a heart attack. For 50 years, she has been a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son has been selling bangles in a Pakpattan bazaar for the past 10 years. The other children are receiving an education from a school that is located near their house. Naziran baji is a very hardworking lady whom sews clothes and bears the education expenses of her children. Her children are very proud of her. This encouragement and affection gives her the strength to continue. She is applying for a loan to buy bangles and artificial jewelry sets to help grow her son’s business.

Naziran begumis is the group leader of some more women from her locality. Shamim baji, Parveen baji and Tahira kalsoom baji each are requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khursheed begum baji is requesting a loan to buy bleach and washing powder for her laundry business. Naseem akhtar baji is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles and jewelry sets to sell

loans.name: Nicholas Kweku

texts.en: Nicholas Kweku D. sells maize at the Nyankumasi market near Cape Coast. Nicholas Kweku has completed an education up to the junior high. He is married and has four dependants. His wife is a trader. Nicholas Kweku has been selling maize for about three years now. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to increase his capital which will enable him to increase the quantities of maize he sells. Nicholas Kweku hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest in the expansion of his trade in maize.

loans.use: To increase his capital to enable him to increase the quantities of maize he sells

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 40-year-old widower with four children, living in the Katarmaya municipality of Mount Lebanon Governate.  He has been in construction work for more than 23 years.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy wood to improve the quality of his construction projects.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Mrs. Men Meach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of sixteen members and is located in Peam Sala Village, Kandal province.

Mrs. Men M. is 64 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. She owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice for a living. Aside from farming, she sells fish. Her husband, Mr. Savoeurn Bork, helps her in both business activities. Her fish business is going well and she would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She hopes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanie S. is engaged in firewood vending to earn a living. Bundles of firewood are displayed along the road. Her customers are the passersby, local residents and carenderias (restaurants).

Mrs. S. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 64-years-old and separated with three married children. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since January, 2005, and is requesting a loan for additional capital and to build a shed for the firewood.

Mrs. S.’s heart's desire is to have a decent life with money for her old age and to be able to help send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for a firewood business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Faustina es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Faustina viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Faustina hace papa seca (papa sancochada y secado al sol, que es utilizado para la preparación de comida) que vende a intermediarios.
Faustina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Faustina sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Faustina is married, is 43 years old and has 3 children. Faustina travels to the markets where she buys cereals, potatoes and products that she sells in the supply markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Faustina makes dehydrated potatoes (parboiled and sundried, which is used in food preparation) that she sells to intermediaries. Faustina needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Faustina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Matel

texts.fr: MATEL B. est une jeune femme née à thies le 18 AOUT 1982;elle est mariée et gère une boutique aux parcelles assainies;avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
Matel B. is a young woman who was born in Thies on August 18, 1982. She is married and runs a little shop in the Parcelles Assainies district. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of merchandise so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Liney

texts.en:
Liney S. is from the village of Tinaclaan in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 29 years old. Liney is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Liney owns and operates a construction business. Liney has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liney joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liney has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase materials that she needs for her business. Liney is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be Liney's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory use as working capital

loans.name: Leonor Elija

texts.pt:
Leonor Elija C. nasceu em Gaza há 40 anos, viúva e mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade e todos vivendo fora de boane. Sustenta três netos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 12 anos que vivem com ela na mesma casa. Não concluiu a primeira classe, porque muito cedo contraiu problemas de vista. Chamou de doença espiritual! E, muito cedo foi à formação de cinco anos como curandeira.
 
Saiu de gaza na altura da guerra civil sozinha porque os filhos já se encontravam no Maputo, viveu com eles na mesma casa, e mais tarde arranjou um terreno e construiu a sua própria casa em Boane.

Leonor é negociante há três anos e dona do negocio onde trabalha cerca de 7 a 12 horas por dia. Não tem empregado e pessoalmente dedica se a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, principalmente o amendoim que compra a 1.750,00MT o saco de 50 kg e vende a 50,00MT o kilo.
Consegue um rendimento diário de 700,00MT que os aplica nas despesas correntes e poupa algum dinheiro num banco comercial, onde tem a conta.

Leonor já levantou cinco empréstimos com a Hluvuku-Adsema todos para comercio e com este sexto de 15.00,00MT é para aumentar o volume da mercadoria assim como responder a demanda dos produtos.

Ouviu falar da hluvuku através das amigas. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de  2.500,00MT; 5.000,00MT; 8.000,00MT; 15.000,00, e 10.000,00MT.
No futuro, Leonor, pretende mobiliar a sua casa e para tal conta com mais empréstimos logo que terminar de pagar.
texts.en:
Leonor Elija C. was born in Gaza 40 years ago. She is a widow and the mother of three children who are all now adults and have moved away from Boane. She supports three grandchildren between the ages of 8 and 12, who live with her in her house. She didn't finish first grade because she had problems with her vision from a young age. It was said to be a spiritual malady. As a young girl she trained for five years as a traditional healer. She left Gaza during the civil war all by herself because her children were already living in Maputo. She lived in their house with them, and later acquired some land and built her own house in Boane. Leonor has been a businesswoman for three years and owns a business where she works 7 to 12 hours a day. She doesn't have any employees, and works on her own to sell staple goods, mainly peanuts, which she buys in 50-kg bags for 1750 meticals and sells for 50 meticals a kilo. She earns about 700 meticals a day, which she uses to cover living expenses, and then saves some money in a commercial bank, where she has an account. Leonor has already received five loans from Hluvuku-Adsema, all for her business. She will use this sixth loan of 15,000 meticals to increase her stock so she can respond to demand for goods. She heard about Hluvuku through friends. Her previous loans were in the amounts of 2500, 5000, 8000, 15,000, and 10,000 meticals. In the future, Leonor wants to furnish her house, and will request additional loans for that purpose once this one has been paid off.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Ural

texts.en: K. Ural was born in 1956 in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. He has higher education and is a school teacher by professional background but for the last 12 years he has been engaged in the family business. Ural grows vegetables and sells them in the local bazaar. His wife and children help him in the vegetable garden to do the required work. Ural grows potatoes, carrots, cabbages, onions and beets. Ural applies to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 1,000 STJ for 2 months to open another trade outlet in another local bazaar. It will permit him to increase his business turnover. He has a good reputation as a MicroInvest client and he has not had any delays in previous loan repayments. About MLF MicroInvest MLF MicroInvest is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. A following step of its development sees MLF MicroInvest’s transformation into a micro-loan deposit-taking organization. Therefore, in October 2008, MLF MicroInvest together with LLC Frontiers have founded the limited liability company micro-loan deposit-taking organization “Arvand”. Arvand, being an assignee of MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To open another trade outlet

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli B. is 44 years old and mother to four; two girls and two boys. She is happily married to Rodel, 49 years old and a tricycle driver. She is full of determination to cut the bonds of poverty that hinder her way and her family's to success. She lives in Angono, Rizal province in the Philippines.

With her desire to look for a greener living, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, just recently with a bagful of hope to have access to capital to start a business. Her first loan was invested in a sari-sari Store (general store) as her primary business and part was used in her secondary business: hog raising.

Her businesses went well and seem to bring her enough income for their living. Now on her 2nd loan, she proposes the amount of 10,000 pesos to pay for sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, canned goods and groceries for her store. And again, a portion of her loan will be used as additional capital for her secondary business: hog raising.

Araceli's aspiration in life is to be able to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She dreams also of expanding her business someday.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries for her store

loans.name: Jogilyn

texts.en:
Jogilyn manages a general store business, located in front of their house, which is in Barangay Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. She wanted to expand her business by acquiring the additional working capital of PHP 6,000.00 from Kiva lenders. She plans to use the loan to purchase grocery items to sell, so as to maximize her profit and be able to provide her children with enough financial support for their education. She is very determined and is working hard for the development of her business.

Jogilyn believes that “when one works hard, he or she can fulfill his or her dreams.” Her dream for her children is to give them a complete education that will lead them to a better life and gainful employment. She is 40 years old, and she and her husband Venarcio are blessed with four children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D., 65 ans, mariée est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE-2-PONT depuis 8 ans. Elle n'a pas d'enfant en charge, mais pour subvenir à ses besoins primaires elle développe une activité de petit commerce. L'objectif de son crédit est de commercialiser des produits halieutiques au niveau du marché de son quartier. Elle remboursera son prêt globalement en une seule fois à l'échéance au bout de 6 mois.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 65 years old and she has been a member of the Community Bank "Lyndiane-2-Pont". She has no children in her care but in order to cover her basic needs she manages a small business. The loan will be invested in the sale of seafood in the local market. She will repay the loan in full in one installment at the end of the 6-month term.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her small business

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is 42 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells tubers of yams to make a living in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar C.  vive en casa en Anticretico, en la zona  Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, y sus dos hijos.
El señor Edgar es chofer de transporte público y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación del motor del vehiculo que es su herramienta de trabajo y así poder continuar con sus actividades.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Edgar C. lives in a house by an arrangement called “anticretico” (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). He lives with his wife and two children in the Villa Exaltación area of the city of El Alto. Edgar is a public transportation driver. His wife devotes herself to the house work. The loan he is asking for is to repair the motor on his vehicle, which is his work tool. This way he will be able to continue with his activities. This is the second time he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the motor on his public transportation vehicle

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 37 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles and sells hair extensions to her clients within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Hueyapan Group

texts.es:
HUEYAPAN(SAN ANDRéS HUEYAPAN)
      

     La localidad de Hueyapan (San Andrés Hueyapan) está situado en el Municipio de Tétela del Volcán (en el Estado de Morelos). Tiene 6014 habitantes. Hueyapan (San Andrés Hueyapan) está a 2340 metros de altitud, el significado de Hueyapan en náhuatl significa: (Hueyi : mucha  Atlat: Agua, "LUGAR DE MUCHA AGUA"
 
     Bueno en esta ocasión les hablare del grupo Hueyapan que llevan el nombre de su misma localidad, este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas las cuales son:  CELIA M. F., JUSTINA A. S., YOLANDA R. M., YOLANDA A. CORTES Y HERLINDA P. A. con la ultima de las acreditadas que se hace mención es de quien vamos hablar.
  No tiene conocimiento de que o cual es el significado de su nombre,  la edad es de 48 años, curso hasta 6 años de primaria en la escuela que lleva por nombre actualmente "CARLOS A. CARRILLO" de su misma localidad hueyapan.

     La Sra. Herlinda solicito un crédito a Fundacion Realidad, AC. Para poder comprar hilos por mayoreo de distintos colores, comprar también harina de trigo, lo anterior para la elaboración de sus rebozos y gabanes, que es la actividad que la sra. realiza.
Se preguntaran ustedes que tiene que ver la harina con la elaboración de los rebozos.

     Bueno la manera como la sra. prepara el hilo es de la siguiente manera: primero pone a hervir agua y le vierte la harina de trigo, cuando la mezcla adquiere la consistencia de atole, lo retira de lo caliente y lo pone a enfriar, al ya estar frió,  vierte el hilo tipo lana,  lo deja aproximadamente 30 minutos dentro, para que el hilo se ablande y no tenga una consistencia rígida para posteriormente ella poder manipularlo con mas facilidad al momento de estar  hilándolo,  o tejiendo en otras palabras.
 


una vez que lo saca de su mezcla lo exprime y  lo coloca en su tejedor y comienza a tejer el gabán o rebozo, en este proceso de tejido se tarda un día completo para terminarlo una vez terminado lo lava con jabón de pasta neutro y lo pone a secar al sol con esto termina el proceso de la elaboración de un gabán hecho por manos artesanas así sucesivamente los va elaborando cada uno. 


También se dedica al cultivo de flor de temporada por ejemplo,  ahora en este mes de Noviembre sembró flor de  CEMPAZUCHITL por las festividades del día de  MUERTOS y otras F. mas de temporada.

     Ella se integro al grupo de HUEYAPAN en el segundo ciclo,  actualmente es su segundo crédito con el grupo, ella fue invitada  por la Sra. Yolanda R. M.,  la cual es la representante del grupo,  la sra. Yolanda se dedica a la  cosecha de fruta de temporada, tiene huertos de:(MANZANA, PERA, HIGOS, AGUACATE, CAJINICUILES ESTAS SON UNA COMO BAHINAS QUE LLEVAN POR DENTRO UNA ESPECIE DE ALGODINCITOS DULCES, LES PUEDO DECIR QUE SON MUY SABROSOS, TEJOCOTE DE TEMPORADA, la SRA. CELIA M. es mamá soltera: Es la mas relajienta del grupo, ella se dedica a la crianza de borregos y también tiene una pequeña huerta de frutas de temporada, Doña YOLANDA A. es la integrante mas penosa, no quería tomarse la foto con el grupo por que dice que no quieren la vean por Internet sus hijos allá en el norte, la Sra. JUSTINA A., ella cuenta con una pequeña papelería y venta de útiles escolares.

     Bueno regresando con la Sra. Herlinda que es de  quien hablamos, ella tiene su negocio en su propia casa de hecho sus clientes llegan hasta su domicilio para comprarle los rebozos y gabanes, y por su cuenta ella va a las plazas mas cercanas a su comunidad a venderlos,  ya que aun no cuenta con un local establecido donde pudiera exhibir su producto.

 Esta actividad la aprendió a la edad de 10 años, su abuelita materna fue la que le enseño a elaborarlos.

 Sus ingresos son buenos   les gana el 10% o 15% por cada prenda que vende pero no es su único ingreso, aparte de ello también cuenta con una huerta de árboles frutales, crianza y venta de borregos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta.
 
    Ella realiza su actividad en su propia casa en SAN ANDRES (HUEYAPAN), le es de mucha importancia seguir dedicándose a esta actividad por que sabe que son  muy pocos artesanos la que la realizan aquí en el estado de Morelos aunado a que es herencia de su abuelita.

  La parte que mas le gusta de este trabajo es porque sabe que son indispensables estas prendas en su comunidad debido a que casi todo el año hace mucho frió y que de ello ha sacado adelante a sus hijos más pequeños.

     Ella en su actividad y en su comunidad no tiene competencia, aunque sí ha enfrentado algunos desafíos; como los costosos precios de la materia prima y el tener que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Cuautla para adquirirlos.

  Doña Herlinda,  conforme va recibiendo sus créditos lo va invirtiendo de inmediato, ella en este ciclo solicito la cantidad de $ 5,000.00 pesos, para la compra del material y como ella trabaja sola no se da abasto para  elaborar mas producto,  pues se ve apurada y necesita contratar a mas gente para producir más de lo que ella hace y quiere a darse a conocer con algún buen comprador de mayoreo y hacer crecer su negocio.


La Sra. Herlinda es viuda desde hace un año, tiene 6 hijos, el hijo mayor se llama Lorenzo, el se fue a estados unidos desde hace 4 años, el segundo se llama Genaro el es empleado de un restaurante, el tercero se llama Alejandro el vive con doña herlinda y le ayuda en casa y se dedica al campo, su única hija se llama Judith es una señorita de 18 años y ella trabaja como empleada en la ciudad de Cuernavaca y por ultimo los 2 pequeñitos que son: Julio que va en segundo de Secundaria y Alberto en 4º. De Primaria ellos conforman su familia actualmente.

Ella hace mención sobre su parte del pueblo, me dice que es un clima muy frió pero la tierra en la que cultivan es muy generosa con ellos, por que todo el año sus árboles frutales le dan mucha producción. Su casa esta construida con block de adobe de una sola planta con 3 cuartos y techo de lámina de asbesto. De antemano su negocio le a ayudado mucho desde que su esposo falleció por que de ello se a mantenido y a salido adelante.

Sus planes de esperanza que ella tiene es que en un futuro pueda exportar sus prendas y tener un buen comprador para darse a conocer su artesanía.

Ella esta feliz y contenta por la oportunidad que le dieron de ser parte de Fundacion Realidad, A.C. como acreditada.

    “Agradecimiento por el préstamo que adquirió y por confiar en ella y agradecerles  por existir Fundacion Realidad,  gracias por  ayudar  y comprender la situación de cada uno de los integrantes y de cada localidad a la que visitan y forman grupos para apoyarlo para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de nuestras familias,  muchas,  muchas gracias por ser una micro financiera de apoyo y ayuda.”
texts.en:
The community of San Andrés Hueyapan (or Hueyapan, for short) is situated in the town of Tétela del Volcán in the State of Morelos. It has 6014 inhabitants. Hueyapan is 2340 meters above sea level. In the Nahuatl language, Hueyapan means “place of abundant water” (Hueyi = “many”; Atlat = “water”).

The Hueyapan Group bears the same name as this location. It is composed of 5 members: Celia M. F., Justina A. Sardiñas, Yolanda R. M., Yolanda A. Cortex, and Herlinda P. A.. We will focus on Herlinda’s story.

Not knowing what her name means, Herlinda is 48 years old. She completed her education through the 6th grade at the Carlos A. Carillo School in Hueyapan. Sra. Herlinda requested a loan from Fundación Realidad in order to buy yarn in different colors at wholesale. In addition, she will purchase wheat flour to use in making shawls. You’re probably wondering what flour has to do with producing shawls. Herlinda prepares the yarn in the following manner:

First, she combines flour and boiled water. When the mixture becomes the consistency of porridge, she allows it to cool before adding the woolen yarn. She lets the yarn soak in the flour mixture for 30 minutes or until it no longer has a rigid consistency. This process makes the yarn easier to manipulate for weaving. After the yarn is finished soaking, any excess mixture is squeezed out before the yarn is washed with neutral soap and set out to dry in the sun. The entire process takes a full day and prepares the yarn for use in handicrafts.

In addition, Herlinda also grows seasonal flowers. For example, in the month of November, the cempazuchitl (a miniature yellow marigold, an Aztec symbol of death) is planted for the “Día de los Muertos” celebrations.

Herlinda recently joined the Hueyapan Group, which is now in its second loan cycle. She was invited by Yolanda R. M., the group leader. Sra. Yolanda has several orchards where she grows seasonal fruits such as apples, pears, figs, avocados, cajinicuiles (a tropical fruit with flesh that looks like cotton candy), and tejocote. Sra. Celia M. is a single mother and the most relaxed member of the group. She raises sheep and also has a small fruit orchard. Doña Yolanda Argon is the most guarded member. She did not want her photograph taken so that her children would not see her on the Internet. Sra. Justina A. manages a small stationery shop where she sells school supplies.

Getting back to Herlinda’s story, she operates a home business in Hueyapan where her customers visit her to purchase shawls and overcoats. She says she also travels to other venues closest to her community to sell her products since she does not have an established vending location. Herlinda started weaving when she was 10 years old and learned this skill from her maternal grandmother.

Herlinda makes a profit of 10 to 15 percent from each garment that she sells. Apart from her agricultural activities, this is her only source of income. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic person. This business is very important to her because it represents an extension of her grandmother’s heritage. She faces very little competition since there are few craftspeople who work in the State of Morelos. However, Herlinda still faces some challenges. The cost of materials is high and she must travel constantly to the city of Cuautla to acquire them. She is proud of the fact that her garments are indispensable in her community because of the cold that exists for most of the year. Another benefit of the business is that it has enabled her younger children to get ahead.

Doña Herlinda will immediately apply her loan of 5000 MXN toward the purchase of materials. Since she works alone, she cannot generate more items on her own. She feels rushed and needs to hire more people to produce more garments. Herlinda hopes to come into contact with a good wholesale buyer so that she can grow her business.

She became a widow last year. Herlinda’s six children are as follows: - Lorenzo is her eldest son and left for the United States four years ago. - Her second child Genaro is employed at a restaurant. - Her third child Alejandro lives with her and helps around the house and on the farm. - Her only daughter is named Judith. She is 18 years old and works as a clerk in the city of Cuernevaca. - Julio attends high school. - Alberto is in fourth grade.

In her part of town, the climate is very cold but the land is fertile and enables their fruit trees to be productive. Her single floor house is made of adobe blocks. It has three rooms and an asbestos sheet roof. Now that her husband has passed away, her business enables her to maintain her lifestyle and move forward. In the future, she hopes to export her garments and become connected with a good buyer that specializes in handicrafts.

Herlinda says she is satisfied and happy to be given the opportunity to be part of Fundación Realidad. She says, “We are grateful that Fundación Realidad exists and for the loan that was provided to us. They take the time to understand the situation of each member and the communities in which they live. By forming support groups, we are able to help each other improve the quality of life for our families. We are very, very thankful that Fundación Realidad is a microfinance institute that provides both support services and financial assistance.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn in different colors & kilos of flour

loans.name: Ritchelyn

texts.en: Ritchelyn T. is from Pagadian City. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ritchelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ritchelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ritchelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: La Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Maura lives in Samana, the Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her loan group, La Fe (Faith), and her story is typical of the people in her group.

Maura runs a small business selling clothing to friends and neighbors. She is a single mother with one child, a boy, and runs her business out of her home, which she rents. Maura plans to use this loan, her third with Esperanza International, to buy new shoes and perfume to sell to her customers. She also hopes to hire an employee to help her expand her customer base and increase sales. Life in Samana can be difficult, with little access to potable water, reliable electricity and medical care. With her loan, she hopes to improve her living conditions, and will also receive health care from Esperanza International.

With her increasing profits, Maura hopes to one day move her business out of her home and into its own location. She does not like having to work in her home, and would like to create more space for her family. Maura also hopes to stop renting and have her own home one day, a place where her son can study and get a good education. She would like him to become a person who can overcome hardships and be a professional in whatever field he chooses. Thank you for lending to Maura and La Fe group!

loans.use: To buy more shoes and perfume to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio es casado con 2 hijas estudiantes, domiciliado en la ciudad de Piribebuy en el barrio San Blas.
El Sr. Julio aprendió el oficio trabajando como ayudante en un taller de su barrio, luego con la ayuda de su padre se independizo y emprendió su propio taller en un terreno que le facilito su padre, empezó con las mínimas herramientas, gracias al esfuerzo y la ayuda de su padre fue incorporando mas herramientas.   

El Sr. Julio posee hoy una gomería con todas las herramientas necesarias para el rubro, gracias a los buenos servicios que ofrece, tiene una clientela totalmente formada con alta fidelidad.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de cubiertas para su posterior venta al público, con ello generaría más ingresos en la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Julio is married with two daughters and lives in the San Blas neighborhood in the city of Piribebuy. Julio learned his skills (as a mechanic) by working in a neighborhood garage and later, with the help of his father, he started his own garage on land that his father provided. He started out with a few tools, but with his father’s assistance, he has been able to add more tools to his business. Julio now owns a tire shop with all the necessary tools. He has an established set of customers, thanks to the good services he provides. He is asking for this loan in order to buy tires to resell, so that he can increase his family income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for resale

loans.name: Levie's Group

texts.en:
Levie S. is from the village of Pilitan. She is 23 years old. Levie is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Levie S..

Levie is married. To make a living, Levie runs a vegetable store in her local community. Levie earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Levie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Levie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka and has a small business selling souvenirs. Victoria has several vending locations at the markets and in the local mall called “Tsentralnyi” (“Central”). Presently, Victoria has about 20,000 grivnyas in capital turnover. Her net profit amounts to 6,500 grivnyas.

Victoria is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and diversify its assortment. She has been in this business for 8 years. She knows how to please her customers and meet their needs. Victoria enjoys working with people and this type of merchandise. She is hoping to see her business expand and flourish in the future as well.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Baringin Sur, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Teresita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shyrel

texts.en:
Shyrel M. is from the village of Zone 2 Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Shyrel is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Shyrel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and dry goods in the local community. Shyrel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Shyrel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shyrel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shyrel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Carol owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp with the help of her husband in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carol is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Catarina's Group

texts.es: Las señoras Trabajadoras que se han dedicado a la compra y venta de ropa tipica  ellas  han tenido a bien de trabajar durante 5 años atras ya que con esto se han mantenido y han mantenido a sus hijos y familia salen  a vender  cortes y guipiles  a otras aldeas  aledaños para ganar el sustento, y para tener màs surtido la mercaderia acuden a la Asociacicòn ASDIR para incrementar sus capitales y asi sobre salir avante a la competencia y generar màs ganancia y podran estar en otro nivel de vida  de ellas y de sus familia.
texts.en:
The Lady Workers have worked buying and selling traditional clothing. They have had to work hard during the last 5 years so that they could support themselves and their families and children. They travel to sell traditional blouses and skirts to other nearby villages to earn their upkeep. In order to have more stocked merchandise they have come to the ASDIR association to ask for a loan to increase their capital so that they can get ahead of the competition and generate more earnings and be able to be at a higher level for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Sergio Abelardo

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio, es un cliente  que trabaja con crédito en Emprender desde el año 2006,, se encuentra en su sexta secuencia, él trabaja de día en una Empresa constructora por las lomas de Achumani, realizando sevicio de transporte, llevando material y otros artículos que la empresa solicita, recibiendo un salario quincenal de aproximadamente  por la noche trabaja en su taxi que esta afiliado a taxi trufi 1, Sergio esta casado, su esposa trabaja también en dicha empresa de construcción como control del personal, ambos son personas jóvenes y tienen un hijo pequeño que lo dejan al cuidado de su abuela paterna.los créditos que saca de la Institución son generalmente pequeños y para mantención del transporte, como en esta secuencia él solicito un credito para la renovacion de su licencia de conducir y tambien para la compra de llantas, ellos viven por la zona de Chasquipampa en la casa de la mamá de Sergio. En estos años el respondió con responsabilidad los pagos de sus créditos y esperamos que en este crédito trabaje de la misma manera. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio is a client who has been working with Emprender since 2006. He is currently in his sixth loan cycle. During the day, Sergio works for a construction company in the hills of Achumani. He is responsible for transporting materials and other items that his company has requested. Sergio receives a salary every two weeks and works just about every night driving a “trufi” (a taxi that travels a set destination) along Route #1. His wife also works for the same construction company in human resources. Both of them are young and have a small child who is looked after by Sergio’s mother.

The loans he receives from Emprender are generally small and used for vehicle maintenance. For this loan cycle, the funds he requested will be used to pay for his driver’s license renewal as well as purchase tires. Sergio and his family live at his mother’s house in the Chasquipampa district. Over the years, he has handled his payments responsibly and expects to do the same with this loan. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & pay for his driver's license renewal

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Doña Olivia V. Labora para Loteria Nacional  tien 15 años de laborar como Glosador y este es el segundo préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL, el anterior lo solicito para mejorar su vivienda y este lo va a utilizar para pagar una deuda de tarjetas de crédito que tiene y le esta causando problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Doña Olivia V.
