Labora para Loteria Nacional tien 15 años de laborar como Glosador y este es el segundo préstamo que trabaja con CEPRODEL, el anterior lo solicito para mejorar su vivienda y este lo va a utilizar para pagar una deuda de tarjetas de crédito que tiene y le esta causando problemas de salud.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de materialesde construccion

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina ,de 55 años, es madre soltera y tiene seis hijos. Reside en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.Recuerda muy bien que tenía pocos recursos económicos, y solo le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, además tenía una pequeña parcela, en donde producía y comercializaba cacao , pero sus ventas no le generaban buenas ganancias. En la actualidad  tiene un terreno de cultivo, en donde produce cacao y café en grandes cantidades, y ya tiene una buena cantidad  de clientes con los que trabaja de manera conjunta, es por esta razón que se  que se siente satisfecha con su trabajo.Además ya lleva trabajando 39 años de manera constante y con buenos resultados, para lograrlo  siempre tuvo la ayuda de sus hijos y ocasionalmente sus peones, en temporada de cosecha. Normalmente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde . Generalmente comercializa  sus productos en los centros de acopio de sus comunidad, no obstante, para más adelante anhela  ampliar su terreno de cultivo con la finalidad de satisfacer a sus clientes.Este es su segundo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente  con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal.Justina invertirá el dinero solicitado  para comprar fertilizantes,  y otra parte la destinará para  cubrir los constantes gastos universitarios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Justina is a single mother and has six children. She lives in her own home, in a town located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle. She knows very well that she has few economic resources and that she only uses them to pay for necessities. She also had a small plot of land, on which she cultivated cocoa, but her sales of cocoa did not generate a good income. Now she has a plot where she cultivates cocoa and coffee in large quantities, and she also has a good number of customers among those she works with. For this reason, she is satisfied with her work. She has been working steadily for 39 years with good results; to achieve this, she always had the help of her children, and occasionally the help of farm workers, at harvest time. She normally works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Generally, she sells her products at the street market of her community. Nevertheless, for the future, she yearns to expand her cultivated land with the goal of satisfying her customers. This is her second loan from MFP (local lending institution), and she is committed to making timely repayments. She is also satisfied with the work of her communal bank. Justina will invest the loan proceeds in fertilizers and will also use part of the proceeds to pay the ongoing university expenses of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pay the university expenses of her son

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joseph K., an entrepreneur in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Joseph has applied for a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand his business. In his shop, right at the center of town, Joseph sells spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles.  

Joseph has been doing business for more than ten years now. However, his business has not been growing as planned due to the lack of sufficient capital. Joseph therefore applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to boost his business. With the help of this loan, he will buy spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles wholesale to add to his current inventory. In this way, Joseph expects to make better sales, more profit and consequently improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for both motorbikes and bicycles wholesale for resale

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 30 years old and married with a one-year-old child.  Ezechiel is commonly known for his business of selling clothes for women and this is his fifth successful year in this business.  The hours of his business are from 9 am to 6 pm every day.

Ezechiel is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing additional styles of clothes to sell.  With this loan, Ezechiel will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase of additional styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel C. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. He is 35 years old. Samuel is married and has three school-aged children. Samuel owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services to local community members. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Samuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

Samuel is now requesting his third loan from HSPFI, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Thoang

texts.en:
Thoang L., 59, is widowed and resides with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated area in the country.

L. is a hair dresser, earning an income of USD 2 per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more hairdressing tools to improve her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida L. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Aida is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children who are now between 20 and 35 years of age. Two of the children attend school. Alice has been operating and managing her mixed farm for the last 35 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She has four employees. Her farm produces coffee, tea, maize and sukumawiki (greens). She sells her coffee to Kenyenya machine and tea to Eberege factory in Kisii town.

Alice has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her get enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. She hopes that in five years time, she will have expanded her farming activities and improved her income.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of market for her vegetables. She is thankful to Juhudi for addressing the needs of the people.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Nareiyio

texts.en:
Mary Nareiyio K. is 63 years old. She is married to K. and the mother of seven children. She operates a retail shop that she has been running for the last three years in the Ololulunga shopping center in the outskirts of Narok Town.

She learned about KADET Ltd. from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her second loan. She is planning to increase her shop's stock by buying more soft drinks, especially during this sunny season, as she knows their demand will be high. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. 

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and be running the shop at her own premises.
 
Mary also believes she is hard-working and she only needs resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: increasing stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr R. is 36 years old and lives with his family in Kant city in Kyrgyzstan. His wife earns money by working as a charwoman in the Almaluu school. The couple has three children, the daughter already a schoolgirl, the others at home. 

Fifteen years ago his wife’s parents presented them with a calf as a wedding gift. Since then the family has been breeding cattle.  Aleksandr also gets extra money by selling 7-8 liters of milk daily. Out of profits from their regularly increasing cattle stock, the family has managed to obtain a house and necessary household appliances. The total sum of profits is around $46 per month.

The family needs additional money for purchasing a cow and fattening it. For this purpose Aleksamdr wants to take out a loan. In the future he is planning to increase his cattle stock up to five cows.     

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick K. K. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children. Five of his children are currently in school. Fredrick has a business of a retail shop, which he has had for 7 years. He owns rental houses as well.

To help expand his business, Fredrick has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more items like soap and sugar. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fredrick hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Fredrick hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy and stock more items like soap and sugar.

loans.name: Lucy Wambui

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Olkalou since the year 1999.  She is 54 years old, married to James Ngethe, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to plant more potatoes in her farm.

In future, she plans to start other businesses in town and she is currently thinking of opening a clothes shop.

loans.use: To plant potatoes in her farm

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall S. is a villager in Krabau village in Kandal province and she was born in 1977. She and her husband, Mr. Ven Tang, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve this field, Mrs. Phall S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. This couple has three children, two of whom are studying in school, and the other is two years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Jean is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jean is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jean from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase a cow to raise for sale

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Naciones Unidas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ellas es Emma Rosa M. de 53 años tiene una tortillería y venta de frijoles cocidos desde hace 4 años la cual inicio con 200 pesos. Ella desea superarse y salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yelba de la Asunción L. quien vende comida desde hace 4 años y Pedro José E. quien tiene una repostería.
texts.en: The group Naciones Unidas (United Nations) is made up of three energetic, hardworking and enterprising people.  One of these is Emma Rosa M., 53, who for the past 4 years has had a tortilla shop.  where she also sells cooked beans, a business that she started with 200 pesos.  She wants to improve and get ahead.  The other members of the group are Yelba de la Asunción L.  who has sold food for the past 4 years, and Pedro José E.  who has a bakery.

loans.use: Corn, beans and firewood

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 28 años, convive con Wilder, de 32 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Vigner, de 9 y Abel de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La agricultura, es su principal actividad; los productos que abona y cuida constantemente son: papa y olluco (tubérculos). Los constantes cuidados que le brinda hacen que sus cosechas, sean buenas y productivas, tanto así, que los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado central de su localidad ya la conocen y constantemente esperan la temporada de cosecha de sus cultivos. Pero de la misma manera como cuida de sus sembríos, Mery, también se dedica al negocio de compra  y venta de carne de carnero, el que comercializa una vez a la semana en el mercado. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a ello, por eso más adelante está pensando implantar, el pequeño espacio que tienen en el mercado para vender. Este es el  octavo crédito con MFP, y como socia activa de su banco comunal, se compromete en las constantes actividades que desarrollan en cada reunión. Con el monto que solicita comprará 5 sacos de abono orgánico, asimismo con el dinero que resta, comprará varios kilos de carne que venderá en este mes, que es el de mayor acogida.
texts.en: Mery, 28 years old, lives with Wilder who is 32 years old. They have two children: Vigner, 9 years old and Abel, 4 years old. As a family unit they live in their own house located in Ricrican. They work in agriculture. The products that they fertilize and constantly care for are potatoes and other tubers. Their constant care has brought them good and generous harvests. This is why the wholesale merchants in the central market of their city know them and always await the fruits of their harvest. In the same way that they care for their plants, Mery also buys and sells lamb. She sells this meat weekly in the market. She has been doing this for the past eight years. She is thinking about taking a small space in the market where she can sell her products. This is their eighth loan with MFP, and as an active member in the communal bank, she has committed to the constant activities that develop in each meeting. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy five sacks of organic fertilizer. With the rest of the money she will buy various kilos of meat the she sells each month. This is her main activity. .

loans.use: She will buy five bags of fertilizer and kilos of meat.

loans.name: Jessica Nataly

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jessica V. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su cultura y tradiciones, la belleza de esta ciudad cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señorita. Jessica es soltera y tiene una hija de 4 meses, vive en la casa de sus padres quienes no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia por el momento esta al cuidado de su niña, también cuando puede ayuda a su mamá en la venta de comida. Hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, es una socia fundadora del banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra cosméticos Yanbal.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miss Jessica V. is a member of the communal bank "Buscando el Éxito" ("In Search of Success"). She lives in Cuenca, a city renowned for its culture and traditions. The scenery of the city captures residents and visitors alike, with its large choice of gastronomy and its very kind and cordial people who keep its culture and traditions alive.

Miss Jessica is single and the mother of a 4-month-old daughter. She lives with her parents who don't own their house, but rent it.

Our member currently looks after her daughter, but she also helps her mother in her food business whenever she can. A year ago she began selling cosmetics of the brand Yanbal. Jessica is a founding member of her communal bank. She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of Yanbal cosmetics.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Eugenio Leonel

texts.es:
Eugenio Leonel G. Z. tiene 21 años de edad, Es soltero vive solo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos, No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Eugenio Leonel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Eugenio Leonel Garcia Z. is 21 years old. He is single and he lives alone in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. He does not have children. 

The community bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. They have been practicing this business for a long time. 

Eugenio Leonel is an agriculturist who has been harvesting corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. He purchases his products at Agripac Eicopa and he carries out his sales at the fair in Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers to cultivate corn and rice. The support of this loan is a financial help to help him supply his needs. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and the changing weather. His dream is to purchase farm land.

He enjoys dancing.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Mrs. Ney T. is a widow with four children, two of whom are farmers, one is a laborer, and the other is a student. They live in Prey Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

It is time to cultivate the rice field, so she needs some money to support this activity. To improve the production rice, Mrs. Ney T. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field

loans.name: Las Golondrinas De Paxboch Group

texts.es: Doña Marta Lidia I. D. L. D. P., casada D. 50 años D. edad, cursos en 5to primaria en la escuela, tiene 8 hijos, 2 D. la cuales estudian, se dedica a oficios domesticos, su esposo se dedica a las maquilas, el prestamo lo invertira para el cultivo D. hortalizas, ya que tiene 10 años ya D. experiencia con este trabajo, ella empezo a sembrar verduras(repollo) cuando tenia 20 años D. edad, quiere ver su negocio con un  buen capital y buenas ganancias, por lo que reune a 2 compañeras y 1 compañero para organizar un grupo y poder capitalizar el trabajo que realiza cada uno D. ellos, los integrantes D. este grupo se decican a diversas actividades productivas que son: amarre D. hilo y construccion D. vivienda, esperan mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Marta Lidia I. D. León D. Pérez, 50, is married and finished fifth graD. in school.  She has 8 children two of whom are studying.  She is a housewife.  Her husband works in an assembly plant.  She will use the loan for her vegetable farming.  She has ten years experience in this line of work.  She started planting vegetables (cabbage) when she was 20 years old.  She wants to see her business with good capital and good profits so she got two girlfriends and a male friend together to form a group to capitalize each of their enterprises.  The members of the group are in various occupations like: weaving and house construction.  They hope to improve their and their families’ living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len, born in 1981, is married and she and her husband, Mr. Hul, are farmers who own a rice field plot where they grow rice to earn a living. Currently, they want to grow rice in the dry season but do not have enough money to do this. Mrs. Len is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Aside from their rice field, the couple also cultivate mushrooms and run a watermill to support their family. They have two children, who attend the local school. Mrs. Len is in this photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop.

loans.name: Kandida

texts.en: Kandida M. is a 36-year-old lady and a single mother of three children. Kandida runs a grocery shop in Kiembeni, Mombasa and has been in this business for the last three years. She joined KADET a while back and this marks her second loan which she plans to use to increase stock by purchasing more vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop. She anticipates profits which she will redirect into her children’s education. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Allodalome Group

texts.en:
The Allodalome group consists of 14 women who live in the same village near the rural market town of Allada. This is their first loan with ALIDE. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Ahouanvoéton (with her hand raised in the photo) is 36 years old and a widow. She independently supports two children, who do not have the chance to be in school. Since the age of 6, Ahouanvoéton has been selling palm oil, corn, and cassava from her stall in the market. This loan will enable her to purchase five drums of oil for resale. Her long term aim is to grow her sales. Her strongest points as an entrepreneur are her rigor and dynamism.

loans.use: to purchase 5 drums of palm oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to a teacher. They have five children:  four have graduated from school and one still attends school. They live in a house that they rent; it has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a fish-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors. Mary's biggest business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish and cooking oil. Mary decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to gain access to loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARRIO LINDO” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Paula. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de monederos de cuero, trenzado de mantas, transporte, venta de comida, costura en general, pensión familiar, venta de comida, venta de leche.

La señora Paula,  indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de Marina, promotora que vino a la zona de Barrio Lindo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de ropa de mujer que trabaja desde que migro a Brasil hace 20 años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de telas (que servirá para incrementar su capital), las que adquirirá de la calle Mariscal santa Cruz, Max Paredes, galería La Paz; posteriormente elaborados sus productos los venderá por mayor, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus costureros. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de préstamo de dinero para aumentar ingresos.
texts.en:
The “BARRIO LINDO” (Beautiful Neighborhood) community bank is just starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by an executive committee which is led by Paula.  The businesses that the bank members are engaged in are varied and include: selling leather change purses, braiding blankets, transport, selling food, sewing, running a small family restaurant, selling food and selling milk. 

Paula tells us that this is the first time she has joined a Pro Mujer community bank.  She joined via an invitation from Marina, a promotor who came to Barrio Lindo.  Paula has a dressmaking workshop where she makes women's clothes.  She has been working there since she migrated from Brazil 20 years ago.

Paula will use the loan that she has requested to buy fabrics (which will help her to increase her capital).  She will buy her fabrics in Mariscal Santa Cruz Street, Max Paredes, La Paz.  She will then sell the products that she makes wholesale, with the help of her husband and her seamstresses.  This work allows Paula to make money to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the ease of the loans which give you money with which to increase your income.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
With the desire to further develop her general store, Teodora Layco decided to borrow a loan from ASKI and KIVA lenders for 21, 000 PHP. She will use the looan to buy commodities like canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap and condiments.


Teodora Layco is married and 49 years old. In the future, Teodora aims to retail rice in her store to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap and condiments.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 22 years old and single.  He is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya.  He has been farming for four years.  His mixed farm produces coffee, maize, and beans, which are all sold locally.  He earns additional income from selling shoes to the local market.

Evans has requested a loan of 45,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The supplementary income he will generate from the sale of milk will be saved for his future projects.  His primary business challenges are the shortage of fertilizer and lack of access to capital for expansion.  In the future, he plans to buy an acre of land and expand his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, es casado, vive con su esposa y aun no tienen hijos, él trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años, aprendió de su padre el proceso de la siembra de maíz y frijol, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos agrícolas, abono, fertilizantes, tratamiento para las plagas, esta inversión es muy necesaria para José y para su familia, ya que dependen del cultivo, y este dará frutos por los buenos cuidados que se le brinden.
Su objetivo es proveer a su familia lo necesario, además de tener una fuente de ingresos que le garantice sus ganancias.
texts.en: José grows corn and beans.  He is married and lives with his wife.  They don't yet have children.  José has been farming for 20 years.  He learned how to grow corn and beans from his father.  He works from 6.00am to 2.00pm.  José is currently requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers and pest treatments.  José and his family really need to make this investment since they depend on his crops which will provide fruit due to the good care that he takes of them.  His goal is to provide his family with what they need and also to have a source of income that will guarantee profits.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Blanca Deyadira

texts.es: Blanca Deyadira es una mujer muy emprendedora a pesar de la situación económica en que vive el país sigue adelante sobre todo porque tiene  un hijo que mantener. Hace 2 años puso su negocio de abarrotes denominado “Miscelánea Iscely” en cual le permite estar al tanto de su pequeña para cualquier cosa que se le ofrezca a diferencia que si trabaja en alguna maquiladora tendría que faltar para realizar algún pendiente lo cual le quitaría dinero de su pago. Por ello quiere comprar mercancía para su negocio para tener mayor variedad en producto y así satisfacer los gustos de cada cliente. De esta manera seguirá generando mayor ingreso para los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Blanca is a hardworking woman in spite of the economic situation in the country. She keeps pushing forward because she has a child to look after. For 2 years, she has been running a grocery store called "Miscelánea Iscely" which lets her look after her little girl, as opposed to if she worked for a big firm where she would have to be absent to do any chores and would loose money from her pay. For this reason, she wants to buy supplies for her business so she can have a greater variety of products and so satisfy the tastes of her customers. In this way she will keep generating more income to pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Isabelita

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 64 años D. edad.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se dedica a dar el servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos (habitaciones), tiene una casa D. 2 pisos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 baldes D. pintura, 2 rollos D. cables D. luz, 10 tubos pvc, 2 cinta aislante, pago D. mano D. obra (pintor y electricista).
Esta vez hará arreglos que necesita su casa para estar más presentable y poder alquilar sus habitaciones a un buen precio.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder pertenecer a esta familia, que por años viene trabajando D. esta manera.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 64 years old.  María has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years.  Her business is renting out rooms.  She has a two-storey house.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy 15 large containers of paint, 2 rolls of electricity cable, 10 PVC pipes and 2 lots of insulating tape.  She will also pay labor costs (a painter and an electrician).

On this occasion, María will carry out repairs that her house needs in order to be more presentable, so that she can rent out her rooms at a good price.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to belong to their family.  She has been working in this way for years.

loans.use: to buy paint and electricity cables

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children.  Lita has a food shop that sells & serves variety of dishes. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan off PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes to sell.  Lita has been a member of HSPFI since 2000.  In the future, Lita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes to sell

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru:
Компания "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" искренне благодарит социальных инвесторов и Фонд Кива за всестороннюю поддержку и помощь в финансировании своих клиентов. Благодаря вашим усилиям, Дамира успешно развивает свой бизнес в торговле, который позволил выплатить первый кредит по линии Кива без просрочек.
Дамира родилась в селе Чалдовар (Панфиловский район, Кыргызская Республика), в котором сейчас и проживает. Ей 58 лет. Она была третьим ребенком в многодетной, малообеспеченной семье. С раннего детства ей пришлось помогать матери по хозяйству, поэтому она закончила всего 7 классов средней школы. В 22 года вышла замуж. Вскоре родился сын, а затем  две дочери. Муж Дамиры в то время начинал заниматься разведением овец, но особого дохода это не приносило. Но для содержания растущей семьи необходим был постоянный заработок. Таким образом, не имея образования и практических знаний, Дамира решила попробовать торговать.
Начинала Дамира, как и многие в ее ситуации, с торговли на рынке. Когда на руках трое детей и нет никаких постоянных источников дохода, торговля стала единственной возможностью заработать. Не без усилий первый опыт частной предпринимательской деятельности увенчался успехом. Начальный капитал составлял 4 000 сом (KGS), и уже после первого года работы она смогла приумножить свои вложения. После пяти лет торговли на рынке продуктами питания Дамира смогла приобрести павильон и открыть небольшой магазин возле своего дома - и с этого момента торговля в магазинчике стала уже семейным делом. Женился сын, старшая дочка вышла замуж, младшая дочь помогала матери по бизнесу. В 2009 году  Дамира получила свой первый кредит в сумме 100 000 сом в компании «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» и построила магазин на собственном участке. Торговая деятельность стала приносить постоянную прибыль,  росло число клиентов. 
В этот момент в семье случается несчастье – в серьезную автомобильную аварию попал единственный сын и ему потребовалось дорогостоящее лечение. В это же время родилась внучка, что еще увеличило расходы семьи.
Сейчас Дамира планирует получить очередной кредит в сумме 100 000 сомов (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товара в магазине и покупку нового холодильника в магазин. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" (MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners” CJSC) предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Damira was born in the village of Chaldovar (Panfilov Region, Kyrgyzstan), where she still lives now. She is 58 years old. She was the third child in a large low-income family. From an early age she had to help her mother with household duties, which is why she  completed only seven grades of primary school. At 22, she got married. Before long she had a son and later on two daughters. At that time, Damira’s husband started raising sheep, but this work was not particularly profitable. However, steady income was necessary to support the growing family. And this is how, lacking formal education and practical knowledge, Damira decided to go into retail.

Like many in a similar situation, Damira started by selling at the local market. With three children to feed and without a reliable source of income, working as a vendor was the only opportunity to have earnings. After much effort, her first year of entrepreneurship turned out to be successful. The starting capital amounted to 4,000 KGS, and already after the first year of work Damira was able to increase her investment. After selling food items at a market for five years, Damira was able to buy a pavilion and open a small grocery store near her home. From then on, retail became a family business. Her son got married, her older daughter too, while the younger daughter started helping with the business. In 2009 Damira obtained her first loan for 100,000 KGS from “Bai Tushum and Partners” and built a store  on her own land plot.  Her retail work started to bring in a steady income; the number of customers kept increasing. 

Then the family had to face an emergency: Damira’s only son was seriously injured in an automobile accident and  required expensive medical care. Around that time, her granddaughter was born, which necessitated further expenses.

At present Damira plans to receive her next loan for 100,000 KGS in order to expand her selection of goods and   buy a new refrigerator for her store.

The MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners,” CJSC offers loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable populations. The MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners,” CJSC is a leading microfinance organizations in Kyrgyzstan. “Bai Tushum and Partners” is a reliable financial partner that contributes to the economic development of Kyrgystan through providing affordable microfinance services in rural and urban areas and thus  promoting the creation of work places and serving the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha has been operating a fruit shop where he sells ripe bananas for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000.

He is married, with two children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET registered client and is now applying for his first loan, which he will use to add to his stock of bananas for sale.

He hopes to make a profit and invest the return in farming. His dreams are to see his children prosper. He is a hardworking man who could do more if he was funded.

loans.use: to add to his stock.

loans.name: Absatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Absatou   est une jeune célibataire de 33 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est serveuse dans un restaurant de la place, mais en même temps elle exerce l’activité de commerce . Ainsi elle s’adonne depuis 3 ans déjà a  la vente de chaussures, parfums, colliers, boubous  traditionnels, poudriers et maquillage. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité   afin qu’elle puisse prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et arrondir les fins de mois. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2007. Elle a déjà remboursé deux prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 prévu pour l’achat  de marchandises qu’elle va aller vendre en Gambie. A son retour elle prévoit d’acheter d’autres  produits qu’elle va pouvoir vendre au Sénégal. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement et de mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Ms. Absatou is a single 33-year old woman living in Senegal. She is a waitress in a local restaurant, but at the same time she works as a vendor. Since three  years ago, she has been selling shoes, perfume, necklaces, traditional "boubou" outfits, cosmetic powder and make-up. She has chosen this activity out of necessity, in order to be able to take care of her expenses and make ends meet. She is a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since May 2007. She has already repaid two prior loans. She is seeking a credit of 250,000 in order to buy merchandise in Gambia. After returning, she will buy some additional goods that she will be able to resell in Senegal. This financing will allow her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional outfits, shoes etc for resale

loans.name: Sarina

texts.es: La señora Sarina se dedica a la venta de lechón de cerdo al horno y pollo al horno los días jueves y domingos en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto. Los días restantes desempeña la función  como farmacéutica en una farmacia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material, como ladrillo refractario para la reparación de su horno que lo usa para su negocio de venta de comida. Vive en casa de sus suegros , ubicada en la zona de 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Sarina tiene un hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene prestamos con impro y la primera con kiva.
texts.en: Sarina sells roasted piglet and roasted chicken on Thursdays and Sundays at the market in the city of El Alto.  On the rest of the days she works as a pharmacist in a pharmacy.  She needs the loan to buy materials, like a refractory brick, to repair her oven that she uses in her food sales business.  She lives in her in-laws’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio neighborhood.  Sarina has one son and this is the second time she has loans with Impro and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair her oven.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del banco comunal San Fernando II del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de  comunicaciones, tiene un locutorio en su propia casa, que le da muchas facilidades de poder atender su casa y lo bueno es que no tiene que invertir en alquiler de local.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles, comprará: 4 bancas de madera, 2 teléfonos nuevos,  saldo para sus teléfonos, 25 tarjetas de diferentes precios.
Su esposo es docente universitario (profesor), el negocio en su casa es una gran ayuda para poder cubrir otros gastos, tiene que solventar los gastos de sus tres hijos.
Agradecen a Manuela Ramos por haberle aceptado integrar uno de sus bancos comunales y poder trabajar para el beneficio de toda su familia, de esta manera podrá apoyar a sus hijos hasta que terminen la carrera.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank San Fernando II in the Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali, She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She works in communication services. She has a call center shop in her own home providing many communication services, and the good thing is she does not have to pay rent for her business location. With this new loan she will buy 4 wooden benches, 2 new telephones, account balances for the phones, and 25 prepaid cards offering different prices.

Her husband is a university professor. Her at-home business is a great help in order to cover other expenses. She has to pay the cost of living for her three children. She is grateful to the communal bank Manuela Ramos for working with her and to be able to work in order to provide for her family so that she can support the children until they finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase telephones and prepaid phone cards

loans.name: Mwangeka

texts.en:
Mwangeka is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Mwangeka dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita lives in a village where you can find housewives busy in their daily activities such as vending food and personal products, fruits and vegetables and backyard hog raising. Teresita is involved in personal products sales- selling cosmetics, perfumes, and slippers to the people in the village. She has been offering these items for almost three years and earns a profit of P2,000 each month. 

She needs to diversify her business to gain more profit. She has insufficient funds which is why she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy colognes, perfumes, lipstick, shampoos, and soaps to offer and sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to establish a permanent stall in front of her house for a more convenient place to stock the items offered to her customers.

loans.use: to buy colognes, perfumes, lipstick, shampoo, and soaps to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 9 years old.

Irene sells bamboo products to the people in her community. She has been in this business for nine years. 

Irene also raises chickens, pigs and ducks. She plans to use her loan to buy more bamboo and ducks. 

Irene plans to use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo and ducks.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es: Pedro Joaquín tiene 46 años. El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, pues él tiene una finca y ha sido con tiempo que ha logrado aprender todas estas cosas necesarias para su actividad. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la compra de vacas, toros y chivos, el crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá invertir en su negocio para aumentar la producción. Los desafíos que se le presenta muy frecuente son la competencia, enfermedades que se dan en los animales. Pero aun así ha logrado mejorar cada dia.
texts.en: Pedro Joaquín is 46 years old. He is dedicated to the buying and selling of cattle. He has a farm and over time he has successfully learned all the things that are necessary for his business activity. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of cows, bulls, and goats. The credit will be a lot of help because he will be able to invest in his business and thereby increase his sales. The challenges that he often encounters are competition and diseases that affect the animals. But even with these problems, he has managed to improve every day.

loans.use: To purchase cows, bulls, and goats

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry es un grupo integrado por 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Ellas tienen como objetivo principal mejorar su estilo de vida, ya que ellas son mujeres de escasos recursos y quieres salir adelante. Al escuchar hablar del programa de la fundación quedaron encantadas por lo que decidieron darse la oportunidad.
Elodia es una mujeres muy trabajadora, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, mediante la cual ayuda con los ingresos de la casa. Comenta que trabaja desde muy temprano, pues desde tempranas horas ya tiene clientes. Entre sus metas está seguir creciendo y expandirse para agrandar su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para abastecer su despensa con azúcar, harina, huevo,aceite, fideo, golosinas, carne; frutas, verduras, leche y demás, con lo cual piensa que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Kuña Katupyry” is a group of 18 women from the city of Caaguazú. Their main goal is to improve their lifestyle. They are women of limited resources who want to get ahead. Upon hearing about the program with Fundación Paraguaya, they were delighted with the opportunity being given to them and decided to take action.

Elodia is one of these hardworking women. She has a well-stocked food pantry, which helps her to generate household income. Elodia says that she begins her work very early because she already has customers in the mornings. Her goals include continuing to grow and expanding the size of her business.

She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her food pantry with sugar, flour, eggs, oil, noodles, candy, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, and other products. By restocking her inventory, she will be able to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, eggs, oil, noodles, candy, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam  est mariée  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. Tous vont  à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes et des habits pour enfants depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont  les gens des différents quartiers.

Elle veut  s’acheter  04 paquets d’habits pour enfants.

 Avec  ses bénéfices, elle améliore son activité. Elle ambitionne  pouvoir aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam is married and mother to two children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest 11 years old. They both go to school. She has four people under her care.

She has been selling loincloths and children's clothing for nine years. She buys her supplies at the market of sector 10 in town. Her clients are from the different neighborhoods.

She wants to buy four bundles of children's clothing.

With her profits, she plans to improve her business. Her goal is to be able to help her husband to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy four bundles of children's clothing.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit is engaged in agriculture. Margarit needs an investment to develop cattle-breeding. With the requested loan she plans to purchase cattle and hay. Additional cattle will allow Margarit to get more income from agriculture by selling milk and expanding the farm further. With additional income Margarit will renovate her house and improve her household economy. Margarit lives together with her husband, mother-in-law, and children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and hay

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 37 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a school. She has employed three people in the school. She was able to open a school because she has good experience in teaching because she is a teacher. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money and run her business well. Catherine has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to build more classrooms.

loans.use: To build classrooms

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nougnito Rènee

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Nougnito Rènee est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 15 mois. Elle a un niveau d'instruction primaire et vend des produits de mercerie dans sa boutique depuis huit ans. Nougnito Rènee s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Sa clientèle est constituée des femmes, des  hommes et surtout des artisans. Dans le but de satisfaire ses clients, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Nougnito Rènee is 36 years old and married. She has three children ranging in age from 12 years to 15 months, and two of her children are in school. She herself went to elementary school. 

For eight years, she has been selling dry goods in her boutique. Nougnito Rènee buys her supplies at the marketplace. Her clients are women, men, and above all - artisans. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients' needs, she depends on financing from Finadev to reinforce her business and maximize her profit.

loans.use: buy 2 boxes of wire, 1 box of zippers, 5 rolls of fabric, 1 box of wool, and 3 boxes of needles.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: My name is Lucila G. and I make and sell decorative articles for the home and office.  Some of my products include artificial flower arrangements, tablecloths, blankets, porcelain decorations, and felt items. I have had my business for five years.  My daughter helps me make and sell my products, and my business generates income so that I am able to sustain my household.  My goal is to increase my inventory so that I am able to increase my sales and pay for a college education for my daughter. I also hope to provide for my family.

loans.use: To buy felt, artificial flowers, porcelain decorations, thread, hemp, needles, bags, glue, cotton and paper.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. S. has a truck that he uses to make freight deliveries to other cities. He has been doing this work for over 18 years. Now he wants to purchase another vehicle for the same use. He says, "My son has followed in my footsteps and is interested in helping me with work, but we only have one vehicle, so I am asking for a $1200 loan to buy another little truck."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. S. cuenta con una camioneta que utiliza para realizar fletes a otras ciudades, lleva haciendo esto por mas de 18 años, hoy en día quiere adquirir otro vehiculo para darle el mismo uso. "Mi hijo siguió mis pasos y esta interesado en ayudarme con el trabajo solo que no tenemos mas que un solo vehiculo por lo que les solicito $1,200.00 dlls. para comprar un camioncito.

loans.use: To buy another work truck.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Shoppers who pass Lubov’s neatly arranged retail space at the Ubileini market in Marganez will find an attractive selection of women’s coats and outerwear for sale along with several choices in men’s footwear. She has had her own business for six years. It has provided much needed income to support her and her 17 year old son. Lubov currently makes around $300 in profit each month. She normally orders about $600 worth of new products twice a month.

Lubov has requested a loan to help her purchase necessary inventory. She is gearing up for summer and what she hopes will be a very profitable season for her business. We are happy for this opportunity to help Lubov improve her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Amsatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six members of the Khourwi association, led by Mr. Amsatou G.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The gardeners of our village who have cultivated the Valley of Sin for a very long time plan to increase not only their production, but also continue to cultivate their fields in every season, twelve months of the year. We need only to obtain a powerful irrigation pump in order to alleviate the hard work of watering the fields by hand. A large reservoir will also be constructed for the storing of a large volume of water, with a proper distribution system to carry the water as far into the fields as possible in pipes.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

« Les membres de l’éco village maraîchers installés depuis très longtemps dans la vallée (de Sin) visent à accroître non seulement leur production mais continuer à exploiter leur périmètre en toute saison ; douze mois sur douze. I l s’agira tout simplement de trouver une motopompe très puissante pour les alléger du dur travail de puisage à la main. Un nouveau basin très grand sera construit pour le stockage d’un très grand volume d’eau, avec une bonne technique de distribution dans le périmètre aussi loien que possible en tuyaux.»

loans.use: Purchase of an irrigation pump, reservoir and pipes to irrigate vegetable field

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina is a hard-working and affectionate mother who with help of her husband does different activities at home to be able to support her family. She has 4 children and two of them are still in school. Every day they take the sheep to pasture in her grounds so they can have their daily sustenance that nature offers them; in addition to this activity they grow some vegetables for her family consumption. They start these activities quite early; meanwhile her husband is getting the sheep ready, Peregrina prepares the meal for her dear children so each one can do their assign task. The cattle profits for many families have diminished due the climate because the temperature in the Peruvian valleys has descended in an alarming way and has affected directly the cattle activity generating millionaire losses. Peregrina’s family also suffered the loss of a considerable number of sheep that they had so their family revenue diminished. For this reason Peregrina is requesting for a loan of 425 dollars in order to increase and improve the area where the sheep pasture and the sheep’s food. She promises to repay over a period of 6 months. Let's help Peregrina and her family!.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Peregrina es una trabajadora y amorosa madre que con ayuda de su esposo realiza distintas actividades en el seno de su hogar para otorgarle bienestar a su familia, tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos aún en etapa escolar. A diario recorren sus tierras para que las ovejitas que crían puedan tener el sustento diario que la naturaleza les ofrece; además de dedicarse a esta actividad siembran algunos vegetales para su consumo familiar. Las actividades las inician muy temprano y mientras su esposo va alistando a sus ovejitas Peregrina elabora la comida para sus queridos hijos a fin de que cada uno desarrolle la tarea acostumbrada, el clima ha sido un factor que ha hecho que las ganancias ganaderas en muchas familias disminuyan porque la temperatura en los valles peruanos ha descendido de manera alarmante y ha afectado directamente la actividad ganadera generando pérdidas millonarias y la familia de Peregrina también sufrió la muerte de un considerable número de ovejitas que tenía en casa y por ende también el ingreso familiar debido a que el único sustento con el que cuentan se los otorga la venta de estos animalitos. Por esta razón y con el deseo de incrementar y mejorar el espacio y la comida que ingieren las ovejas hace ella hace una petición de 425 dólares con el propósito de llevar a cabo este proyecto y se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Hagamos que Peregrina y su familia puedan hacer realidad este anhelo.

loans.use: Buy more sheep, improve the sheep's food and their barn.

loans.name: Neman

texts.en: Neman has been in this business for one year. He is 21 years old and single. He lives in Khachmaz town. He would like to improve the conditions of his cafe to attract more clients, therefore he is applying for a loan of $825 to buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar-bowls.

loans.use: Neman would like to buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar-bowls for his cafe.

loans.name: Mhamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed S. is 28 years old and the father of three children, all of whom are at school. He meets the needs of his family by the income he makes from his business. With this loan Mohamed intends to increase the capacity of his small store in order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of his customers. He has been in business for more than 10 years, which has given him expertise in all areas of the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mohamed S. est âgé de 28 ans et père de 3 enfants tous à l'école. Il subvient au besoins de la famille par les profits réalisés sur son commerce. Avec cet emprunt Mohamed compte augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour satisfaire aux besoins sans cesse croîssants de ses clients. Il est exerce cet activité de plus de 10 ans ce qui lui favorise une maîtrise de tous les rouages du secteur.

loans.use: To buy 10 cases of milk, 15 bags of rice, 8 bags of sugar, 10 cases of canned food

loans.name: Rasulov

texts.en: Rasulov Y. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Rasulov Y. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007.  He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Mr. Rasulov Y. is very experienced in business (about 10 years) and it is the family business. He is engaged in business of the livestock raising and selling and the milk production.  He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk goods production (to supply to the bazaars). This would include such products as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. Rasulov Y. requests the loan of $475 for business development that would permit him to increase significantly the family income and to purchase the pedigree bull.

loans.use: for the business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more polythene bags for sale

loans.name: Katwe A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth fabric. Mariam is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children, aged 1 and 4, and one child goes to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save to cater for basic needs. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Mwajjuma N. and Betty N.. Mwajjuma N. has a business selling cold drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Betty N. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to increase her purchases.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread to expand tailoring business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Yastrini

texts.id:
Ketut Yastrini owns a store, which she had operated diligently since. Having married 7 years, Yastrini has not been blessed with a child. Her husband worked as a farmer. Everyday Yastrini commences her work from 4 am. After waking Yastrini is ready to go to morning main market, to purchase merchandise for her store. Returning home by 5 am, cooks fish, prepares rice, boils vegetables, prepares bananas, and finally prepares sweet ice. Yastrini besides making cooked food also sells basic needs. Loan from Dinari Rp. 3.500.000,- (about USD400) will all be used for merchandise for the store. Prior to this loan from Dinari income earned daily was Rp. 25.000,- to Rp. 30.000,- (about USD3.50). With this loan the daily income is Rp. 30.000,- to Rp. 60.000,- (about USD6). With this income Yastrini assist in meeting the family’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Yastrini memiliki usaha warung yang sudah lama ditekuninya.Sudah 7 Tahun menikah Yastrini belum juga dikaruniai anak. Suami Yastrini bekerja sebagai petani. Setiap hari Yastrini memulai usahanya mulai jam 4.00 pagi. Bangun tidurYastrini sudah bersiap –siap untuk pergi ke pasar pagi di Negara. membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya . Sampai dirumah jam 5.00 pagi , mulai memasak ikan, membuat nasi, merebus tipat, merebus sayur,membuat kolak pisang, dan terakhir membuat gula es. Yastrini selain membuat makanan matang juga menjual Sembako. Modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari Rp.3.500.000,- semua sudah dipergunakan untuk kebutuhan warungnya. Sebelum pinjam dari Dinari keuntungan yang di dapat perhari Rp.25.000,- sd Rp.30.000,-. Setelah pinjam dari Dinari keuntungan perhari Rp.30.000,- sd Rp.60.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Yastrini membantu kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: Purchase raw merchandise (Membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 47 years old, a widow with 6 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 5 years. She sells rice and beans. She is requesting $875 to enable her buy more rice and beans for sales.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.en:
Saidbek is 28 years old. He is married and has 3 children of school age. All is he doing is for the well-being of his children. Saidbek’s wife is a housekeeper, and she’s taking care of their children. Saidbek’s business is the main source of income for his family. Saidbek started his own business over 10 years ago when he was young, renting a stall in an open-air market of Khujand.

First he began selling the foods on the market. As time went by, he decided to change his business because he was married and the business did not generate enough income to support his family. He began to sell white salt.

He purchases the white salt wholesale from his suppliers. Over seven years of working in this business, Saidbek already has had enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Today Saidbek requests 900 $ US Dollars for increasing the stock of goods. Saidbek would like to thank everybody for supporting him, and promises that he will repay the loan in 10 months promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing white salt to increase stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is not sufficient for Mary and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and so she is asking for additional capital to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma O. R. is 42 years old and married with four children, ages 22, 19, 15  and 3.  She sells perfumes and porridge, a business she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 10 a.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $50. Mwajuma  now hopes for a loan of $150  to buy more perfumes for her business.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her perfume business

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is the wife of H. A. and lives in Pakistan in the city of Lahore in a district named Walton. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She is the mother of six children: three boys and three girls. Her eldest son is a mechanic and repairs vehicles. The next eldest to him is in 9th standard. The younger one is in 5th standard. Her eldest daughter couldn't get an education because of her weak mind. The next to her is in 10th standard. Her youngest daughter is in 8th standard.

Anwar baji's husband is a driver by profession. Anwar baji is a housewife but she sews clothes also. She has been in this line of work for the last 20 years. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband's small truck.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shutter business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy livestock to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a small truck for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vegetable Garden and Nursery Bed  for Children

loans.name: Emil

texts.es: Emil tiene 21 años, vive con su madre y hermanos. Desde su niñez ha sido un apoyo económico para su familia en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, pero hace más de 3 años decidió dedicarse enteramente a la crianza de cuyes, para lo cual habilitó, en su misma casa, un granja de tamaño regular, donde actualmente tiene alrededor de 100 cuyes, por ello es que en sus propias tierras de cultivo ha sembrado principalmente alfalfa, alimento primordial de sus animales, a fin de tenerlos saludables. Cada 2 semanas, luego de obtener el tamaño y peso deseado, los vende, es ahí cuando puede ver las ganancias de su esfuerzo. Emil trabaja movido por sus deseos de superación, en el futuro, se ve como propietario de una gran granja de cuyes. Solicita este préstamo para comprar alimento balanceado y cuyes de raza mejorada.
texts.en:
Emil, 21, lives with his mother and siblings. From childhood, he's contributed to his family's income by supporting their farming and livestock business. However, he decided more than 3 years ago to dedicate himself entirely to raising cuyes [a hamster-like animal], for which he has a skill, on the farm--a regular-sized place--where he now has around 100 cuyes. He grows alfalfa, the main food source for his animals, on the farm so that he can make sure they cuyes are strong and healthy. Every 2 weeks, when they're at the right size and weight, he sells them. That's when he can see the benefits of his efforts. For the future, he sees himself as the owner of a large cuyes farm. He's applying for this loan so that he can provide a balanced diet for his animals and better stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock and feed for livestock business.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.en: Rahmon K., a father of 3,  is a very responsible gentleman who repairs electrical appliance for a living at the local Isfara area. His business is widely visited by many because he is capable of fixing many types of electrical appliances and offers his clients a high quality service. Rahmon has the urgent need to purchase modern electrical instruments to provide better service in the future and is requesting a loan for this reason. Rahmon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing electrical instruments.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Elena, casa, de 37 años de edad, con un hijo de 13 años estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  Maria Elena es una persona responsable, buena madre y desea darle un hogar digno y propio a su hijo, ya que ella en estos momentos alquila y quiere salir de esa situacion pues en el cuarto que habita no puede realizar ninguna mejora porque no es de ella, con los creditos anteriores compro un terreno y parte de los materiales de construccion, con este 3er credito quiere levantar paredes y poner techo; plantea que en un futuro cuando haya cancelado este credito continuara con otros hasta lograr la construccion completa de su propia vivienda que han sido los sueños de toda su vida para que su hijo tenga estabilidad y no estar de un lugar a otro, porque los dueños de las casas donde habita actualmente le pueden pedir en cualquier momento desaloje el cuarto.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 37 years old, she is married and has a 13 year old son who is in high school. Her husband works and helps her with the household expenses. Maria Elena is a responsible person, she is a good mother and wants to giver her son a worthy and proper home. She currently rents and wants to get out of this situation since she cannot make improvements to the room that she lives in as it does not belong to her. With the previous loans that she received she bought a plot of land and a portion of the construction materials. With this third loan she wants to erect walls and build a roof. She plans that in the future, when she has paid this loan, she will continue with others until the construction of her own home is complete. It has been her life long dream that her son have stability and not move from place to place because the owners of the homes where she currently lives can ask her to leave at any time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Erect walls and build a roof for her home currently under construction.

loans.name: Kalsoom Mai Tariq Mahmood Baig Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom mai baji is the wife of T. M. B. and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 12 years. She is 38 years old and the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Kalsoom mai baji completed her education until the 10th standard and then she got married to her husband who has a very kind nature. Kalsoom mai baji learned the skill of embroidery and now runs her own boutique in the community. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

Kalsoom mai baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Yasmeen baji is requesting a loan to buy material (beads, sketches and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Reema baji is requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Abida baji is requesting a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Samina baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose E. is 59 years old and married with 14 children. He is a farmer; he cultivates cassava and yams which he uses to take care of his family. His wife also farms. He needs money to cultivate more cassava. He is requesting the loan amount of N 30,000 cultivate more cassava. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To cultivate more cassava

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
Amelyn V. lives in the village of Sitio Anguapan, Sto Nińo Tumauini, Isabela. She is 27 years old and is married to Oscar who is 10 years older than her. They have three children: Princess - 7 years old, grade one; Precious - 6 years old, kindergarten; and the youngest is Clarence - 3 months old. In the village, Amelyn strives for a better livelihood to help her husband earn their daily living and give their children a better education.  

Amelyn learned to manage a vending business in their village. She entered this business because she wants to help her husband to provide for their needs and uplift their poor living situation. She roams around the village selling her vegetable products. Sometimes, her husband also serves as part-time driver aside from being a helper. Amelyn is frightened of not being able to meet her family’s growing needs because of the unavailability of a stable source of livelihood. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP4,000 as financial support for her business. She is hoping that her loan will be approved in order to buy different kinds of vegetables in bulk.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Fawusat
