texts.en: Fawusat sells drinks and wine. She is 50 years old and is a widow with 5 children. Fawusat is very enthusiastic about the well-being of her family and the prosperity of her business. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more wine and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been a clothes and shoes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and shoes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.

Khadija is 35-years-old, married and has two children: ages 14 and 11. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Shemsa, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for business.

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en:
Zelita is 34 years old and has three children. She resides in Deboloc, PlariD., Misamis Occidental. She asked for a loan amounting to Php20,000.00 for additional capital for her store. Her husband is a fisherman. The couple started their business with their own capital from what they were able to save from her husband's salary.

When she observed that her business was growing slowly, she realized that she needed to add to her capital in order to have more stock available for her customers. She decided to join Paglaum to borrow money for additional capital. She was very interested in other products and services that Paglaum offered. Zelita hopes that someday her business will become a mini-grocery store and her kids will be able to establish their own careers.

loans.use: To buy additional Ready To Wear clothing products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in local communities at affordable prices and sells in the local market. She also treks to other towns to sell and distributes some to retailers and beverage sellers. 
Elizabeth is 48 years old, divorced and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is in the polytechnic and her daughter is currently in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 
Elizabeth has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure crate of eggs in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure eggs

loans.name: Savit

texts.en:
Mr. Savit U. is 35 years old and his wife, Sreypov But, is 36. They were married in 1991 and have five sons. Three of their sons are in school and the other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savit has been driving a motor taxi for six years. He drives from his village to Phnom Penh and back. Mrs. Sreypov has been selling corn for eight years. She buys them from a nearby commune for resale in Phnom Penh market. Savit’s wife needs money to pay for corn before harvesting season, so he is asking for his first loan of $500 to help fund his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase corn on contract for next season.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: marie V. est parent beneficiaire habitant camberene et commercialisant lapate d'arachide,un produit fdrtement utilise dans la consommation quotidienne des menages.elle a une experience dedix ans dans cette activite.par consequent elle emprunte cent mille frs pour pouvoir repondre favorablement a l'accroissement de la demande.
texts.en:
Marie V. is a client parent living in Camberene and marketing peanut butter, a highly-used product in daily household consumption. She has ten years of experience in this business. Consequently she is borrowing 100,000 francs to be able to respond favorably to the growth in demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, a 37-year-old married mother of three children, ages 7, 13, and 15 years old, is also the primary caretaker of two orphans, (her late sister’s children), aged 16 and 17. An early childhood development schoolteacher, Eunice will use this loan to improve the school by purchasing chairs, tables, charts, and porridge for feedings. Many of the children she works with are vulnerable orphans; five of the 30 children she works with are HIV positive. It is important for her to buy porridge because, she explains, that is sometimes the only meal that these kids get during the day. Not all of the children have someone to pay their school fees, but she takes them at her school anyway.

In the evenings Eunice sells second-hand clothing to make ends meet for her family. She will use part of the loan to buy more clothing.

Eunice explained that she is “living positively:” she is living with HIV and she is living in a positive way. She said it is ok for people to know that about her, and she also wants people to know that people living with HIV/AIDS require good nutrition. If they are taking their ARV medicine properly, they need to be eating well, which is a challenge for many people in Kisumu.

K-MET, the NGO providing Eunice’s loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, click on “About the Field Partner” on the right-hand side of the webpage.

loans.use: School Furniture and clothes to sell

loans.name: Warlyn

texts.en:
Warlyn A. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 26 years old. Warlyn is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Warlyn owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Warlyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Warlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlyn has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Warlyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 25th loan taken out by Warlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Relina

texts.en:
Relina is engaged in the hog raising business and is also sells dry goods in the village. She is hoping to borrow PHP 7,000.00 which she will use to buy feed for her hogs.

She is married to Dominador and they have two children who are both students in the rural village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela. Regina dreams of a progressive life for her family. She and her husband work hard to become successful in their small livestock and farming business. Relina considers her children as God’s greatest gift, thereby making them her inspiration to move forward. 
 
Relina is hoping for a loan to improve her businesses and become more profitable in the long run. Through the business that she manages, Relina hopes support her children's education. She really hopes that they complete their education because she believes that it will be the only way for them to improve their poor living conditions.

loans.use: Additional  Capital

loans.name: Idiatou

texts.fr: Idiatou D. est une femme de 35 ans elle est mariée avec 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara OUEST2 depuis 4 ans et a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Ce prêt lui permettra de développer un petit commerce de tissu teinté et de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Idiatou D. is a 35 year old married woman and mother of 5 children still in her care. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Velingara Ouest2" for the past 4 years and she has acquired 8 previous loans, all of which have all been repaid without difficulty. This loan will permit her to develop her small colored fabrics business, and to obtain earnings to help her husband support the family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advertise her small business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells sarongs of various colors. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Claveles Community Bank Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Claveles está formado por 12 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi Bajo y Pampahasi Alto, están ubicados alrededor de la Sub alcaldia  de alto San Antonio, las socias se dedican a la venta de Comida, Viveres, pan, Cerveza, Abarrotes, juguetes, Cosméticos Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 5 ciclos se reestructuro en un 30% de las socias
Mery C. B. Es la líder y presidenta del banco desde hace 2 ciclos teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 5 ciclos, la socia tiene una  tienda de abarrotes. 
En su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas de sus compañeras a la hora de pago, amigable, alegre. con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en la tienda aportar de esa forma con ingresos para su familia.
Irene C. A. La señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una de las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco claves se dedica a la venta de comida, en feria, fiestas y en diversas actividades sociales que se presentan no contaba con capital para emprender su propio negocio, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  materia prima para  iniciar su propio negocio.
Sofia M. S. Socia bastante dinámica, alegre, es la secretaria del Banco, durante su permanencia en el banco siempre se encuentra animando a sus compañeras, a seguir adelante, actualmente se dedica a la venta de carteras, el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para la compra de mercadería.
La señora Sofia S. tiene un  hijo, sin embargo esta no es una limitante para ella ya que sale a comercializar sus productos en compañía de su niño debido a que no tiene con quien dejarlo mientras va ha trabajar.
texts.en:
The Claveles Community Bank consists of 12 members that live in the Pampahasi Bajo and Pampahasi Alto areas, located around the Town Hall of upper San Antonio. The members sell food, supplies, bread, beer, groceries, toys and cosmetics. During their tenure with Emprender, which has been 5 cycles, they are restructuring to 30% of the members. B. Mery C. is the leader and president of the bank for the past 2 cycles, given that the bank already has completed 5 cycles. That member has a grocery store. In her community bank, she has learned to be a responsible leader with her friends, requiring the shares of her colleagues at the time of payment, being friendly and cheerful. With the loan that has been granted, she will be able to increase store supplies, thus providing income for her family. Mrs. Irene C. A. is the Treasurer of the bank and is one of the founders that led to the formation of the bank. She sells food at fairs, festivals and social activities that occur. She had no capital to start her own business, but now with the loan that she will be given, she will be able to buy raw materials to start her own business. The member Sofia M. S. is rather dynamic, happy and is the Secretary of the bank. During her tenure at the bank, she is always encouraging her colleagues. To move forward, she now sells handbags, and the requested loan is required for the purchase of merchandise. Mrs. Sofia S. has a son, but this is not a limiting factor for her as she sells her products in the company of her son because she has no one with whom to leave him while she goes to work.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in capital

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: H. Agnès est née en 1971 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Agnès est mariée à ADOUEKONOU Médard, un chauffeur. Agnès et Médard ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Dowa à Porto-Novo. Agnès vend du charbon de bois qu’elle attache en petits lots dans des sachets. Agnès vend aussi de boisson locale et des beignets faits à base de farine de blé. C’est à domicile que Agnès vend ces produits. Mais, Agnès s’approvisionne en ces produits au marché Ouando de Porto-Novo. Agnès a eu deux crédits de ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursés. Agnès sollicite ce troisième crédit de ALIDé pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Agnes Houdenou was born in 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Agnes is married to Menard Adouekonou, a driver. Agnes and Menard have four children who have all attended school and are still in their care. The family lives in Dowa in Porto-Nova. Agnes sells charcoal which she packages in small bags. She also sells local drinks and doughnuts made from a corn flour base. Agnes sells her products from her home. She buys her supplies at the market in Porto-Novo. Agnes has had two previous loans with ALIDe which she has duly repaid. Agnes is requesting this third loan from ALIDe to increase her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn flour and charcoal as well as crates of local drinks for resale

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a member of Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Andrea is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 36 years old and is married with 4 children. 

Andrea splits her time between agriculture and making a Peruvian drink called chicha in her house. With the loan, she will buy livestock to raise.

Andrea appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing livestock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel B. is 53 years old and makes a living as a farmer and a local public official. He grows vegetables on a field next to his house, where he works hard to support his family's needs. He earns about PHP 400 daily, which he supplements with occasional jobs as a carpenter. Despite his hard work and enterprising nature, Joel’s income is not enough to support his family, so he has applied for a loan for PHP 7,000 to expand his farm.

Joel is happily married to Amparo B., who works as a clerk in the town's department of health. They are blessed with five children, four of whom are in college: Reychel, 23 and married; Jhon Rey, 21 and computer-technology student; Rey-Ann, 20 and a student of psychology; Reysa, 16, who is studying accounting; and Regielyn, 14 and in junior high school. The family lives in the village of Barangay Estefania Amulung,Cagayan.

Joel thanks Kiva lenders for their support and hopes he can secure the help he needs to expand his farm.

loans.use: to expand a small farm

loans.name: Marlyn Lissette

texts.es: La joven Marlyn M. se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, lleva cinco años en este negocio que inicio con una ayuda que su esposo dio para que ambos se apoyaran, producto de su trabajo de albañil. Anteriormente solo vendía por encargos como la clientela ha aumentado y no puede cumplir con los pedidos por que no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar ropa y cosmético ya en zapato invertio casi todo su dinero. Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para hacer crecer su negocio y poder sastifacer a sus compradores ya que desea aprovechar las ventas de esta época navideña que espera deje buenas ganancias. Sus meta como madre es poder tener su propia casa ya que viven en un cuarto de la mama de su esposo, que es pequeño y muy inseguro por que esta forrado con zinc una parte. Solo tiene una niña de cinco años el cual espera poder dar una vivienda digna que espera poco a poco junto a su esposo lograr construirla junto con el apoyo de la institución que espera tenerlo.
texts.en:
Marlyn M. is a young woman who has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for five years. She started her business with the help of her husband, who works as a mason. They both support one another. Marlyn previously sold only by request, but now that her clientele has grown, she does not have sufficient funds to buy clothing and cosmetics to fulfill her orders. She invested almost all of her money into buying shoes. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business and satisfy her buyers. She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to generate more sales in hopes of earning better profits.

Her goal as a mother is to have her own home. She currently lives in her mother-in-law’s house, which is small and insecure because it is partially lined with sheets of zinc. Marlyn has a five year old daughter and hopes to provide her with a decent home. Over time, she and her husband hope to build a house with the support of AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & cosmetics

loans.name: He Lives Group

texts.en: Isaac is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in the country. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Isaac operates a sawmill in his community. He is the leader of a trust bank group called He Lives. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Isaac is seated in the middle in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Sharifullah

texts.en:
Sharifullah the son of Sultan M. is 35 years old, married and the father of 5 children, three sons and two daughters. He is a professional and experienced mechanic who runs a workshop with three workers. Currently, his business income is not enough to meet his family's needs and to provide a salary to his workers. Therefore he has requested to take an individual loan of 40000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing modern and good quality equipments for his workshop. This will held Sharifullah repair cars more easily and increase his business income to meet both the needs of his own family and those of his workers' too.

He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: to purchase modern motor workshop equipment

loans.name: Xiomara Indiana

texts.es: Doña Xiomara tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada al negocio que durante varios años ah logrado la captación de clientes, ya que vende una variedad de productos como: comida, hace pupusa, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos todo lo que le genere ingreso. Procreo seis hijos, de los cuales solo uno estudia en la universidad, su esposo es comerciante de repuestos de vehículos, en donde ha recibido su apoyo para crecer en su negocio ya que comparten los gastos, también la institución en donde ha logrado junto a ella su crecimiento. Ya que ha podido vender  variedad de venta de comida, cosmético, ropa y zapatos aumentado su clientela como sus disponibilidad. Con este financiamiento quiere invertir en ropa escolar desde falda, pantalones, camisas, calcetas, zapatos así como una cocina de plancha para hacer pupusa, ella ya tiene una pero desea otra para no atrasar al cliente ya que tiene pensado ubicarse en el parque de la colonia Máximo Jerez para vender pupusa que se venden bien por se rica y baratas en nuestra capital de Managua. Ya que cosmético tiene . A futuro es poder poner un local en su casa con vitrinas para exhibir su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Xiomara is 58 years old. She has been dedicated to a number of businesses selling items such as food, pupusas, cosmetics, clothing, and shoes in order to generate income. She has raised six children, of whom one is a university student. Her husband is a merchant who sells vehicle spare parts. He provide supports to her business and helps with covering the household expenses. In addition, the Institution has helped her grow her business. Since she has been able to sell a wide variety of products, her clientele has increased as well as her available resources.

With this loan, Xiomara will purchase school clothes including skirts, pants, shirts, socks, and shoes. She will also acquire a cooking grill for preparing pupusas. She already has one, but another one is needed so that she can keep up with customer demand. Xiomara currently sells her products at the park in the Máximo Jerez division. Her pupusas sell very well because of the rich flavor and their prices are cheaper than those sold in the capital city of Managua. She also sells cosmetics at the same location. In the future, she want to equip a location in her home with display cases so that she can exhibit her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school clothing & a cooking grill

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is a businesswoman who loves her business. She sells undergarments at retail prices to her customers. In the future, she hopes to sell at wholesale prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more undergarments to sell. She says that, with her loan, she will no longer lose customers to her competitors.
Funke's husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. They have four children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old. Funke is happy because her children are excelling in their school work. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more undergarments to sell

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang S., age 36, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has no children. He buys pigs from local farmers in the province and resells them, earning a gross income of approximately US $16.60 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses. He has been in this business since 2000. 

His standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so he wants to have a loan to expand his business. S. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase more pigs to sell. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to sell

loans.name: Safari Indah Group

texts.en:
"NI NYOMAN S. (0) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of MELAYA-BALI.  NI NYOMAN is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is SAFARI INDAH (MUK-0012).


NI NYOMAN is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, NI NYOMAN owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  NI NYOMAN has been engaged in this business for over 1 years and earns approximately 500000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, NI NYOMAN joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  NI NYOMAN is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.    She is now requesting a new loan of 1500000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  NI NYOMAN plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





NI NYOMAN S. (0) merupakan 35 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA-BALI.  NI NYOMAN adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah SAFARI INDAH (MUK-0012).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak sapi untuk dijual.  NI NYOMAN sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI NYOMAN menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, NI NYOMAN bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  NI NYOMAN meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre.Se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de madera con adornos en cuero, los cuales son exportados. Labora con una empresa que se dedica a este rubro y con la ayuda de 5 colaboradores, trabaja la madera y el cuero, así logran lindos muebles que posteriormente son enviados en las cantidades solicitadas a los diferentes lugares del mundo. A José le gusta mucho su trabajo y pone todo de su parte por sacarlo adelante, y eso se ve reflejado en la cantidad de pedidos que tiene, considera que la parte difícil radica en el esfuerzo que requiere el trabajar bajo presión, pues debe entregar los pedidos en los tiempos establecidos. En el futuro quiere comprar mayor cantidad de maquinaria para ampliar  su taller y elaborar los muebles  en menor tiempo.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería en  madera y  cuero, que le hacen falta, para la elaboración de sus muebles.
texts.en:
José, age 37, lives by her mother’s side in his own house. He makes wood furniture with leather decorations, which are exported. He works with a company in this field and with the help of five other people. He works the wood and the leather. That way he makes lovely furniture, which is later sent in the requested quantities to different places in the world. José likes his work a lot, and he does everything he can to be successful. This can be reflected in the number of orders he has. The most difficult part stems from the effort that is required to work under pressure. He needs to deliver the orders on time. In the future he wants to buy more machinery to expand his shop and make more furniture in less time. This is his second loan, and he promises to be very punctual making his payments. Also, he is very grateful to all of the people who made this loan possible. It allows him to keep working. José plans to use the requested money to buy more wood and leather merchandise that he needs to make his furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and leather to make furniture

loans.name: María Confesora

texts.es:
María Confesora tiene 68 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Nueva Arica, un distrito con geografía bastante accidentada debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país, su principal actividad es la agricultura, aunque cuentan con pocas áreas fértiles, se encuentra situado a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María se dedica desD. hace 30 años a vender productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que su negocio nació D. la necesidad D. agenciarse D. un ingreso con el cual sacar adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo pocos productos y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo, su negocio ha crecido y cuenta con una clientela fija que acuD. siempre a consumir sus productos.

Ella compra productos D. primera necesidad en la ciudad D. Chiclayo y trata siempre D. ofrecer productos frescos (verduras, frutas) a sus clientes, su negocio es uno D. los mas surtidos en la zona por lo que es D. mucha ayuda para la comunidad, el distrito D. Nueva Arica es una comunidad con pocos habitantes (14 habitantes por Km2).

María Confesora desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. productos frescos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad con los cuales lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer honrada y trabajadora, ella es muy estimada en la zona donD. vive, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer D. confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Confesora, 68, lives with her family in Nueva Arica, a hilly region at the foot of the mountains of northern Peru. Her main source of income is farming, even though the area is not especially fertile. The city of Chiclayo is an hour and a half away. Maria has operated a grocery, selling everyday commodities, for 30 years. She runs the grocery out of her house. She tells us that she started the business because she needed a way to generate an income for her family. She only sold a few products at first but the business has grown, thanks to the efforts she has maD. to build it, and she can now count on an established customer base who regularly buy from her. Maria buys basic commodities in Chiclayo, always trying to find fresh produce (vegetables, fruits) for her customers. Her business is one of the best supplied in the neighborhood, a great service to her neighbors. Nueva Arica is a sparsely populated area (14 people per square kilometer). Maria Confesora wants to expand her business by buying fresh produce. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles that she wants to use toward that end. Maria is an honest and hard-working woman. She is much admired in her neighborhood and looked to by her neighbors as someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert C. is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Albert owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling some snack food, water melon, dried fish, candies etc. in the local community. Albert has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Albert joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Albert is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teodolinda Helena

texts.es:
Teodolinda Helena H. P., es casada, madre de 4 hijos, mujer de 52 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su esposo es mesero y apoya a los gastos mensuales en los que incurre la familia.

Uno de los principales problemas en los que se ha enfrentado en su labor, es la retención de los productos debido al cambio de moda, que no le permite la venta de la mercadería, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien logro ahorrar para la compra de producots que comenzaron sus días en este rubro, dentro de los principales objetivos esta la apertura de una pequeña tienda donde ofertar ropa, cosméticos y calzado, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario que aumenten las ventas y mejoren sus utilidades y favoreciendo a sus niveles de vida que beneficien a toda su familia y brinden capital de trabajo para nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Teodolinda Helena H. P. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells cosmetics, and her husband is a waiter. She contributes toward the monthly household expenses and incidentals. One of the main problems she has faced in her work is retention of the same product lines due to changing trends, which interferes with sales. It was thanks to the help of her husband, who managed to save up for the purchase of these products, that they could begin this line of work. Among Teodolinda's principal objectives is the opening of a small store where she plans to offer clothing, cosmetics and footwear for sale. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more inventory to increase sales and to improve profits. This will improve her whole family's standard of living and will bring in more working capital for new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
35-year-old Chona P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years already.

Chona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and three young children. In 2003, he started working in the construction industry by trading in cement.
He is now requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Groupe 1

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 (de l’association Yiriwaton de Cinzana Village) sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes à Cinzana village chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le sésame.
Madame Oulématou  B. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de complexe céréale et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage pour son champ de mil. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants à la foire de Cinzana Gare et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 1,50 hectares, elle espère produire 4 sacs de mil et 6 sacs de sésame. 
La production du mil est auto consommée tandis que celle du sésame est entièrement vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien.  
Madame Oulématou  B. à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe 1 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leurs foyers.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the Yiriwaton Association of Cinzana village are marrired women, mostly living in traditional families. On average, they are 42 and have three children. They all live in Cinzana village, the main settlement of a rural commune in Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and know each other through ties of kinship, marriage and neighborhood. Looking to have fertilizer available for the rainy season, they went to Soro Yiriwaso and are now in their first seasonal loan cycle. They raise peanuts, millet and sesame. Mme Oulématou B. plans on using her loan to buy a sack of cereal fertilizer and hire people for plowing and weeding. She will buy her fertilizer at the market in Cinzana Gare. and hire her help from young village people. On her 1.5 hectare farm she hopes to produce four sacks of millet and six of sesame. The millet is for home use, while the sesame will be sold to cover small day-to-day household expenses. Along with the other group members, her goal is to achieve self-sufficiency in household food supply.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pay hired help

loans.name: Bwagoga Eco Bakyara Tukwatanise, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Gladys K. is a hard working business lady. The 46 year old married mother of 6 school going children sweats her guts out selling agro produce like maize, sorghum, millet, beans, peas, ground nuts in a small rural area of Bisheshe, Ibanda. She has been doing this business for the last 6 years, which she started with her little capital from banana sales. She gets many customers who buy her products for food consumption.

She is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards, but she requires a loan that will help her buy more food supplies for the business. Then she will be able to meet the customers' demand and also get more revenue. She belongs to a group of members and they insure each other in paying back the loan.

In order to start her business, she received capital from her banana plantation and it is because of hard work that she was able to get where she is right now.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Lelita is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lelita owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer and chicken droppings to enrich his soil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman with two children who both attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family needs. She has been operating her business selling second-hand clothes for the last four years. She sells to women by going door-to-door. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of Khanga's. Her major challenges in the business are seasonality and transportation. She hopes to open a shop in the future. Lucy decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business. She lives in a rental houses with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Khanga's.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya C. est marié à une femme et n’a pas d’enfant. Il est né à Nantanso vers 1986  dans la préfecture de Sikasso, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit à Loulouni dans une famille  traditionnelle élargie.
En plus de ses activités agricoles, (car  cultive environ 5 hectares  de vivres pendant la saison des pluies) il fait le commerce depuis 5 ans Il s’est spécialisé dans l’achat vente de tasses et ustensiles de cuisine en plastique.  Il mène son commerce avec assez de réussite compte tenu de son expérience à la matière.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, le prêt antérieur a été correctement remboursé et souhaite maintenir cette relation afin de mieux  satisfaire ses clients. 
Il compte acheter avec son nouveau prêt, 6 dizaines de seaux, 5 douzaines de baignoires et 10 douzaines d'assiettes + des louches tous en plastique + 2 douzaines de bouilloires.
Il vend en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes .  
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Loulouni ville.
texts.en:
Mr Yaya C. is married with no children. He was born in Nantanso in 1986 in the Sikasso region, the third largest administrative region of Mali. He lives in Loulouni in an extended traditional family. In addition to his agricultural activities (he cultivates around 5 hectars of land during the rainy season) he has been involved in business activities for five years. He specializes in the sale of cups and plastic cooking utensils. He runs his business fairly successfully given his experience. He is on his second collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, his previous loan was successfully repaid and aims to maintain this relationship in order to better meet his customers' demands. He aims to use this loan to purchase six dozen buckets, 5 dozen bathtubs and ten dozen plates and plastic ladles, plus two dozen kettles. He sells through retail and cash sales to a customer base made up of men and women. He aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50.000 FCFA, some of which will be used to increase business funds and the rest put aside to save in order to build a house to live in, situated in the town of Loulouni.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing plastic goods

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Jahongir S. is 23 years old. He is a young married man and has one child. Jahongir has a butcher shop and has run a meat selling business for 12 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Now, Jahongir is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. It is the high season for sales now, and Jahongir wants to take advantage of it to increase his profits.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Khursheed Muhammad Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-five years ago Khursheed M. R. moved to Kasur, a city located in Punjab and known for its leather industry in Pakistan. Then a few years ago she lost her husband to a sudden death, so she is now a widow. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family. She couldn’t send her children to school due to poor financial conditions, so she taught her daughters the art of embroidery, which they now do to earn money for the family. She also has a son who runs a grocery shop in the market from which he sells daily use items to his customers.

Khursheed’s children are very obedient and mind everything she says. They respect her very much and take care of her in the way she takes care of them. They like to give her every happiness in life so she never thinks about her loss.

Khursheed has applied for a loan, her fifth from Asasah, for her son’s grocery business. He has been in this business for the past ten years. With the loan he will buy grocery items such as rice, lentils, cooking oil and spices, etc. in bulk quantity for his shop. Khursheed is hopeful that this investment will yield a positive impact on her son’s business. She herself has responsibly paid her previous loan installments every year and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk for her son's grocery shop

loans.name: Put

texts.en:
Mrs. Put S. is a married woman who lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. She was born in 1959. She and her husband, Mr. Hung Some Koem, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice and corn to sell to market in order to support their family. 

In her field,it now is infertile which it affects to her crops. To improve her crop productivity, Mrs. Put S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. 

She is the mother of a child who is a television repairer. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. M. is forty five years old. She is widowed and her daughter has also passed away. However, she takes care of her grandchild and hopes to give her a quality education  at the university level. Her business is located at a busy market known as Mwingi. Joyce is served by the Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, sorghum, cow peas and green grams for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of adequate transportation to transport the cereals to the major towns. However, she works very hard to keep her business perform well. 

She will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business. She hopes to have many business outlets and in the future, have a vehicle to transport the cereals to different parts of the country. She describes herself as aggressive, persistent, patient and strong willed.

loans.use: To buy supplies of millet, maize and beans

loans.name: Julio Eulot

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Julio; el tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el negocio que tiene el socio es un taller de estructura metálica el elabora puertas y marcos de ventanas, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo esta la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank named "My Peru". The community bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

His name is Julio. He is 42 years old, he is married, and he has 2 children. He has a blacksmith shop where he makes doors and window frames. He works together with his wife so that they together can provide for their children.

He requests a loan to purchase materials for his business. 

He is very grateful to all those who have become part of his dream and he is committed to the payment terms established for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lorena, tiene 38 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de siete y seis años ambos estudian en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.

Ella se dedica además de su hogar al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo pero nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas. También vende productos Oriflame y Sayson (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Trabaja los viernes, sábados, y domingos desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00 aunque si algún cliente quiere algo la llama y ella la recibe en su  casa ya que ahí  tiene una vitrina, sus productos  los recibe en su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niñas, además de cremas y perfumes, etc. está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son  tener un carro y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Mujeres en Acción meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo - a city commonly known as Los Reales Tamarindos - which is also the capital of the Manabi province in Ecuador.

In this city lives Lorena, a 38 year old woman with two children who lives with her partner. Her children are 6 and 7 years old, and both are in school. Her husband is a mechanic.

Apart from working at home, she sells clothes of all types. Children and women's clothers sell the best. She also sells Oriflame and Sayson products, which include beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 until 4 pm, though if a client wants to purchase something all they need to do is call and she will receive them at her house where she has a display case with all her products. 

This loan will be used to purchase clothes, above all those for women and children, in addition to creams and perfumes, etc. She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years,  and she enjoys it as through her loans she has been able to finance her business.  Her dream is to have a car and to see her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for women and children, creams, perfumes, cosmetics and other things

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj G. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house with a fence. His three children attend a local high school. 

Purevdorj operates a shoe-making business. He and his wife started their business in 1992 and have since gained much experience in shoe-making. Over the years, he has managed to establish his business into a stable operation with a customer base. 

Purevdorj wants to raise money and help his children go to university and be well-educated. Purevdorj is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase materials and supplies at a wholesale price for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies at a wholesale price

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina N. es muy esforzada ya que labora arduamente para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitacion.
Es soltera y con dos personas  a su cargo, este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL y lo solicita para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Entre los materiales se encuentran bloques, piedras canteras,cemento, perlínes y el pago de la mano de obra. Se siente muy segura de que su crédito será otorgado y así logrará sus sueños de construcción.
texts.en: Luz Marina N. has been working as an administrative sub department secretary at the National Institute of Technology (INATEC) for the past three years. She is single and has two dependants. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and she is requesting it in order to buy construction materials, including: 200 blocks at C$15.00, 50 quarry stones at C$30.00, 20 bags of cement at C$200.000, 20 beams at C$150.00, and labour at C$3,500.00.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha O. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Ros Sophal, is a rice farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tha and her husband asked for a Kiva loan several times already. Now she is requesting another loan of $400 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn M., 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Charlie M., and they have one college-aged child. With her family, she manages their household and operates their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to local neighbors. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilyn earns money by purchasing inventory at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors from the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages in order to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To expand product inventory

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members. Man was born in 1962 and is the group leader selected by the other members. 

Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has five children, two of are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other three are attending school in the local village. 

Man earns her living by making fish nets for selling. In order to support and expand her business, she is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for making fish nets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for making fish nets to sell.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is married to a mason with two children. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees. 

For the past 3 years, she has operated a dumplings sales business from home to the local residents. Priscilla faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to buy sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, a 41-year-old resident of the Agbato district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city, is married to Lazare, and they have one child who has left home. For the past 12 years Josephine has been a seamstress. This is her sixth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in cloth sales.

loans.use: to purchase bolts of cloth and sewing material

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée à un sociologue, Yawa a un(01) enfant et est âgée de 40ans. Elle fait du jus de bissap de citron et d’ananas.  C’est depuis 2008 qu’elle a commencé l’activité, Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend dans sa maison. Une(01) personne l’aide à faire du jus pour vendre. Elle a payé le premier prêt sans aucune difficulté et elle est à sa seconde demande pour acheter 02 sacs de riz, 10 sacs de bissap et 05 sacs de citron. Elle veut vendre du jus pour avoir du profit et s’occuper  en partie du foyer.
texts.en:
Yawa is 40 years old, has one child and is married to a sociologist. She makes bissap (dried hibiscus flower), lemon and pineapple juice, a business which she started in 2008. She obtains her supplies in Lomé and sells in front of her house. She is assisted by one person in making the juice.

Yawa repaid her first loan with no problems and is requesting a second to buy 2 bags of rice, 10 sacks of bissap and 5 bags of lemons. She wants to sell juice in order to make a profit and take care of part of the household responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 10 bags of bissap and 5 bags of lemons

loans.name: Kerly Alejandra

texts.es:
Kerly de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora que inspira salir adelante con su hijo de tres años que se dedico a la venta de morocho y de ropa a por mayor.

Ella labora todo los días en la venta de morocho con ayuda de sus padres ya que es un trabajo familiar y para tener ingresos adicionales vende ropa sola recorriendo todo el sector. Visitando a sus clientes y a la vez haciendo sus cobranzas. Vende camisas, pantalones, interiores tec. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para adecuar su cas y así tener una mayor comodidad y darle lo mejor su hijo. Tambien desea comprar ropa y maquillajes para mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Kerly is 21 years old and she is a young enterprising woman who aspired to come out ahead with her three-year old son, so she decided to sell corn chowder and clothing in wholesale.

She works every day selling corn chowder with her parents' help, especially since it is a family business. As an additional source of income she sells clothing by traveling throughout the sector. She visits her clients and at the same time she takes payments. She sells shirts, pants, undergarments, etc. With the loan she wants to purchase construction materials to remodel her house improve their comfort and to give her son only the best. She also wants to purchase clothing and cosmetics to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, and construction materials.

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en: Irshaad lives in Kasur, which is known for its tanneries industry. She has been living in the area of Azhar colony in a two-room brick house with her family. She has given birth to three sons. Her eldest son is 20 years old and makes chikhs (an Urdu language word). Chikhs are used for shelter against heat and sunshine and are made from bamboos. Her second son is an embroidery expert while the youngest one is 9 years old and studying in the third class. Irshaad is a widow and lost her husband a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her, but she never lost heart and raised her children. Now her children are earning well for her. She is a very caring mother and does her household tasks at home. Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her eldest son wants to improve his chikhs making business. With this loan, he will buy bamboos and ropes in larger quantity which will help him fulfill clients' orders on time and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for 10 years and Irshaad is confident that his business will further expand after making an investment in it. Irshaad is a new loan applicant; this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is hopeful that it will help her son improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bamboos and ropes for a business making chikhs (used for shelter against heat and sunshine).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells onions, beans and rice. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. One of her children goes to school.

Rose borrowed a loan to stock more onions, beans and rice to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with her extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more onions, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda, tiene 50 años de edad, es originaria de Limay municipio de Estelí, esta casada, tiene 6 hijos, ella es comerciante es dueña de una pulpería. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta y elaboración de rosquilla, esto lo hizo por 20 años, este trabajo era muy pesado para ella así que decidió poner una pulpería en su casa, lleva 5 años de tener este negocio. Su esposo la ayuda con los ingresos que le obtiene por cuidar un estadio.   
Solicito el préstamo para surtir su venta, comprar inventario tales como arroz, pan, azúcar, frijoles, huevo, leche. Con esta inversión espera abastecer su pulpería de nuevos y mejores productos que le ayuden a mejorar sus ventas, hacer nuevos clientes, pues su expectativa es hacer crecer su negocio, tiene como meta mejorar la infraestructura de su pulpería, comprar nuevos estantes y una refrigeradora.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 50 years old and comes from Limay - a town in Estelí.  She is married and has six children.

Bernarda owns a grocery store.  She used to make and sell 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut) and was in that business for 20 years.  The work was very hard so she decided to set up a grocery store in her home.  She has owned this business for five years.  Bernarda's husband helps her with the income he makes looking after a stadium.

Bernarda requested this loan to stock her business.  She will buy merchandise such as rice, bread, sugar, beans, eggs and milk.  With this loan, she hopes to be able to stock her grocery store with new and better products which will help her to improve her sales and attract new customers, since her hope is to grow her business.  Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her store and to buy new shelves and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, bread, sugar, beans, eggs and milk

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es   conviviente y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar.  Estudió solo hasta 4to de primaria.
Junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, huevos, etc.,  su préstamo anterior de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio.  Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez cajas de galletas de toda marca, veinte paquetes de gaseosas, una caja de huevo y chocolates diversos.  
Su sueño es mejorar su tienda y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the “Virgen de Concepción” community bank which is located in Ayrumas Carumas, in Acora district, in Puno province and department.  She is 49 years old, lives with her partner, and has three school age children.  She only studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Together with her husband, Agripina sells candies, soda, cookies, eggs, etc.  Her previous loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested it in her business.  She has been a member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy ten boxes of cookies of different brands, twenty packets of soda, a crate of eggs and a range of chocolates.

Agripina's dream is to improve her store and thereby also improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining the loans and also the savings.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of cookies of different brands, twenty packets of soda and candies

loans.name: Felipe Nery

texts.es: Felipe Nery es un pequeño productor de café, tiene 53 años de edad, tiene un hijo y junto a el y a su esposa vive en la Comunidad de Rio Blanco. Don Felipe inició como cuidador en una finca de café y como ha sido un tanto curioso, él siempre estuvo pendiente de las actividades que realizaban los mozos de campo. Así que luego de un tiempo pasó al campo a trabajar y lo hizo por varios años, adquiriendo la experiencia necesaria para crear su propia finca. Actualmente Don Felipe trabaja su propio cultivo de 3 manzanas de tierra y ya lleva 4 años haciendolo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm. Este es su primer prestamo y con el comprará abono y pagará la chapia, y con esto podrá darle mayor y mejor mantenimiento al cultivo y por ende su produccion será de mejor calidad. La dificultad que hasta el momento habia pasado es que por ser un pequeño productor y por la zona donde reside ninguna institucion lo habia apoyado con financiamiento. Su meta es cultivar mas plantas y ampliar su produccion para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe Nery is a small-scale coffee farmer.  He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and son in Rio Blanco community.  Felipe started out looking after a coffee plantation and, as he was curious, he was always watching the work that the farm workers carried out.  After a while, he moved to working in the fields.  He did this for several years, acquiring the experience he needed to set up his own plantation.  

Felipe currently works on his own crops, which are planted over 3 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land, and he has been doing this for four years.  He works from 6.00am to 2.00pm.

This is Felipe's first loan and he will use it to buy manure and pay somebody to chop down weeds with a machete.  This will enable him to provide his crops with more and better care. Consequently, he will enjoy a better quality production.  The difficulty that Felipe has had up to now is that, owing to the fact that he is a small-scale producer and owing to the area where he lives, no institution has supported him with financing.  His goal is to grow more plants and expand his production so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosie has a food shop that sells snacks like waffles, rice sweets, roasted hotdogs and homemade sausage. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed in making snacks.

Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed in making snacks.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 26 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have one child aged four and she lives with her grandmom. For the past eight years Bendu has been selling flour, beans and rice in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, beans and rice for her business. She hopes to have her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, beans and rice for her business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a mason and a farmer in Kisii town, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for 15 years with his farm producing maize, tea, tomatoes and vegetables. He is married with 10 children, with 8 still in school

Samson has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and a dairy cow. He says the business will educate his children. He is also planning to purchase more land to facilitate expansion.

He points at animal diseases and poor markets as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a water tank

loans.name: Aliheydar

texts.ru: Aliheydar rodilsya v 1987 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aliheydar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec i korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov i ovec dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Aliheydar was born in 1987.  He is single and does not have children.  Aliheydar lives in the Baku region together with his parents.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years and breeds cattle and sheep.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and sheep for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep for resale

loans.name: Julio Omario

texts.es:
Julio Omario tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Julio se dedica a la siembra de cacao, soya y a la crianza de chanchos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de chancho y para comprar de alimento para ellos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la alimentacion de chancho y asi tener mejor ganancia. Enfrentan desafios por la competencia en precios. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y construir una vivienda.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
28-year old Julio Omario is single and has no children. He lives alone in Chillanes Canton, in the province of Bolivar.

His community bank is called El Placer and is part of Chillanes Canton, in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, located 60 minutes from the main office. In this branch there are 24 members, all of whom work in agriculture. They grow bananas, rice, yucca, cocoa, soya, and oranges. As well they raise animals.

Julio grows cocoa and soya, and also raises pigs and then sells them. He buys them in San Jose del Tambo, and sells them in Chillanes market on Sundays. 

He is seeking a loan to buy pigs and feed. The money will help him to improve the quality of the food he gives the pigs and thus earn more profit when he sells them. The biggest problem he faces is the number of people selling pigs who all compete on prices. His dream is to remain healthy so he can carry on working and build a house. In his free time Julio enjoys going for walks with his parents.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Santiago De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Santiago es un señor de 44 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde hace varios años que Santiago tiene este negocio de actividad agrícola, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con la propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Santiago está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de semillas de maracuyá. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Santiago es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
44-year old Santiago lives with his wife and children in the community of Upala de San Carlos in the province of Alajeula. There are five national parks, a reserve for wild animals, five protected areas, and several forest reserves in Alajeula. In addition, there is the Juan Santamaría Museum where locally made crafts are exhibited. The area is the most important in the country for the production of coffee and sugar cane.

Santiago has had his farm for several years on land that he inherited from his parents. He cannot afford to invest in his farm and make it more productive. He thinks the organization's plan to lend money is very interesting and will benefit both himself and his neighbours. 

Santiago is seeking a loan of 500,000 colones to buy passionfruit seeds. In this way he hopes to increase production on his farm and also improve his own and his family's standard of living.

He is a member of the Delirio Community Bank, one of 110 organizations run by EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan. He hopes to continue to develop both on a personal and a financial level, and he plans also to participate actively in organizing loans within his community.

loans.use: to buy passionfruit seeds

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling from her home to neighbours and passersby.  She faces the major challenge of high cost transportation in her business.  Shida dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and green vegetables.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, 48 years old, is a farmer and animal feeder and earns $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day. This couple has four children, two are studying, one is working and earns $2.5 per day and one more is only five years old. Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $10 on electricity, $35 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work. She also wants to buy a threshing machine for a new career at home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work

loans.name: Thoa
