texts.en: Thoa is 30 years old. She is married with two children. They are still small. She not only grows rice but also sells pork in the market. She has been doing this for two years. She earns a monthly income of about VND 4,000,000. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. Now she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Luzalva

texts.es: Con su credikiva Lusalva compró materias primas y confeccionó vestidos infantiles, que vendió a crédito e invirtió sus utilidades en su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará telas, encajes, forros, porque tiene encargos de ropa para vestir a los niños en las épocas navideñas, en las cuales sus padres se sienten felices de que luzcan vestidos nuevos confeccionados por Lusalva. Ella  envía saludos de agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y espera que la sigan apoyando, ya que le han permitido incrementar su liquidez, ventas y utilidades.
texts.en:
Luzalva used her previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials to make children's clothes which she sold on credit.  She invested her profits in her business.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy fabrics, lace and linings because she has orders from people who want to dress their children for the Christmas season.  Parents feel happy when their children look good in their new clothes which have been made by Luzalva.  

Luzalva sends grateful greetings to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and hopes that they continue supporting her as they have enabled her to increase her cash-flow, sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace and linings because she has orders for children's clothing

loans.name: Dotou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DOTOU est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clémentine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clémentine est âgée de 28 ans, et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Éric. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémentine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Clémentine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis trois ans, Clémentine vend des chaussures et des savons dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses enfants. Clémentine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la sixième fois que Clémentine et les autres membres du groupe DOTOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DOTOU Group is made up of three persons who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Clémentine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 28 years old and married to a welder named Eric.

The couple has two school-attending children, whom they have to support. Clémentine lives together with her husband and their children. She never attended school.

For three years, Clémentine has been selling shoes and soaps in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

This is the sixth time that Clémentine and the other members of DOTOU Group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand.

Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soaps and shoes

loans.name: Benendeta

texts.en:
Benendeta is a focused business woman. She is 37 years old, single, and blessed with three children who are in school. She has been running a cereal shop for the last ten years to support her family. She also farms to earn more income. 

Benendeta is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize, beans, and peas for resale. She describes her business as busy, since her customers are the local residents. In the next 5 years, she plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухроб потомственный пекарь. Его отец тоже работает пекарем. У них свой лепешечный цех. Их лепешки знамениты и востребованы в городе. Более пяти лет он тоже занимается данным бизнесом. Сухроб женат и имеет одного ребенка. Для продвижения своего бизнеса он хочет получить займ. Выпечка лепешек приносит удовольствие и радость. Ведь если дома насыщенный хлеб, значит все хорошо. Он хотел бы получить займ  в размере 10 000 сомони для оптового закупа муки и угля. Он надеется в вашей поддержке в получении займа
texts.en: Suhrobjon comes from a family of bakers and operates a flatbread bakery with his father. Their flatbreads are famous and in demand in the city. Suhrobjon has been in this business for over five years. He is married and has a child. In order to advance his business, Suhrobjon would like to obtain a loan. Baking flatbreads is fun and rewarding. After all, if there is good bread in the house, then all is well. Suhrobjon would like to receive a loan of 10000 somoni to make a bulk purchase of flour and coal. He is hoping for your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura is 56 years old. He lives in a small village of the South Tajikistan with his wife and 4 children.  The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. He feeds cattle. Jura feeds 6 cows and 4 sheep. His wife and children help him with managing business. His income is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop business but he has not money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from profit improve living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle and from profit improve living condition

loans.name: Bekhal's Group

texts.en:
Bekhal is a member of this group from Iraq. Bekhal is 29 years old widow and has two children  . After her husband death, Bekhal became the sole supporter for her fatherless children. She started her own business and bought an old sewing machine and started sewing clothes for women and children.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy new sewing machine ,over sewing machine ,iron and fabric  to help her increase her income.
She is aiming to grow her business and provide best life to her orphaned children.
The story of Bekhal and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Bekhal's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy new sewing machine ,over sewing machine ,iron and fabric.

loans.name: Donatienne

texts.fr: Donatienne âgée de 34 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Donatienne est mariée à un commerçant du nom de François. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Donatienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Donatienne vend depuis quinze ans de façon ambulante, des épices et divers autres produits. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Donatienne achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Donatienne sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des épices et divers produits.

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en:
Rubaba is a refugee from the occupied Aghdam region of Azerbaijan since 1993. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-children. 

As all refugees at that time she came up with the problem of covering family needs for clothes, school, msdication ets.


Rubaba rears 2 cows that yield a total of 20 litres of milk daily. She sells milk at the central market in Sumqayit city. She also sells cheese, sour cream, kefir, cottage cheese in the market.

Now Rubaba applies for $500 to buy one more cow, to make some changes in her working place and expand her business. Rubaba is looking forward to the kind participation of Kiva lenders in increasing her capital and giving her a push towards the better life.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow and expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Christine Njeri Ndungu intends to buy a dairy cow and buy 20 bags of cereals and other household goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaide has lived in her home for more than 12 years. Her biggest problem is that when it rains water comes in through the windows and the front porch gets flooded. It also causes a dampness problem, since she has a sick child and the dampness harms his health too much. She is requesting a loan of $700 to be able to make repairs on her home before the rainy and cold seasons come.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Adelaida T. tiene ya mas de 12 años viviendo en esta casa su gran problemas es que cuando llueve se le trasmite el agua por las ventanas y en el patio de enfrente se la inunda de agua es un problema con la humedad ya que tiene un hijo enfermo y la humedad le afecta demasiado a su salud, ella esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 700.00 para poder reparar su vivienda antes que se venga la temporada de lluvias y frió.

loans.use: Waterproof her home and make repairs

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: “I sell animal skins and fodder as well as trading livestock. I am lucky enough to have a piece of land that I can use to keep my animals and would like $246 to purchase additional fodder to sell in the local market. My husband is only seasonally employed as we live in a small town where there isn’t much work to go around. I have five children, three of which are in government school. I make about $3 to $5 per day. Your loan will help me increase my family’s income.”

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mudayani

texts.id:
Mudayani's Husband's salary as Ojek is insufficient to cover her family's expenses. This has prompted her to find alternative to increase their household income. She decided to become a seller. She chosen this, because she felt that the turnover is fast. She invested her savings of Rp. 450.000 as capital and operated her stall at Gilimanuk Port.Mudayani start selling from 8am till 3am because during those time many people waits to board the ship. She manage to earn about Rp. 20.000 per day. With the help from DINARI, Mudayani hopes to increase her selection of items that she sells. She also intend to buy new furniture to make her stall look more attractive to customers.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suami Mudayani sebagi Ojek ( jasa transportasi dengan sepeda motor ) dirasa kurang bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Hal itu memacu Mudayani untuk mencari mencari usaha lain untuk menambah penghasilan keluarganya. Usaha yang dipilih Mudayani adalah sebagai Dagang Asongan ( menjual aneka makanan dan minuman ). Hal itu dipilihnya karena perputaran uangnya cepat, sehingga modalnya bisa diputarnya kembali. Bermodalkan uang tabungannya yang sebesar Rp. 450.000.-, Mudayani membuka usahanya di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Mudayani mulai berjualan dari pukul 8 pagi sampai pukul 3 pagi, karena pada jam – jam tersebut banyak penumpang yang berdatangan untuk menunggu naik ke kapal laut. Dalam sehari, Mudayani mampu mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 20.000.- per hari. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Mudayani berencana untuk menambah jenis dagangannya sehingga lebih banyak pilihan. Mudayani juga berencana untuk membeli rak dan toples yang lebih baik, sehingga dagangannya kelihatan lebih menarik dan akan menarik minat pelanggan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan - Stock up inventory of tidbits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
SOPHIA, age 26, is the owner of "Teddy Salon," which was named after her sister. Living at home with her mother, 8-year-old daughter, and 17-year-old orphaned niece, Sopia helps to support her home through the profits of her 2-year-old business. Before opening the salon, Sophia worked for two years providing hairdressing services from within her home. Now, with her own salon, she is able make around $36 a day, or more, depending on the season. From a small previous loan, Sophia was able to pay the rent and cover general expenses. Now, having successfully paid this back, she hopes to take out another loan to buy hair treatments and accessories to expand her services.

Sophia belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”), which consists of 36 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy hair treatments and accessories to expand salon services

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es:
Ms. Marta Iris O. Guzman is a 41 year old woman from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Mr. Margarito Torres, and they have 4 older children. Ms. O. has been able to pay for the studies of her children thanks to the earnings from her business. She owns a stand where she sells cheese and cream, and she has more than 20 years of experience in this business. Her clients are parents and the supervisors that work in the judicial system and the hospital. At this point Ms. O. needs to buy 298 pounds of cheese (at $1/pound) and 80 pounds of cream (at $0.65/pound) with which she will be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marta Iris O. G. tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Margarito Torres, ambos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, cabe señalar que a la Sra. O. a podido pagar los estudios de sus hijos con el ingreso de su negocio. La Sra. O. es propietaria de un tramo donde vende queso y crema, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, sus clientes son los padres de familia, los encargados del Sistema Judicial, los encargados del Hospital. En estos momentos la Sra. O. necesita comprar 298 libras de queso a $1.00 dólar la libra y 80 libras de crema a $0.65 centavos dólar la libra con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de las instituciones y de los padres de familia.

loans.use: To buy cheese and cream

loans.name: Abdurahmanova

texts.en: Abdurahmanova G. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has a child. She decided to become the client of the MicroInvest because she watched the successful business development thanks to the MicroInvest loan procedure. Now she is the client of the MicroInvest and she trusts completely its loan procedures. Mrs. Abdurahmanova started her business many years ago but she has not had investment opportunities so she was ready to stop her business. But by taking the loan in MicroInvest she improved the business terms and opened a trade outlet in the food bazaar. She provided  new goods and now she has a wide-side assortment (cultured milk products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc.). Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity she has repeat customers and works with the regular suppliers. She works with the clients of  different income levels. Now Mrs. Abdurahmanova requests a loan for $650 for the business development that will improve her business income and permit her to plan to start a new business.

loans.use: for the business development

loans.name: Alicia's Group

texts.en:
Alicia, Maruja, and Pelaya are members of the community bank “Empecemos”. Alicia and Pelaya have been belonged to the bank for two years. Maruja joined just four months ago. In that time they learned about punctuality, responsibility, and how to manage their businesses. In addition, they have learned about self-esteem and family relationships.

Alicia is 33 years old. She is married and has four daughters. Alicia sells children’s clothing. Once per month she travels to nine hours to the city of Lima to buy products and then sells them from her home.

Maruja is 25 years old. She is married and has two sons. Maruja has been selling cosmetic products to her friends and family for one year. Previously, she sold fruit but this required a large degree of travel and time away from her family.

Pelaya is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Pelaya buys grains in the city of Ayacucho and sells them at a regional three hours away. From this market she buys a variety of fruits and sells them in Ayacucho.

Alicia, Maruja, and Pelaya need loans of 400, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to start selling shoes, buy cosmetics, wheat, barley, corn, and fruit.

One of the key aspects of the community business is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Alicia, Maruja, and Pelaya plan to use their savings to improve their homes, and pay unexpected expenses. Their dreams are to be powerful as a woman, own a store, continue to progress forward, and see their children have a better life.

loans.use: Alicia, Maruja, and Pelaya need loans of 400, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to start selling shoes, buy cosmetics, wheat, barley, corn, and fruit.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Mrs Aïssatou D. is married and a member of the Ngollar Village Bank. She buys wood and pays for the labor to turn it into charcoal, which she then sells. She has been a customer of the program for five and a half years and has always respected her commitments. Her income enables her to provide for the needs of her family and buy livestock. To pursue her business activity, Aissatou is requesting a 12th loan that she plans to repay after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Aïssatou D., mariée, membre du Banc villageois de Ngollar.Elle achète du bois et paie la main d'oeuvre pour la fabrique du charbon qu'elle vend.Elle est cliente du programme depuis 5 ans et demie et a toujours respecté ses engagements.Ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir au besoin de sa famille et de s'acheter du bétail. Pour poursuivre son activité, Aissatou sollicite ce 12ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance

loans.use: To buy wood and labor

loans.name: Fusi Safotulafai Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 5 women of Fusi Safotulafai Centre on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments, and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Motu Mataitoga T., 49, is married with 7 children. She is entering the taro business. Her family has a history of farming but not for sale. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a filing, and 2,500 taro roots.

Tufaiga A., 35, is married to a farmer and has 6 children. She and her husband have farmed a taro plantation for over 5 years. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a bush knife, a filing, and an axe. She plans to earn 120 Tala (~48 USD) per week in net cash flow by selling her taro at the Salelologa market.

Faasalafa V., 48, is married with 4 children. She and her husband have farmed a taro plantation for over 3 years. With her loan, she will purchase pesticides, a bush knife, and a spade. She plans to earn 300 Tala (~120 USD) per week in net cash flow by selling her taro at the Salelologa market.

Silia S., 59, has 2 children and is married to a farmer. She is starting a business selling pancakes (deep fried pieces of dough) and ice cakes (ice cream). With her loan, she will purchase 2 bags of flour, 2 bags of sugar, 2 bags of yeast, 2 cans of cooking oil, and 4 plastic cups. She will sell her food 5 days a week in her village, at the school and to passersby.

Eleoupu P., 43, is married with 4 children. She has over 2 years of experience in taro farming. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a knife, and a filing, and also hire 5 workers.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for taro farming, including weed killer, pesticides, tools, and taro roots

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna is very dedicated to her guinea pig farm, which she implemented in her house over nine years ago, starting at first to use for her own consumption. Later, after noticing the interest, she increased her capacity and invested capital into acquiring more guinea pigs. She fills orders for her demanding customer base, and they are used during festivities. Her wish is to get ahead and, for this reason, she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna, está muy dedicada a su granja D. cuyes implementada en su casa hace más D. 9 años y que en sus inicios fue para consumo propio, después D. darse cuenta D. su acogida aumentó su capacidad D. crianza y su capital D. inversión para adquirir más cuyes. ElL. cubre pedidos D. acuerdo a su más exigente clienteL., y estos son utilizados en ambientes festivos. Su deseo es seguir adelante y por ello solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 41-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Suzanne makes handicrafts. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Isabel Jamisse

texts.pt:
Isabel Jamisse M. is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children with ages of 25, 22, 16, and 12. The oldest is already together with someone and lives in her home. Isabel studied until the 12th grade and stopped going when her husband passed away. She has taken the value she got from her studies and passed it on to her children.

Isabel never moved from the city. She was born and raised in the city of Maputo and has her own home. She is an official of the state and works for the Municipal Council in the city of Maputo.

This is her first loan through Hluvuku which she discovered through some coleagues that were already clients for some time. She intends to pay back the loan before maturity so she can request another loan to refurbish two other homes for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Isabel Jamisse M. Tem 47 anos de idade. É viuva e mae de 4 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 25 anos, o segundo com 22 anos, o terceiro com 16 anos e quarto com 12 anos de idade. O primeiro ja se junto e vive na sua casa. Isabel estudou até 12ªclasse e deixou de continuar quando faleceu o seu marido. Tendo levado os valores que custearia os estudos dela para custear os estudos dos filhos. Isabel nunca mudou se de cidade, nasceu e cresceu na cidade de Maputo e tem casa própria. Isabel é funcionaria do estado e trabalha no conselho municipal da cidade de maputo. Este é o primeiro empréstimo e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que já são clientes a muito tempo. Isabel pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro emprestimo para reabiliatr outras duas casa para os seus filhos.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 30 years,She is a married woman with 4 children ages between 9 and 2. She is a charcoal and clothes since seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Pili now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Chiên năm nay 48 tuổi gia đình chị hiện có 4 con trong đó có hai con đã  trưởng thành. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, sau đó nhận thấy công việc kinh doanh dịch vụ ăn uống cũng có thể đem lại thu nhập cao nên các vòng vốn sau gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh cửa hàng ăn.  Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị Chiên đều đang kinh doanh cửa hàng ăn và kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà tại gia đình. Với thái độ phục vụ nhiệt tình cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được lượng khách ngày một đông. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn của cửa hàng công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình cũng có nhiều thuận lợi. Với thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi và kinh doanh  kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
This year Ms. Nguyen Thi C. is 48 years of age; her family consists of 4 children, 2 of which are grown. She has been a part of this organization, using her first initial loan to invest in livestock. After raising farm animals, she realized that the restaurant business would bring in and improve the family’s income. Since then, she has been borrowing subsequent loans in which she used to invest in a restaurant. Presently, Ms. C. and her husband both run the family's restaurant while raising pigs and chickens at the same time. The restaurant is known for providing good customer service and the number of people coming in to eat is growing every day. Any leftover food from the restaurant is used to feed her livestock. The family income has improved and since been stable from both businesses of raising farm animals and running a restaurant. She is requesting a loan of 20.000.000d in which she plans to use to expand her restaurant and her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business and rasing

loans.name: Mayra Judith

texts.es:
La señorita Mayra A. está tramitando una casa por medio de infonavit pero le está haciendo falta una diferencia para que le entrege la casa.

Ella vive con su mama la casa en donde viven se las tenían prestada pero hace unos meses se las pidieron; pero las rentas de casa están muy altas para ellas así que mejor decidieron utilizar su ahorro Infonavit y así mejor pagar su propio patrimonio de ellas dos.

Mayra trabaja en una compañía en el puesto de ventas esté es su ingreso familiar del de pende ella y su mama. Solicita un préstamo de $600.00 dlls para el enganche de su casa y así tener un patrimonio para su mama y ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Mayra Alfara is arranging a house through Infonavit but she lacks the difference to obtain a house. (Infonavit is a Mexican government program that provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.) She lives with her mother and the house in which they live in was lent to them but it has been several months since it was asked for, but rents on houses are really high for them so they decided to use their Infonavit savings and pay for their own property for the two of them. Mayra works in a company in the position of sales; this is the family income that she and her mother depend on. She asks for a loan of US $600 for the down payment of her house so she can have a property for her mother and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference in a down payment to acquire a house through Infonavit.

loans.name: Djita

texts.fr: Djita D., 46 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés). Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Djita D., 46, married and raising 7 children, has been a member of the village bank of "Samba 15 ans 1" for 6 years. She wants to bolster her business selling thioub (hand-dyed cloth). Her income allows her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that wil be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of hand-dyed cloth

loans.name: Worlanyo Kwadzo

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Worlanya Kwadzo est né le 20 septembre 1976 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants.  Il a pour activité la vente des sachets en plastique dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1990 et il a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plusieurs types de sachets. Avec ce nouveau stock il pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Worlanya Kwadzo A. was born on 20 September 1976 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is married and is the father of three (3) children. His primary business is the sale of re-usable plastic shopping bags in the Agoè district in northern Lomé. He started this business in 1990, and he has lots of experience in this field. This first loan he is asking for will allow him to buy several types of bags. With this new stock, he will be able to sell better and realize higher profits.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell multiple-use plastic shopping bags

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sr. Juana tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, estado civil casada su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad,  tiene una hija de 11 años de edad. Sus planes para su familia es construir su casa por completa. Doña Juana posee su pequeño negocio de venta de nacatamales, chicharrón y leña desde hace veinte años, inicio vendiendo solamente leña después fue adquiriendo más capital y invirtiendo en otros productos y elaborando los nacatamales. Los cuales sale a vender en un carretón jalado de dos caballos para vender mas,  Sus metas para el negocio a corto plazo es aumentar el volumen de venta y captar nuevos clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materia prima para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias a si como captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and lives in Managua’s Hialeah neighborhood with her husband and their 11 year old daughter. Juana’s husband works in security services. The family plans to finish building their house. For 20 years Juana has had a small business selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales), chicharrón (pork rind), and firewood. When she started her business she only sold firewood, but later she acquired more capital and began investing in other products and making nacatamales. Juana goes to sell her nacatamales in a cart pulled by two horses, which allows her to sell more. Her short-term business goal is to increase her sales volume and attract new customers. Thanks to a loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, Juana will be able to purchase ingredients for making nacatamales. This will allow her to increase her sales, earn higher profits, and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for making nacatamales

loans.name: Niem

texts.en: Mrs. P., 27 years old, works in the fish business. She buys fish from the local fishermen and re-sells them for a profit. She delivers the fish to her customers' homes by bicycle. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn is 28 years old and works as a rice farmer. P. grows rice with her husband during the rainy and dry season. To gain a higher rice yield, P. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer. With the remaining money, she will put towards rental fees for farmland plowing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D.  is married and the mother of six children. Through hard work, Mary has supported her eldest to complete a training program in tailoring, one is in the senior high school while her other children are is still in the primary level in school. Mary resides in Offinso with her family. 
She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition to her food, Mary also sells bananas in the market square where she lives. She has been in the food business for the past 14years. Mary hopes to receive a loan of $425 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs.She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is 47 years old and married with 8 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar P. is an ice-cream seller in Kraing Raong village in Takeo province. Since this business is going well, he wants to sell it door to door so he decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his ice-cream. His wife, Mrs. Som Yang, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living.

Mr. Sar P. is 33 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study because that child is four years old. Mr. Sar P.’s wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his ice-cream to sell door to door

loans.name: Batsayhan

texts.en:
Batsayhan B. is 42, married and the father of two. His family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His spouse, Sarantsetseg, is unemployed and stays at home. Batsayhan's eldest daughter is a university student, and his youngest attends elementary school. 

In 2005, Batsayhan started his retail business along with a taxi service. When he began his business, he had only one vehicle and drove it himself. From his profit, he has been able to buy two more cars, which he rents out to other taxi drivers. 

His daily income per car is around 12,000 tugrug ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT), and his monthly income can reach over 1 million tugrug. With this loan, he will buy a refrigerator for his home. Batsayhan is a hard-working person who wishes a happy life for his two daughters.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita C. has industriously nurtured her farm. She grows rice to support her needs and her five children. She started farming in 1990 using her own lot, which she inherited from her parents. She loves farming a lot. She enjoys working under the heat of the sun, touching the clay loam and wet soil in order to feed and clothe her family well.

The purpose of her loan from CEVI (KIVA partner in the Philippines) is to buy fertilizers for her farm. She believes that the soil has to be treated to have a better harvest. The loan will truly help Amelita increase her yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that was organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI has reached out to a lot of people to start their own businesses. It not only provides loans but also gives training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua F. started her trading business two years ago in Mankessim, the town where she lives in the central region of Ghana. Afua prepares and serves very tasty and good quality smoked fish to her customers and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots and green peppers at the community market and sometimes she sells the leftovers through street hawking. She is 28 years-old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Until now she has not been able to get extra funds to help grow her business.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of assorted fishes and vegetables so she can increase her sales and profits to better support the education of her child. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fish and vegetables for her market stand.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita B. is a rice grower. She is 48 years old and has five children. She and her husband have been tilling the land together. They do it as a labor of love to feed and clothe their children. Aside from farming, she wants to have a store. She plans to sell variety of goods in their small barrio to supplement their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. The loan will also help her to get started in the new business. 

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Dzifa D. est une femme de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside  à Womé. Dzifa désire avec ce crédit ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale, un commerce qu’elle a tant rêvé réalisé. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il faut noter que la vue est prise dans un petit jardin qu’elle tient non loin de sa maison.
texts.en:
Dzifa D. is a 36-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She resides in Womé. She would like to use this loan to open a general store, a business she has dreamed of having so very much. She is counting on this opportunity to change her family’s living conditions. It should be noted that the snapshot was taken in a small garden she has, not far from her house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease a store and to stock it

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
S. Mahkam is 25 years old and he lives in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. He is engaged, as are many in Istaravshan, in the livestock business and milk processing. In addition, he trades in house wares in the local bazaar. In summer time, he trades in melons. He has been a repeat client of MicroInvest since 2007. He is happy to continue his co-operation with “Arvand”. Mahkam is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ for two months for the seasonal melon business, importing and selling big melons. He thanks KIVA for small business development and entrepreneur support. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal melons

loans.name: Yesu Tease Group

texts.en:
Philomena, a 28-year-old petty trader, is divorced with one son. Currently her child is in school. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to her home. She is a used clothing and soap seller. Selling used clothing is a very big market in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created a market for many women.

Philomena has been in this business for the past two years. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and detergent to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her child's future and also to rent a store.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Tease’ which literary means 'God lives'. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and soap

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050040) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 08 (8).


T. is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beef products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.006.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201050043) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.600.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050045) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (20201050048) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


4.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20201050070) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050040) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t bò trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 6000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần T. để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201050043) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050045) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (20201050048) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20201050070) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Masi

texts.en:
"Masi U. (0) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Faala 2.  She is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Masi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Masi has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Masi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Masi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Masi is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Masi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 65 years old and married with 8 children.She sells tubers of yam in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Con Vision (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres con Visión  está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del País, tiene un clima frío, además cuenta con  muchos lugares turísticos naturales y arquitectónicos haciéndole una ciudad muy hermosa, su gente  es muy cálida y amable. 

Este Banco está formado por un grupo de mujeres que viven por diferentes partes de la urbe cuencana,  son damas muy unidas que buscan día a día la superación personal y de su familia siendo un pilar fundamental en la economía de sus hogares.

La señora Patricia Leonor P. V. es una socia muy carismática del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector Pampas del Cebollar, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y concibió tres hijos de 21, 18, 14 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el Instituto Misael Acosta, el segundo en la Universidad de Cuenca y su último hijo se encuentra aún en el colegio Técnico Salesiano,  su esposo trabaja como agente vendedor, fruto de su esfuerzo llegaron a construir su casa propia.

Patricia tiene una ferretería desde hace cuatro años, teniendo días buenos como malos pero nos comenta que siempre hay que confiar en Dios y tratar de salir adelante, y espera superarse cada día más.

Ella mantiene  una buena relación con todas las compañeras de su banco comunal formando un gran equipo de trabajo,  lleva un año y medio trabajando con su banco  y nos comenta que los créditos recibidos le han permitido comprar mercadería para su negocio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le entregue va a invertir en la compra de acabados para la construcción y otros materiales que le hacen falta  para incrementar su ferretería y ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es viajar y conocer las encantadoras Islas Galápagos.

La señora Blanca Azucena L. P. es otra socia activa del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector el Otorongo, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal concibió 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en la escuela Luisa de Jesús, en tanto que su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en una empresa privada, mantienen una buena relación conyugal compartiendo responsabilidades, aún no cuentan con casa propia.

Blanca  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres desde hace cuatro años y nos cuenta que le va bien que al menos le sale para pagar los gastos del arriendo y un pequeño porcentaje para seguir ampliando su negocio, 

Todas las socias del banco se llevan  muy bien  entre ellas, Blanca trabaja hace cuatro años con la fundación y los créditos obtenidos la han ayudado en la ampliación de su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a incrementar su negocio con productos surtidos para mantener un stock adecuado de víveres para su tienda.

Su sueño de llegar a construir su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
The Community Group, 'Mujeres con Visión' ('Women with Vision') is located in the city of Cuenca, in the south of the country. It has a cold climate and houses many natural and architectural tourist attractions which makes it a beautiful city. The people are very warm and friendly.

This group is made up of women who live in different parts of the Cuencan city; they are very united women who try to do the best they can for themselves and their families - as they are the main source of income in their homes - each day.

Patricia Leonor P. V. is a very charismatic member of the community group 'Mujeres con Visión'. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca, in the Pampas del Cebollar sector. She is 42 years old and is married with three sons who are 21, 18 and 14 years old. Her first son studies in the Instituto Misael Acosta, her second son studies at the University of Cuenca, and her last son is still at the Técnico Salesiano school. Her husband works as a salesman, and it is through his hard work that they were able to build their own house.

Patricia has had a hardware store for four years, and has had good days and bad days, but she tells us that one must always have faith in God and try to move forward, hoping to overcome your problems each day.

She has a very good relationship with all her colleagues in the community group who make up a large working team. She has been working with the group for a year and a half and tells us that the credits she has received allowed her to buy merchandise for her business. With the loan that Fundacion Espoir gave her she is going to invest in buying building finishes and other materials that she needs to increase the stock of her hardware store and offer better products to her clients.

Her biggest dream is to travel and go to the beautiful Galapagos islands.

Blanca Azucena L. P. is another active member of the community group 'Mujeres con Visión'. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca, in the Otorongo sector. She is 29 years old and is married with 2 kids who are 6 and 4 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying in the Luisa de Jesus school. Her husband works as a warehouseman for a private company and the couple have a good relationship and share household responsibilities. They do not yet have their own house.

Blanca has had a small grocery store for four years, and she tells us that it is going well and that at least she has enough to pay the household bills and a small percentage to expand her business.

All the members of the community group get on well with each other. Blanca has worked with the foundation for four years and the credits she has been given have helped her expand her business. With the new loan that Fundacion Espoir gave her she will stock her business with products in order to always have enough groceries in the store.

Her dream is to be able to build her own house.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building finishing products, and basic groceries like rice, sugar, oil, salt etc/Compra acabados de la construcción, articulos primera necesidad: arroz, azucar, aceite, sal, etc

loans.name: Blanche

texts.fr: K. Blanche est née en 1982 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Blanche est mariée à ZOUHO Crépin, un couturier. Blanche et Crépin ont un seul enfant, scolarisé et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Djassin à Porto-Novo. Blanche et Crépin assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Blanche a seulement fait le cours primaire mais elle a fini par aussi faire une formation en coiffure qu’elle exerce actuellement. En plus de la coiffure, Blanche vend dans son salon, des produits cosmétiques et certains produits de grande consommation. C’est à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin que Blanche s’approvisionne en ses différents produits. Blanche a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits de ALIDé pour son activité. Blanche a bien remboursés ces crédits et sollicite un autre pour continuer de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Blanche was born in 1982 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to ZOUHO Crépin, a clothing designer.  She and Crépin have one child in school who they still support.  The family lives in Djassin in Porto-Novo.  Blanche and Crépin together ensure that family expenses are covered.  Blanche has completed only primary school but also ended up completing training in hairdressing, which she currently works in.  Beyond hairdressing, she sells in her salon certain high-volume goods and cosmetics.  Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, is where she stocks up on these different goods.  Blanche has benefited before from two ALIDé loans for her business and has repaid them.  She's requesting another one to continue to respond effectively to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and highly-consumed products

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  NUEVO PROGRESO está conformado por doce personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 50 años. La presidenta en conjunto con sus hermanos forma parte de la banca, por otro lado tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra. Filomena tesorera de la banca en una persona muy alegre, determinada y proactiva, la Sr. David secretario de la banca es una persona con carácter calmado pero proactivo, las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. La presidenta la Sra. Hilda se dedica a la venta  de ropa (chamaras) en el interior del departamento, la Sra. Filomena S. se dedica a la venta de ropa (abrigos y chamarras) en la feria de la ciudad y también lleva su producto a vender al interior del departamento. Sr. David está iniciando su actividad en negocio de venta de CDs en la feria de la zona. Dentro de este grupo existe  la particularidad de contar un número considerable de socios varones los cuales en su mayoría se dedica a la conducción de  transporte público socias de dedican a la  elaboración de helados los cuales distribuye en gran cantidad. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas. Las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra de nueva maquinaria para incrementar su producción, otros para compra de repuestos para mejora sus vehículos y dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este grupo se encuentra en su quinto ciclo, lo cual  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Progreso" [New Progress] communal bank is made up of twelve people, whose ages vary between 20 and 50 years. The president, Hilda, is a member of the bank along with her siblings, and she also has one child currently of school age. Filomena, the bank's treasurer, is a very cheerful, determined and proactive person. David, the bank's secretary, is a person with a calm but proactive character; the other members of the bank also have similar personalities. Hilda, the president, sells clothing (jackets) within the province. Filomena sells clothing (overcoats and jackets) in the city's marketplace and also takes her products to sell within the province. David has recently started a business selling CDs at the local marketplace. This group is noteworthy in having a considerable number of male members, most of whom work as drivers in public transportation. There are also members who prepare ice cream and distribute it in large quantities. While there are competitors with similar businesses in the places where the bank members carry out their activities, the affluence of the consumers at the markets and the area's constant urban growth have allowed them to continue without negative effects. The partners are hopeful that their businesses will grow and expand, and they are requesting the current loan for that purpose. They are asking for the loan to purchase merchandise in larger quantities; in some cases to purchase new equipment to increase their production levels; and in others to buy spare parts to improve their vehicles and provide better service to their customers. This group is currently in its fifth loan cycle; accordingly, most of them already know each other and have experience working with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie B. who lives in the village of Brgy. Patic, Pulupandan Negros Occidental,is 50 years old, and married to Jersom who is a fisherman. The couple have 2 children who are 14 and 20 years old.

Julie works hard to help her husband improve their living situation and send their children to school so that they will have a brighter future.

Julie believes that the family should come first before anything else; that’s why she is doing everything to improve their life by providing proper nutrition and education to her children. When she got married she decided to help her husband by selling his catch within their village and even up to the nearby towns.

She was so good at selling fish that demand from her regular customers grew, prompting her to think of expanding both her husband's fishing venture as well as her own operations. So she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 so that she could purchase additional fishing gear for her husband and have access to more capital for her fish vending business.

Business did not always stay up - through the years, Julie and her husband encountered ups and downs in their business but she never lost hope and held on to her dreams for her family - the one motivating factor that made her go on in spite of the hurdles they encountered.

Now, her business is more stable and she earns a monthly average income of 12,000 PHP which is quite sufficient for her family's household expenses with some left over for savings.

Julie’s previous loan of 19,500 PHP was utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and fishing business. The loan was fully repaid on time and in full without delay. For her 13th loan cycle she is borrowing the same amount to buy additional fishing nets for the fishing venture and to have working capital for her fish vending business.

In the picture, Julie and her husband Jersom pose with their fishing boat and some of the catch which she will sell.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling and fishing materials.

loans.name: Djamira

texts.fr: Cette dame est  une femme célibataire, très dynamique  qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle y a associé le commerce de galettes. Son stock de galettes a diminué, elle souhaiterait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 09 sacs d'arachide. C’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This lady, who is unmarried and very energetic, has a revenue-generating business for grocery items. She has included with it the sale of cookies. Her inventory of cookies has diminished. She would like to stock up again. This is why she's requesting a loan from WAGES, so as to buy nine sacks of peanuts. She supports herself with the income from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of peanuts

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
“27 de mayo” es un grupo de 13 señoras que pertenecen al Centro Focal Alto Lima, así, Isabel F. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Anna E. y como Secretaria de Actas es  Dannia F., las tres organizan a sus compañeras para llevar adelante su reunión, guiados por un orden del día.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de comercialización, es decir, compra y venta de productos, producción y servicio y necesitan una vez más el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para sus familias ya que la mayoría tiene en promedio 3 a 4 hijos, además a ellas les gusta el consultorio porque tienen la oportunidad de cuidar su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The "27 de Mayo" group is made up of 13 women who are in the Alto Lima Focal Center. Isabel F. is the group leader, Anna E. is treasurer, and Dannia F. is recording secretary. The three of them draw up the order of the day for their meetings. Each is involved in different lines of work: commerce, production, service. They, once again, need financing to invest in their businesses in order to generate earnings for their families since they have an average of 3-4 children, each. Besides, they like the health office because it provides them with an opportunity to care for their own and their family's health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan which Lyn has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Habibatou

texts.fr: Habibatou T. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et a eu 6 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de poivre, de sel, d'oignon, de pâte d'arachide, d'huile végétale, de miel et de légumes. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Habibatou T. is a woman of 54. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for three years and has had six successful experiences with loans. She runs a small trade, selling pepper, salt, onions, peanut-butter, vegetable oil, honey, and vegetables. She contributes to the betterment of her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: P.g.

texts.en: A. is 32 years old, and married with 3 children living with her husband.  They live in the Matara district of Sri Lanka, on the southern coast of the island.  Her husband runs a small masonry business, which she wants to help him improve with this loan.  They hope to earn enough money for their children's education and to take good care of the family.

loans.use: Building construction materials such as stone, tiles, brick and cement

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
C. Sreyoun, age 39, has been selling groceries in the local market in Takeo Province since 1998. Every day, she is able to make about US $3.00 in profits. Her husband is a construction worker who is able to make only US $2.00 each day. This couple has three children living at home to support.

C. Sreyoun plans to open another business so that her family can make more income to improve their standard of living. She will take a loan of US $400 for her husband to purchase a motorbike. Her husband will use the motorbike to transport vegetables to the village to sell them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her vegetable business

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl C., from the village of Gingoog City, is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns and operates a business whose main income derives from making and selling specialty food such as tocino, longganiza and more processed food products in the local community. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first from HSPFI, to invest in expanding the business, Cheryl plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús Córdoba R., quien  Labora como Conserje en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado diez crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: piso, cemento y mano de obra, para su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María de Jesús Córdoba R. works as a janitor in the professional training center "Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA." She has 2 children in her care, and they are school-aged. She is married, and has taken 10 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this period she has used the loans to invest in the house that she lives in. She was able to do this thanks to CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to cover construction costs: buying flooring, cement, and labor, to improve her home. She is doing all of this to provide better security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement: to buy construction materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca K. is 37 years old and married to James K., who is a 45-year-old policeman. They live in Kabarnet Town. They have been blessed with three children: Hezbon (14 years old and in Form 2), Faith (12 years old and in Class 8) and Tony (9 years old and in Class 5).

Mrs. Prisca K. runs an agro-vet shop. She started this business 10 years ago. She gets a profit of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month and an additional income of Kshs 3,000 from other sources.

She has borrowed Kshs 70,000 for her second loan from KADET, a Kiva partner. She plans to use Kshs 28,000 to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer. She will use the balance for tilling and renting land.

Prisca has never borrowed a loan from any other financial institution other than KADET. Existing clients introduced her to KADET. Prisca’s business is near a Tobil Petrol Station. Most of her customers are farmers in Kabarnet Town and its vicinity.

If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra income to expand her maize-farming business. She dreams and hopes of expanding the agro-vet business and purchasing a plot of land, which she will develop. She describes herself as hardworking and creative.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidad está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Rosa Argentina C. quien tiene un pequeño kiosco en el colegio veinticinco de septiembre donde comercializa desde gaseosas, emparedados, tajadas con queso y chiverias. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Cecilia J. comenzó vendiendo unos cuantos productos como gaseosa, huevos, pan, fósforos y chiverías con lo cual poco a poco fue formando una pequeña pulpería y Gloria Elena S. es propietaria de una panadería donde realiza desde pan simple, con queso, dulce,  reposterías etc.
Ellas invertirán el crédito para mejorar sus negocios y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
The group Unity is comprised of three hard-working, decisive, and entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Rosa Argentina C., who has a small kiosk at the 20th of September School where she sells sodas, sandwiches, plantains with fried cheese and miscellany. Her associates in the group include Cecilia J., who started selling some products such as sodas, eggs, bread, matches and more, which slowly led her to start a small general store. Also, Gloria Elena S. owns a bakery where she sells plain bread, with cheese, sweet, desserts, etc. They will invest the loan into improving their businesses and to continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as sodas, bread, etc.

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco  Comunal Cumbe está conformado por un grupo de 12 señoras luchadoras y dispuestas a salir adelante junto a sus familias, viven en la parroquia  Cumbe que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia presentan viviendas mezcla de europeo, americano y las típicas  de la región con paredes de adobe, columnas, pilastras, puertas y ventanas de madera, pisos de ladrillo y madera,  con estructura de madera y revestimiento de teja tradicional formando un singular paisaje mezcla de culturas.  Cumbe también ofrece al visitante lugares muy especiales para la recreación como el mirador El Calvario a 5 minutos en auto y 15 caminando del centro parroquial,  el Gulash  entre Santa Rosa, Cumbe y Jima, Pucará de la Geografía Sagrada de los Cañaris, las orillas del río Cumbe y las ruinas de Ingahuasi en el ascenso a Tinajillas.

María Lucrecia León es una mujer  casada,  tiene 62 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos que ya son casados y viven de manera independiente,  su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción y gracias al esfuerzo del trabajo en su juventud han logrado construir su casa  compartiendo con  dos nietos que le hacen compañía.

María Lucrecia se dedica a la venta de animales como chanchos y gallinas que  los vende en su  comunidad, también cuida de una vaca y la leche que obtiene la vende y un poco es para el consumo de su hogar.  Es socia de éste banco comunal  hace cuatro  años  y todos los créditos  anteriores ha invertido en su  negocio, con su nuevo  préstamo comprará más chanchos y gallinas para incrementar su criadero de animales.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Al igual que las  otras socias del banco comunal la señora  Rosa G. vive en la comunidad  del mismo nombre de su banco del que formó parte hace un ciclo incentivada por su cuñada, ella  se dedica  a la compra y venta  de chanchos y gallinas labor que realiza hace 24 años y fue gracias a su cuñada que ingreso a esta actividad, los días martes, miércoles y jueves son los días que se dedica a la venta de los animales y los fines de semana vende en una picantería  de su propiedad en la cual labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 3:30 p.m. con su nuevo crédito va a comprar más chanchos y gallinas  para incrementar  su negocio y su meta es  aumentar  su picantería y hacerle de dos pisos.

Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 26, 24, 12 su primer hijo trabaja y su sueldo es solo para sus gastos, su segunda hija le ayuda en la picantería y su último hijo estudia en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo se dedica al cuidado de su ganado, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cumbe communal bank has 12 tenacious members who are determined to get ahead with their families. They live in Cumbe parish that is 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca. This parish has homes that are a mix of European, American and typical of the area construction styles. The latter have adobe walls and columns with wood windows and doors and floors of brick and wood; the structures are wood covered with traditional tile work giving the area a singular look blending several cultures. Cumbe also offers the visitor special recreational areas like El Calvario lookout which is a five minute drive or a 15 minute walk from the parish center, El Gulash which is between Cumbe and Jima, Pucará, a sacred archaeological site of the Cañaris people, the Cumbe river banks and the Ingahuasi ruins on the slope of Tinajillas Mountain. María Lucrecia León, 62, is married and has four children who are married and live independently; her husband works in construction and thanks to his efforts at work when he was young they managed to build their home which they share with two grandchildren who keep them company. María Lucrecia sells pigs and chickens in her community; she also cares for a cow whose milk she sells keeping some for personal home consumption. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and she has invested all her previous loans in her business. She will use the new funds to buy more pigs and chickens to increase her animal nursery. Her goal is to continue growing in her business. Like the other group members, Rosa G. lives in Cumbe. She became a member a cycle ago thanks to her sister-in-law who encouraged her to join. She has raised pigs and chickens for sale for 24 years and it was thanks to her sister-in-law that she went into this kind of business. On Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays she sells the animals and on weekends she tends to an eatery she owns from 8am until 3:30pm. She will use the new loan to buy more pigs and chickens to enlarge her business. Her goal is to expand her eatery by adding a second story onto it. Rosa, 47, is married and has three children who are 26, 24 and 12 years of age. Her oldest is employed and uses his salary just for his own expenses. Her second daughter helps out in the eatery and the youngest is still in school. Her husband is a cattleman and his efforts have made it possible for him to build their house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: El Retoño Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Retoño” nombrado así por que antes era un restarurant granD. y ahora solo es una pequeño palapa hecha D. madera y laminas en los camellones chontales D. Nacajuca, en el Estado D. Tabasco. Está integrado por tres hombres y una mujer. Los representa  Martín B. H., es soltero, además D. ser socio del pequeño restaurant también trabaja D. vigilante por las noches. Timoteo B.
