texts.es: La señora Wilma nacida en Sanandita, Tarija es casada con el señor Félix con el cual tienen 3 hijos,  ella tiene 34 años, ellos viven en el km. 14 doble vía a la guardia, la señora Wilma se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada  entre semana y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de comidas, el crédito que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de accesorios y actualización de  su computadora  para el uso de sus hijos, ella esta agradecida con ese préstamo y su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Señora Wilma was born in Sanandita, Tarija. She is married to Señor Félix with whom she has 3 children. She is 34 years old and they live at Km.14 of the highway to La Guardia. Señora Wilma sells seasonal clothing during the week and at the weekends she sells food. The loan she is requesting is to buy accessories and to upgrade her computer for use by her children. She is grateful for the loan and her wish is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy accessories and upgrading her computer.

loans.name: Kibisi Central A Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Kibisi Central A group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Benson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Benson will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi Central A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en: Felimon is 36 years old and an industrious father and husband. He is a farmer who supports his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but is not able to save money to improve his business. So, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He hopes to make his business more secure with this loan and to earn enough extra income to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Abiyemejumurimo/kmg Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg. Il a 50 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 5 à 23 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Jacques est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jacques voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg group. He is 50 years old and married with 7 children aged between 5 and 23. Six of the children are in school. He supports one other person. Jacques completed 4 years of primary education.

Jacques is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for business growth is to use selected rice seed. In the next few years, Jacques would like to expand the surface area of his rice farm. With the profits, he is planning to educate his children by sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Unia

texts.en:
Unia is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 2 years old. Three of them go to school. 

Unia runs a clothing sales business. She has been in the business for six years. She has one employee. Unia heard about Finance Sudan through her fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like shoes, T-shirts, women's wear and many others. In additions to this business, Unia has no other source of income.

In five years time, Unia would like to hope for an increment in the business size and to open another new business.

Her major challenges include school fees and home expenses. 

Unia says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping us in South Sudan with capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes and T-shirts

loans.name: Sreymich

texts.en:
Sreymich (in the photo), 27, and her husband, Pheap, 31, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters; one is in school and the other is still young.  

Sreymich and her husband are garment workers. Sreymich is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to assist in her grandparents’ farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and a water pumping machine. Sreymich’s grandparents are still strong enough to work.

loans.use: To assist in her grandparents’ farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 26-year-old, married woman. She describes herself as flexible and determined. She operates a retail store where she sells second hand clothes, commonly known as 'mitumba'. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a very busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power when a certain type of clothing goes out of fashion. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a bale of clothes. Olivia's business goal is to run a boutique and venture into a new retail shop business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Amadu M.'s Group

texts.en:
In the picture above is a group of primary school teachers in the township of Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 14,500,000 SLL in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Amadu is the featured leader of this team of primary school teachers. Born in Pakie Masabom village in northern Sierra Leone, Amadu is married to a housewife and together, the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Amadu is a professional school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Kène

texts.fr:
Madame Kène, une dame de la cinquantaine s’active dans le commerce depuis une dizaine d’années. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Chaque matin, elle se lève à 6h du matin pour aller au marché où elle tient un étalage de vente de légumes et autres denrées alimentaires ; à 14 h, elle rentre pour déjeuner et s’occuper du repas du soir de la famille. Kène peut avoir une recette journalière de 5000F ou des fois même plus. Cela lui permet de donner sa participation dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer, d’améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires, de payer la scolarité et d’épargner pour faire face à de probables imprévus.
Avec les économies qu’elle fait, elle souhaite un jour acquérir une parcelle et la construire.
texts.en:
Kène is a woman who is in her fifties, and who has been working in retailing for around ten years.  She is married and has children.  Each morning, she gets up to go to the market where she runs a stall selling vegetables and other food products.  At two in the afternoon, she returns home to eat, and produce the evening meal for her family.

Kène can make 5,000 francs CFA in a day, sometimes even more.  This allows her to help provide for the day-to-day expenses of her household, and to improve their standard of food, pay for school fees and save for unexpected expenses.

Kène hopes to use her savings one day to buy a plot of land and build a house on it.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other food products for sale.

loans.name: Melinda Aracely

texts.es: Melinda es una joven trabajadora de 22 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa y a la cría de ganado vacuno, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder alquilar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa para utilizar como alimento para su ganado. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Para alquilar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa para alimentar a su ganado vacuno

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi lives in Kiwalani area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with one child.He owns a retail shop near his residence.The shop sells different consumable items especially food items,rice in particular. Rice is one of staple food in Tanzania .Rice demand rises especially in festival seasons,like this coming Christmas.Hamisi plans to increase the stock of rice.There is an expectation of rice price rise.Having enough stock now will help him make more money later.The extra stock demands more funding.Through his savings he managed to contribute 10% of the required stocking.The strategy will help him increase income.The aim being to sustain the family and pay for school fees for his child. To implement his plans Hamisi needs USD 400 as a working capital.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF RICE

loans.name: Maria Benigna

texts.en:
I have sold cosmetics and lotions for a year. I sell these products through a catalog. This has created some difficulties because I do not have sufficient capital to be able to purchase products solicited by my clients. I seek new revenues to be able to attend to all my clients. I firmly believe that what I invest I will recuperate at the moment of sale to my clients. The revenue generated by sales helps me support my children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un ano de vender cosmeticos y lociones, estas ventas las hago por encargo de catalogos, se me ha dificultado un poco porque no tengo suficiente capital para poder comprar productos que mis clientes me piden, es por lo que necesito capital de trabajo fresco para poder atender a todas las clientes, me siento segura porque lo que invierto lo recupero al momento de entregar el producto a mis clientes es por eso que lo hago de esta manera. Los ingresos que tengo de mis ventas me ayudan a mantener a mis hijos que se encuentra estudiando en escuelas.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, eye liners, tweezers, lotions, face powders, etc.

loans.name: Lesbia Yaneth

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Lesbia Yaneth. I'm a traveling salesperson, I own a business that sells clothes and cosmetics. I have attained a solid clientele, asI've been in this business for the past three years. The income it provides is enough to cover all my family's needs, which is important since I am a single mother and my entire family depends on me.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hola mi nombre es Lesbia Yaneth, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa y cosmeticos, producto que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con buena clientela y tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madres soltera y de mi depende mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing towels, shirts, umbrellas, creams and sunscreens

loans.name: Luís Fernando

texts.es:
I have spent more than 3 years dedicating myself to welding. This business has helped me and my wife provide for our family. I am solicitng a loan of $1,200 USD. for the purchase of raw materials since I have a lot of requests from clients and I have not been able to supply because of the lack of raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo más de 3 años dedicándome al oficio de la forja. Este negocio me ha ayudado a sacar a mi familia, en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para comprar materia prima ya que tengo varios pedidos y no le es podido entregar por falta de materia prima.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She has 4 children. Her husband died two years ago in an explosion when he was at work, so she is responsible for a big family. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some modern fabric in order to increase her income and expand her small project. She wants to save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Pipih

texts.en: Pipih is 32 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to sell her products. She usually earns $15 per day. Her husband sells clothes in the market too. She needs more capital to expand her business, due to the small profit margin of her husband's clothes business. Pipih is a member of MBK and requests a IDR 1,000,000 loan. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Carlos Cipriano

texts.pt:
Carlos Cipriano E. lives in the neighborhood of Matola. He is single and teaches at Matola School. He is in the 3rd phase of the credit program. His first loan was of 3.000MT and is now requesting a loan of 7000MT to buy land.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

carlos Cipriano E. , portador do passaporte nº351501 , residente no bairro da matola, solteiro e da aulas na escola Matola sede esta no 3º ciclo entrou no programa no dia 07/03/07 tomando o valor de3000 agora vai tomar 7000 para compra de bens moveis é professor.

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Emmy M.. She is married with four children, aged 4, 10, 12, and 15, and has one other dependent, who is her sister. In 2003 Emmy established a business selling fish, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Emmy would like to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Mrs. Ouk M., 32, is a housewife who looks after the three children and cooks food for her family. She also has a small stand selling a variety of groceries, generally earning around $2 a day in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Pun Pirun, 34, works as construction laborer every day and earns around $1.50 a day. This couple has three children, all of whom are students. This couple hopes to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more groceries to sell in large amounts.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in large amounts.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Mr. Leonidas has in his home a distribution business for gasoline fuel that is disruptive to his neighbours. Thanks to the help of his beloved son they can run this business from their home. He earns enough income to provide his wife a dignified life and he has enough to spare to plant a small plot of tubers for their own consumption. On an infrequent basis he also works as an electrician. His request is for the improvement of the facilities of his small business to be able to offer tanks of gas in larger number and in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Leonidas, posee en su hogar una empresa distribuidora de gas que abastece a sus vecinos con este combustible, gracias a la incursión de su querido hijo en esta labor puede ofertarlos desde su domicilio; obteniendo ingresos económicos suficientes para ofrecerle una vida digna a su compañera, de manera adicional siembra algunos tubérculos para consumo propio y esporádicamente ofrece servicios eléctricos.Su solicitud atiende a mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeño establecimiento para ofertar mayor cantidad de balones de gas en menor tiempo.

loans.use: To upgrade the gasoline fuel distribution facilities.

loans.name: Asha's Jitihad Group

texts.en:
Asha is 32 years old and is married. Asha started her small charcoal business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm selling charcoal and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zainabu, Mkasi, and Maulid, who also have small businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Thị Phuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nghiem Thi Phuong (ID number: 050013), is 4o years old. She wants to borrow 160 USD to buy chicken-feed, chinawares to let other people rent. Her average income is 8-9 USD/day. She has 2 children, one of which is in the military, the other is going to school. She already repaid for the first loan and she is very fond of repaying weekly. Mrs. Le Thi Binh (ID number: 050008), is 40 years old. She wants to borrow 170 USD to buy frogs to breed. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Loan (ID number: 050009) is 38 years old. She wants to borrow 155 USD to buy wholesale pork for retail at the market. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ngai (ID number: 050010) is 49 years old. She wants to borrow 130 USD to buy pig mash. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Nga (ID number: 050011) is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 130 USD to buy meat and sell them at the market. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thang (ID number: 050012) is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 155 USD to buy wood to do carpentry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Phượng (MS: 050013), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà, ngoài ra chị còn mua bát đĩa để cho thuê, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên cho gia đình với mức thu nhập 130.000 VND/ngày. Chị có hai con một đi bộ đội, một còn đang đi học. Chị đã hoàn trả rất tốt ở kỳ I và chị cũng rất thích với việc hoàn trả tuần nên chị tiếp tục tham gia vào chương trình ở những kỳ tiếp theo. Chị Lê Thị Bình (MS: 050008), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để lấy vốn mua ếch công nghiệp về nuôi. Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 050009), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua thịt lợn vể bán ở chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngại (MS: 050010), năm nay 49 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga (MS: 050011), năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ bán thịt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thắng (MS: 050012), năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế để bán.

loans.use: breed frogs, buy chicken-feed, pig mash, retail at market, carpentry

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh D. is a 31 year old married mother of one. She sells grocery and grows crops to make a living, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thoun Pheat, is 32 years old and also farms, earning approximately $5 per day.

They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more inventory for grocery sales as well as to purchase fertilizer to improve their crop yield. This loan will allow Mrs. D. to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for grocery sales as well as to purchase fertilizer to raise their crop yield

location.town: Spean Krong Village, Kampong Thom Province

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo has his own house in the zone of Las Lomas (a poor suburban area of the city of La Paz) with his wife (Placida Quispe, travelling vegetable saleswoman) and their two children. Carmelo is employed in construction work, and does his business by offering his services in private homes (for example; the demolition of a wall, refurbishment, installation of furniture or building, etc.)

Past credits were used for the construction and finishing work of their home (now finished) but there are still a few more details that they would like to take care of. For this reason, Carmelo is asking for the credit in order to demolish the front wall that is old and running the risk of falling down (at present it is not possible for him to do so because he doesn’t have the proper tools nor the sufficient financial resources.) This will be his fifth credit. The socio-economic analysis has determined him to be well-qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo tiene casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas (área suburbana pobre de La Paz) con su esposa (Placida Quispe, vendedora de verduras ambulante) y sus dos hijos. El cliente traba como empleado en construcción, su método consiste en brindar sus servicios en casas particulares (demolición de una pared, refacción, instalación de muebles o empotrado, etc.).

Anteriores créditos le sirvieron para realizar la construcción en obra fina de su vivienda (acabado) pero aún quedan detalles por terminar. Por lo tanto, Carmelo solicita crédito para demoler el muro frontal que por su antigüedad corre el riesgo de caer (él no esta en posibilidades de hacerlo, no tiene las herramientas ni los suficientes recursos financieros). Este será su quinto crédito, el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Demolition of an old front wall (in order to construct a new wall)

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en: Mr. Sophoin S. and his wife, Mrs. Nary Chem, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 2000 and have one daughter who is in school. Sophoin has been an electrician for 18 years, a skill he learned from technical school. He currently works for a company in Phnom Penh, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 13 years. Sophoin travels to work by motor taxi, which is somewhat expensive, so he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Yulber

texts.es:
Yulber tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de tres años. Desde hace poco se dedica a la producción de ladrillos de adobe, ya que se ha dado cuenta que hay muchas personas que han empezado la construcciones de sus viviendas, entonces, la venta de estos adobes incrementa los ingresos en su hogar, dicha labor la realiza a un lado de su domicilio, sin tener que  ausentarse de su familia.Es así, que su trabajo le agrada, porque desde niño le gustó e interesó mucho la producción de ladrillos, ahora espera que  le vaya muy bien en esta nueva actividad, aunque a veces tenga que lidiar con las lluvias y con el ardiente sol de la tarde, el cual hace cansado esta labor.
Yulber tiene una familia a la cual mantener, y son ellos el motivo de arduo trabajo.
El dinero que solicita será invertido en la comprar de madera para elaborar mayor cantidad de  moldes, para los ladrillos, tiene la esperanza que esta nueva actividad le abrirá nuevos caminos para el progreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Yulber is 32 years old; he lives with his wife and his 3 year old son. For a short while now he has been working in the production of adobe bricks. He started the business when he realized that many people have begun construction on their homes. His brick sales increase the family's income. He makes the bricks in an area alongside his home without having to spend the day at a distance from his family. He enjoys his work because since he was a boy he has liked and been interested in the production of bricks. Now he hopes that the business goes very well for him, even though he sometimes has to battle with the rains and the blazing afternoon sun that makes his work tiring.Yulber has a family to support; they are the motivation for his arduous work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wood to make a large quantity of molds for brickmaking. He has hope that this new business will open new roads for his family's progress.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood with which to make molds for his small brick factory.

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en: Inosia M., 35, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the sewing business has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Inosia's only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Inosia would like a loan to purchase thread, lavalava materials, a sewing machine, and needles.  This capital will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.

loans.use: To purchase thread, lavalava materials, a sewing machine, and needles

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos. Es una persona que cada día se esfuerza para conseguir lo mejor para su familia y aprovecha la mejor oportunidad para hacerlo, paralelamente, ejerce su profesión de maestra, por la cual, hace más de 19 años formó su propia institución educativa en los niveles de primaria y secundaria, su dedicación diaria es de promocionar esta institución, lograr el aumento del alumnado, y lo está logrando, eso le alegra mucho. Maria se esfuerza  porque  sus hijos son la mejor razón para hacerlo y porque disfruta  ejercer su profesión. Invertirá este préstamo para mandar a elaborar los buzos deportivos y uniformes institucionales para el uso de los alumnos, además de elaborar afiches publicitarios.
texts.en:
Maria is 44-years old and lives with her husband and four children. She’s a person who works hard each day to achieve the best for her family and took the opportunity to do better. In parallel, she is a practicing school teacher for a school she started over 19-years ago. They teach children in primary and secondary school, and she is dedicated to promoting this institution, increasing student enrollment and it is happening and for this she is very happy. Maria works for the children and it is the best reason to do so because she enjoys her profession. This loan request is to send divers to develop sports and for student uniforms. In addition, these funds will also go towards developing posters for advertising.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop school sports and buy student uniforms for the little ones.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana, a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank, is 28 years old and separated with one son. Travelling two or three times per week to different regional fairs, she buys grains, cheese and mutton to resell in various markets in Ayacucho.  She is now requesting a loan to buy cheese and grains.  Her dreams are to build her own house, educate her son, and open a store in her house.  
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy grains and cheese.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan M., a 35-year-old trader, is a wife and mother of four children, who are currently in school. She trades in yams, beans, maize and groundnuts [peanuts], etc., on a table top in the local market of Ejura, a farming community where in the Ashanti region of Ghana where she lives. 

Alhasan says through this business, she has managed to support her first child to finish junior high school. She is requesting the loan to enable her to buy increased stock of yams, groundnuts, bags of maize and beans to grow her business. Alhasan says she believes the loan will increase her business for this year and early next year. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children in school to give them hope for a better future. 

She belongs to the community group called “Rely on God Trust Group”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Blandine Afi

texts.fr: Marié et mère de quatre (04) enfants Mme Blandine Afi A. est une jeune femme très courageuse dont l’activité principale est le stockage et la vente de mais et de haricots. Afin de stocker en grande quantité ces céréales pendant la période d’abondance et les revendre en période de pénurie, elle demande un crédit à cette fin. Les revenus tirés de ce commerce lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
A married mother of four, Mrs. Blandine Afi Amecor is a very courageous young woman whose main business is the storing and selling of corn and beans. In order to store these crops in large quantities during periods of abundance and sell them in periods of shortage, she is seeking this loan. The profits made from this business will allow her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storing and selling grains

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has six children. Three are in  school and the rest are traders in the market. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mariama  is an achiever and a resourceful woman to her family. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

Mariama has traded in bananas, oranges and plantain sales in the Koforidua market for more than eight years now. She treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas, oranges and plantains from the farmers and then sells them retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. She buys unripe bananas in bulk and she covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. They will be there for awhile so when they are ripe she can go for them and sell them to her customers.  With a loan of $375 she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas, oranges and plantains to enable her to increase her sales. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education. Mariama belongs to a village bank called ‘Nhyira Mma’ which means "Blessed Children".

loans.use: To purchase bunch supplies of  bananas, oranges and plantains.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Додохоновой Саиде 34 года, замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. С Микроинвест сотрудничает в течении полугода. Ее основное занятие это купля продажа косточек от абрикосов. Каждую неделю она выходит на местные рынки и закупает абрикосовые косточки. Если получается продать дороже, то она сразу продает, а если цена ее не устраивает то она привозит косточки домой. Отсортировав косточки по размеру, она выносит их на следующий базар и там продает. Ее доход составляет дополнительный доход в семью. Саида собирается получить новый займ и так как сезонная цена на косточки низкая закупить их оптом.
texts.en:
Saida D. is 34 years old, married and raising one child. She has been partnering with MicroInvest for half a year. Her main business is buying and selling apricot seeds. Every week she goes to local markets and buys apricot seeds. If she can sell them at a profit there, then she does so right away. If not, then she brings the seeds home. She then sorts them and takes them to another market to sell. Saida’s profit has become a supplemental income for her family. She plans to obtain a new loan to help her buy seeds wholesale at a current low seasonal price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of apricot seeds

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is a LAPO client. She sells juice and drinks. She requests a $825 loan to purchase more juice to sell. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She thanks everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more juice to sell

loans.name: Izzatbibi

texts.ru: Иззатбиби - женщина 48 лет, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Занимается оптово-розничной продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке Фаровон г. Гафурова. Муж временно не работает. Ей помогают сыновья. За все время кредитования, она целенаправленно использует свой займ, и расширяет свой бизнес. Для того чтобы женить своих сыновей, она должна расширять свой бизнес, для получения большей прибыли. Иззатбиби очень довольна нашим кредитованием, и желает еще большего процветания.
texts.en:
Izzatbibi is 48 years old, married and has three children. She is in a wholesale-retail business of selling confectioneries on the market Farovon in the town of Gafurov. Her husband is not working temporarily and her sons are helping her. During all the time of lending she purposefully used the loan to expand her business. To be able to get her sons married she has to expand the business to get good profits. Izzatbibi is very satisfied with the loans and wishes to be even more successful.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale and retail of confectioneries

loans.name: Mrs. Seam Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nineteen members, is located in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. SE. V. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faced an obstacle because her field is infertile. This has a bad effect on her crops. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. H. Han, is a construction worker. Mrs. SE. V. has five children. One of her children is a construction worker while another is a laborer and the others are attending the local school. 

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mafalda Maria De Fátima Arminda Gloria

texts.pt:
Mafalda Maria de Fátima Arminda Gloria C. é natural de Maputo, tem 49 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos onde o mais velho tem 29 e ultimo tem 17 anos de idade respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustentam uma neta que mora com ela.

Mafalda estudou até 8ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, até aos 17 anos se casou, casamento que apenas durou 5 anos, e mais tarde veio juntar se com outro homem e este também abandonou e lhe deixo com filhos indo para terra do rand e nunca voltou isto em 1997 dai que se viu obrigada a procurar alternativa para sustentar os filhos onde optou pelo negocio, de então até hoje já praticou vários tipos de negocio actualmente com a de venda de roupa, negocio que lhe dá um rendimento mensal de 5000,00mt.

Mafalda solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio. Futuramente pretende comprar um carro e conta com ajuda de crédito.
texts.en:
Mafalda Maria de Fátima Arminda Gloria C. was born in Maputo. She is 49 years old and the single mother of 5 children between the ages of 29 and 17. Besides her children, she also supports a granddaughter who lives with her. Mafalda had to stop going to school when she was in 8th grade because of her financial situation. She got married when she was 17, and the relationship lasted 5 years. Later on she began living with another man, but he also abandoned her by going off to South Africa in 1997 and never returning. She was forced to find a way to support her children, so she chose business. Since then, Mafalda has had many businesses. She is currently selling clothes and earns a monthly income of 5,000 MT. This is Mafalda’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. In the future she would like to buy a car with more credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

borrowers.first_name: Mafalda Maria De Fátima Arminda Gloria

loans.name: Bolatitu

texts.en: Bolatitu is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Bolatitu sells sarongs and bags. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs and bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A. is twenty–one years old. She is divorced and has one child, a son who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Afia trades in clothes. She deals in ready-made clothes such as jeans for both men and women. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. Afia treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy clothes in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her son the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en: Mrs. Saman P. is a villager in the Khsom village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Teth Vorn, is a construction worker. In the plantation, Mrs. Saman P. has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field to make her crop more productive. Additionally, she would use the rest of money to buy equipment supplies to support her husband’s work. She hopes to increase their income and make her family's better than before. Mrs. Saman P. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field to make her crop more productive and she would use the rest of money to buy equipment supplies to support her husband’s work.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Three are currently in school. She is a petty trader and sells assorted products like cooking utensils and through hawking, that is, house-to-house selling. She has been in this business for two years now. With her humorous nature, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her.

Akosua treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of the high increase in the price of goods in the market. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products like cooking utensils. With the loan she hopes to make lots of profit and to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell her wares. She wants to save more for her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cooking utensils, fabrics, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Cris John

texts.en: Cris John R. is from the village of Landing, Camella, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cris John is currently engaged as a worker for a company. He has held this job for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. However, he is planning to engage in another business endeavor: he plans to raise pigs for sale. In 2009, Cris John joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase five piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe  T. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu Uta Lefaga. She is married and has six school-aged children.  Lupe owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Lupe has been engaged in this business for over three years.

Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lupe  has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lupe is now requesting a new loan of $375 which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lupe  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old and she is married with a child. She sells provisions like milk, sugar, soap, etc. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola es una socia trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y  prendas de vestir,  su esposo es obrero en un aserradero. Paola forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desde hace dos años, tiempo que ha sabido desarrollarse económicamente, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en productos de belleza. Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir y vender a sus diferentes clientes. La meta de Paola es llegar a tener un bazar bien implementado.
texts.en:
Paola is a bank member who works hard and perseveres. She lives in Pucallpa in the Ucayali region and is the 30 year old mother of two children. She sells beauty products and clothing for living and her husband works at a Sawmill. Paola has been a member of the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” for two years. During this time she has learned how to develop herself economically. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she invested in beauty products. Today she needs loan for 1000 soles to buy articles of clothing to sell to her various clients. Her goal is to have a well established variety store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice Wanjiru is a single businesswoman who runs a textile shop known as Eunique Textile shop. She sells threads, ribbons, cotton, buttons and trims to tailors in the local Jericho market.  

Her business challenges consist of customers delaying their payments, and lack of capital to expand her business.  She wants to use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more threads and trims.  In the future, she wants to have a big shop.  Eunice describes herself as intelligent and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more threads and trims.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and married with seven children.  Her husband works for the government. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a grocery store where she sells groceries and foodstuffs. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Don  Luís Alfonso C. ,es un hombre dedicado a los trabajos de campos desde hace 27 años , la mayor afectación que se le presenta durante este tiempo son los recursos económicos , para poder darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivo de piña ; ya que estos carecen de insumos y la fruta queda muy pequeña , si el logra inducir en tiempo y forma todo los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios logrará sacar un  producción de calidad , esto le beneficia por lo que da mas facilidad al vender la piña grande a mejor precio, lo cual obtendrá y mejores ganancias, y pagaría en tiempo de pago su crédito mejora las condiciones de vida para su familia . Don Luís habita en el barrio La Borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar en los gastos básico de agua, luz , ellos tiene cuatro hijos mayores  de edad,  todos habitan con él. Y trabajan con el en los  trabajos agrícolas . Agradece a la institución por la confianza y seguridad que le brinda a los agricultores para que saquen su producción en mejores condiciones y sean mejor pagadas.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfonso C. has made a living as a farmer for 27 years. The greatest challenge that has been presented to him during this time is that of economic resources, to be able to provide better maintenance to his cultivation of pineapples, since they are lacking the necessary supplies and the fruit ends up very small. If in time he manages to implement the necessary fertilizers and supplies, he will be able to yield quality products. This would benefit him because it would be easier to sell large pineapples at a better price, thereby increasing his earnings. Also, he would pay off his loan on time and improve the quality of life for his family. Luis lives with his wife in the neighborhood La Borgona, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works as a merchant to support him with the basic domestic expenses, such as water and electricity. They have four older children, all of whom live with them and work with Luis in agriculture. He thanks this institution for the confidence and security that it provides farmers, so they can turn out their products in better conditions and be better paid.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to combat plagues and obtain better fruit

loans.name: Teodora Narcisa

texts.es:
Teodora V. de 41 años de edad, vive en una casa de caña con las únicas facilidades de tener agua y luz, su casa esta ubicada en la zona Perimetral de Guayaquil, Teodora trabajo como cocinera en una empresa pero al ver ella que no pasaba tiempo con su hija decidió no trabajar mas, ya que su hija estaba cogiendo malos rumbos en su vida y fue hay que ella comenzó con una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Teodora ahora trabaja desde las 06:30 hasta las 21h00, comprar las legumbres en el mercado y algunos proveedores traen los productos a su domicilio ella tiene en su tienda pollos que los vende a $ 1.25 la libra, colas que las vende a $ 1.20, leches a $ 0.75 litro, una de las mayores complicaciones en cuando les roban a los proveedores en el sector esto ocasiona que no lleguen los productos a su domicilio.

Teodora no esta casada y se le hace difícil mantener a sus dos hijos uno de 10 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal y  su otra hija de 18 años que ya es bachiller.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar teléfonos para alquilar, aceites, papel higiénico, jabón etc. En el futuro quiere ampliar su tienda para que con esos ingresos poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Teodora V. is 41 years old, and lives in a house made of cane (reeds) where the only comforts are water and light. Her house is located in the perimeter of Guayaquil. Teodora worked as a cook for a business but seeing that she was not spending enough time with her daughter, she decided not to work anymore since her daughter was taking a bad path in life. It was in this way that she began with a small store in her house. Teodora now works from 6:30 in the morning until 9 at night. She buys vegetables in the market and some vendors bring products to her house. In her store she has chicken that sells for $1.25 per pound, soft drinks that sell for $1.20, and milk that sells for $0.75 per liter. One of the biggest complications is when the vendors in her area are robbed and on these occasions they cannot bring products to her house. Teodora is not married and this makes it difficult for her to support her 2 children, one who is 10 and studies in public school and her daughter who is 18 and is still unmarried. With the loan she wants to buy telephones to rent, cooking oil, toilet paper, soap, etc. In the future she wants to enlarge her shop so that with the earnings she can build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy telephones, cooking oil and toilet paper

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatoulaye S. est une dame de 36 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 an 3mois et 13 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Tonghor à Yoff. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis décembre 2006 et n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt antérieur.
Son activité primaire concerne la vente de boubous et chaussures. Elle capitalise une expérience de 4 ans. C’est sur une table devant chez elle qu’elle expose ses marchandises. Elle est aussi très bien connue dans les tresses dans le quartier. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce grâce a l’encouragement de sa maman. L’avantage pour elle c’est la rentabilité et le statut de non dépendance qui en découle. Madame S. a l’intention de diversifier un peu son activité  et démarrer le petit commerce de bonbons divers pour les enfants. A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Ramatoulaye S., aged 36, is married and the mother of four children. The youngest is 1 year and 3 months old and the oldest is 13. She lives in the neighborhood of Tonghor in Yoff. She has been a member of the Yoff branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since December 2006, but never took out a loan.

Her primary activity is the sale of boubous (a type of clothing worn by men and women in West Africa) and shoes. She built up a 4-year-long experience. She displays her merchandise on a table in front of her house. She is also well known in the neighborhood for her braids. She was encouraged by her mother to choose this trade activity. She enjoys the profitability and independence. Currently Mrs S. wants to diversify her activity and sell candies to children. This is why she applies for a loan of 75,000 CFA francs.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre muy laborioso y responsable de 48 años, él está al cuidado de su madre anciana, y a pesar que nunca se casó y no tiene hijos es muy cariñoso con los niños. Su casa está ubicada en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad, lugar muy apropiado para la actividad que realiza. 

Él es vigilante de un centro minero, trabaja de 6 de la tarde a 7 de la mañana. En sus horas libres le gustaba hacer negocio, anteriormente vendía carbón y pescado pero no le fue rentable. Un buen día, una anciana le regaló un cerdito pequeño mientras  caminaba por el campo, él pensó que le quitaría mucho tiempo y se rehusaba, finalmente accedió a criarlo. 
Cuando llegó al peso adecuado usó su carne para preparar “chicharrones” (carne frita en olla), y vendió varias porciones. Jamás imaginó en convertirse en un exitoso cocinero y vendedor de chicharrones, por lo que ahora cría sus propios cerdos. Aunque Víctor no pudo encontrar a la anciana que le regaló su primer cerdo, vive agradecido a ella porque fue el inicio de su actual actividad económica.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy contento por los resultados de sus inversiones y por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita construirá un corral apropiado para sus 7 cerdos, pues su meta es incrementar la cantidad para tener un restaurante grande de chicharrones.
texts.en:
Víctor, 48, is a hard-working, responsible man who is responsible for his mother's care. Although he has never married and has no children of his own, he is very affectionate with children. His house is very far from the city but it is a very appropriate location for the work he does. He is a watchman at a mine; he works from 6pm until 7am. During his time off he likes to engage in commercial activities. He used to sell charcoal and fish but this turned out to be not very profitable. One day, while he was walking in the countryside, an old woman gave him a piglet. He thought the piglet would require a lot of his time so he wasn't too anxious to accept it. Finally, however, he agreed to raise it. When the piglet reached the proper weight, he used its meat to prepare "chicarrones" (pot-fried pork) and he sold a few portions. He never imagined that he would become a successful cook and chicarron salesman. He now raises his own pigs. Although Víctor was never able to find the old woman who gave him his first pig again, he lives grateful to her for having started him off on his current economic activity. This is his second loan with MFP and he is very happy with the results of his past investment and for the level of responsibility of his fellow group members. The funds requested will be used to build a corral that will be adequate to raise his 7 pigs since his goal is to increase the number of animals so that he can have a large chicarron restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a corral for his pigs.

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is a member of the Yoruba tribe and lives with her family in Nigeria. She is a hard worker, and we see this in her business, where she sells both sarongs and groceries. She works long hours to meet the basic needs of her family, and has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more sarongs and groceries to sell. Omolara is 42 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school and depend on her for support. She has a good relationship with LAPO, and has asked that we extend her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
P. Yon is 45 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. Since 2008, she has been growing vegetables and raising animals to earn a living and is able to make US$1 per day, while her husband is a construction worker earning on average US$3 per day. The couple have three children, two of whom are in school and one is a construction worker like his father.
P. Yon would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to re-build their pig cage and also raise more pigs.

loans.use: to rebuild their pig cage and raise pigs.

loans.name: Mataeva Bahrinisa`s Group

texts.en:
Bahrinisa is 52 years old. She is married with 4 children: 3 sons and 1 daughter. Her elder son is 21 years old and he is a builder. The other go to school. Her husband is a pensioner. For more than 20 years her family has been involved in the animal breeding business. Now she has a milk cow and 1 calf. This loan will be used to buy 2 sheep. Also, she makes national house textiles. 

Nurgul, 30, is a married lady. She has 4 children. The two elder children go to school; the other two are still too young. Her husband works in the local post office. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seed potatoes. They are planning to sow the potatoes in the upcoming weeks. 

Usan is 59 years old. He is married and has 2 sons. His wife is a pensioner. Both of his sons work in Russia. Usan is a doctor in a village medical center. Beyond this, they have some livestock and a farming business. This loan will be used to buy 2 sheep and to sow corn. 

Umirhon, 39, is a mother of 4 sons. Her husband works as an accountant in the water users association. This loan will be used to buy 2 bulls. She also sells milk and milk products as well as fattens the livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135


If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy livestock for farming businesses, seeds for farming.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om P., age 53, is married and lives with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business as a recycler and fabric producer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a farmer growing rice and corn, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since P. and her husband have had these businesses. P. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more recyclable materials, and corn and rice seeds to expand the farming output. This is her first loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials and seeds.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.es:
Elmo es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijas en la ciudad de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia de mismo nombre ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace mas de siete años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa y diversa mercadería de modo ambulante en la zonas de la sierra cercanas al lugar como San Miguel, Agua Blanca, Chilete (poblaciones pertenecientes a la región Cajamarca). El negocio le ha brindado diversos ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia durante todos estos años, como es su única fuente de ingreso el trata de esforzarse todos los dias para sacar adelante a su negocio, eventualmente su esposa también le ayuda a vender los productos que ofrece.

Elmo ha venido trabajando con su propio capital durante todos estos años, ahora desea agenciarse de un capital adicional para ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas mercadería.

Elmo es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos, su mayor anhelo es poder remodelar su domicilio ya que esta construido de material rústico y de techo de quincha, lo que genera mucha humedad y afecta la salud de sus menores hijas.
texts.en:
Elmo is a 49-year-old father who lives with his wife and two young daughters in the city of Chepén, which belongs to the province of the same name in the region of Libertad. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. He started his business in which he sells clothing and various merchandise more than 7 years ago. He sells these items as a traveling salesman in the nearby areas like San Miguel, Agua Blanca, and Chilete (towns that belong to the region of Cajamarca). His business has given him economic income that he has used to take care of his family during these years. Since it is his only source of income, he strives every day to progress his business. His wife also helps him sell the products that he offers. Elmo has worked with his own capital during all of these years. Now he hopes to obtain additional capital to expand his business and to improve his family's quality of life. This is why he is requesting his first credit of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternatitva, which he plans to use to buy more merchandise. Elmo is a hard-working father who always watches over his family's well-being and development. His biggest dream is to remodel his home since it is constructed of rustic materials and has a thatched roof, which generates humidity and affects the health of his young daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and merchandise to expand his traveling sales business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years and married with three children, ages 5 to 15 years. All of the children are in school. She has been farming for 15 years, producing milk that she sells to the local market. She resides in western Kenya near Kitale town. She also earns some income from a kiosk in which she sells staple goods. She owns two posho mills (which grind maize into flour) that generate some income from her. One posho mill is located in the same building with the kiosk while the other one is located in a separate place.

She has successfully completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 30,000. She requested this second loan from Juhudi for KES 60,000 to expand her poultry project. Her challenge is the location in which her posho mill and chicken business is because it cannot attract many customers. In the future, she aspires to venture into a chicks business and acquire a piece of land in which she will install a posho mill and a shop, run a poultry project, and incorporate dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand on her poultry project

loans.name: Freddy José

texts.es:
Freddy José R. R. es un joven venezolano, que estudió economía y tiene un concepto muy especial de salud integral en una pequeña farmacia de la que, segun el manifiesta, las instancias de Salud pública, ha manifestado su aprecio, en el cumplimiento al pie de la letra  de toda la normatividad legal que rige para este sector, donde como valor agregado Freddy y médicos y profesionales especialistas de la salud, ofrecen servicios de asesoría para prevenir la automedicación en un enfoque de responsabilidad social con sus clientes que son orientados en todo lo relacionado con  prescripciones médicas, manejo alimenticio de dietas, etc.

Su idea de negocio inició cuando en Caracas, la capital de Venezuela, asesoraba un proyecto para algunos propietarios de farmacias y conoció la liquidez y utilidades que este negocio genera; así mismo estuvo cerca de muchas experiencias de propietarios de farmacias en su operación administrativas lo que finalmente  marcó en primera instancia su decisión de emprenderlo; por eso cuando se vino a vivir en Colombia y su mamá le insistió  en que montara una Farmacia, no lo dudó,  fue así como nació Farmaprevid  "dirigido a la venta y dispensación de diversos productos farmacéuticos y para el cuidado y la higiene personal,  como concepto novedoso orientado hacia la cadena que influye en la salud y por lo tanto en la calidad de vida del usuario de este servicio".

Freddy  quiere que en Farmaprevid los clientes encuentren de todos los medicamentos en su amplia gama,  por eso solicita su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de adicionarle a su inventario gotas oftalmológicas, antibióticos varios, productos de salud y de aseo personal e iniciar una relación financiera con esta organización. 

Su sueño, meta y también desafío principal es lograr estabilizarse en este negocio para conseguir su gran posicionamiento en el mercado; a nivel familiar comparte una gran alegría con su esposa por la llegada muy  pronta de su primer bebe y finalmente sueña con ayudar a muchas personas que lo necesitan, porque Freddy es un joven de buen corazón, sensible y muy altruista.
texts.en:
Freddy José R. R. is a young man from Venezuela who studied economics and practices a very special concept of comprehensive health at his small drugstore; he mentions that offices of public health have expressed their appreciation on how he literally follows all legal requirements required in this business sector. As an added value, Freddy, doctors and health professionals offer medical advice at the store to prevent self-medication, as a way to focus his social responsibility with his customers; he guides them with everything related to medical prescriptions, managing dietary nutrition, etc. His business idea was born when he was in Caracas, capital of Venezuela, and he was working as a consultant in a project for drugstore owners; he learned about the liquidity and profitability of this business. He was also close to many experiences of how owners managed their businesses and this finally prompted him to make the decision to start his own business. For this reason, when he came to Colombia and his Mom insisted that he setup a drugstore, he did not hesitate. This is how Farmaprevid was born: “dedicated to the sale and distribution of a variety of pharmaceutical products, and to personal health care and hygiene, as an innovative concept directed to the chain that influences health and therefore, the quality of life of the users of this service” Freddy wants his customers to find the widest range of medicine at Farmaprevid; for this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase his inventory with eye drops, varied antibiotics, personal heath and hygiene products, and at the same time, start his financial relationship with this organization. His dream, goal and main challenge is to stabilize his business and achieve a great market position; at a family level, he shares great joy with his wife for the soon arrival of their first baby; finally, he dreams of helping many people in need, because Freddy is a young man with a good heart, sensitive and very altruistic.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory with eye drops, varied antibiotics, personal heath and hygiene products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying generic products

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es:
Flora de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, hace ya algunos años ella tiene su negocio de comidas rápidas su hija le ayuda venderlas hasta las 22h00pm. 

Para tener el negocio tuvo que invertir su ahorros en víveres para comida, poco a poco con esfuerzo su negocio de comida fue creciendo. Ahora ella tiene su puesto de comidas rápidas y vende arroz con pollo, carne. Para darle un mejor servicio a los clientes ella quiere readecuar su puesto de comida comprando con el préstamo cañas, cemento y víveres.    

Una de sus metas es tener su propio restaurante y tener canchas deportivas para alquilar.
texts.en:
Flora is 52 years old, and she lives in the urban area Las Orquídeas (it got its name because it was a field with lots of orchids) in Guayaquil. She has had her fast food business for some years now. Her daughter helps her sell the food until 10:00 p.m. To have the business she had to invest her savings in supplies for food. Little by little, and with effort, her food business was growing. Now she has a fast food stand, and she sells rice with chicken and meat. To give her customers better service she wants to make adaptations to her food stand. She will use the loan to buy cane, cement, and supplies. One of her goals is to have her own restaurant and to have sports fields to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cane and cement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish, chicken, meat, pepper, and onion

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 30 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages 1 and 6. His eldest child is currently attending school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for the past 4 years and produces maize, vegetables and eggs, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his barber shop and battery charging business. His biggest challenge in farming has been diseases, which are always rampant, and the fluctuation in the price of milk.

William has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after he successfully completed his previous five loans. He has requested this loan of KES 56,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to help improve his poultry project. He says that this loan will increase his source of income and enable him to save for the education of his children. The loan will also help to meet the basic needs of his family.

In five years' time, he hopes to have acquired a quality dairy cow and also to venture into zero grazing. 

Zero-grazing: a farming practice in which the plant material for animal feed is harvested daily and fed to livestock in a dry lot. This practice avoids damage to fields from cattle trampling, but requires an increased capital investment for harvesting machinery, construction and maintenance.)

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and to improve his poultry farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David C. is a 30 year old married father of two children. He has a wife who is 28 years old and is a housewife.
David runs a barter trade business popularly known as 'mali kwa mali' in swahili. His business has been in operation for the last seven years.

This marks David's first borrowing from KADET and with the money he plans to purchase business goods for his businesses i.e washing basins and utensils. His major customers include the local passersby and retailers.

In the future David hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase business goods for his businesses i.e washing basins and utensils.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.’s husband appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Lilia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married to a businessman with a boy and a girl--one in the University, the other one in primary school. She has operated her business of selling handbags and soft drinks (juices) for the last six years. She sells wholesale and retail, door to door and from home. This way, she contributes to her husband's earnings.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to be a big supplier of handbags in the future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to raise her standard of living. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Valientes, está ubicado en Morelos en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la primera  vez que solicitan un crédito a CrediComún.

Ignacia S. M., es integrante del grupo. Tiene 49 años de edad, y cuenta con su molino de nixtamal, ella se ha beneficiado, con esta actividad, ya que la mayor parte de las personas de esta localidad elaboran diariamente en casa las tortillas que consumen, es por eso que el servicio de la señora Ignacia es básico, lo que le ha permitido tener un ingreso seguro todos los días, con lo que ha logrado mejorar su local, porque en sus inicios sólo era de lámina de cartón, al igual que su casa, y actualmente su local ya es de loza. 
Utiliza su crédito para darle mantenimiento a su molino, y para comprar refacciones como el balero y la flecha, que ya están deteriorados, estas partes se cambian periódicamente  por el uso, sin contar algunas fallas que a veces le resultan por la antigüedad de la maquina, que tiene ya 60 años de estar en función. Tiene 6 hijos (3 varones, Gustavo de 23 años, Daniel de 19 años y José Manuel de  17 años y 3 Antonia de 28 años, Juana de 26 y Guadalupe de 21 años). Ella se dedica a  esto desde hace 26 años, actualmente su hijo Daniel está estudiando una licenciatura en el estado de México, y ella trabaja para apoyarlo, ya que siempre fue un sueño para ella que uno de sus  hijos fuera profesionista.
texts.en:
This group is called “Valientes” (Brave Ones) and is located in the Mexican state of Morelos.  It has 9 members and this is the first time they have requested a loan from CrediComún.

Ignacia S. M., 49, is a group member.  She has a nixtamal (tortilla dough) mill.  This activity has been beneficial to her because most of the people in her locality make tortillas at home every day to eat.  Therefore, the service Ignacia provides is basic which has provided her with guaranteed daily income.  This has allowed her to improve her locale because at the beginning it was made from cardboard sheets, as was her house, and now it is stone.

She uses the loan to provide maintenance and repair for the mill and to buy parts, like gears and bearings, to replace deteriorated ones.  These parts need to be changed periodically due to use and this isn’t counting some breakdowns caused by the machine’s age since it has been in operation for 60 years.

She has 6 children (3 boys: Gustavo, 23, Daniel, 19 and José Manuel, 17, and Antonia, 28, Juana, 26 and Guadalupe, 21).
