She has been in this line of work for 26 years.  Her son Daniel is currently in college in the state of México and she has to work to support his efforts because she’s always dreamed with her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: To invest in her business and service her mill.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn V., 27, is married and lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province. She and her husband have a business of breaking and selling rock. On average, they are able to make $5 per day. Phorn V. has three young children living at home to support. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a drill and more tools to break the rock.

loans.use: To purchase a drill

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita G. is 59 years old and a widow with three children. She is a resident of Malabor, Tibiao Antique, Philippines. Her husband died five years ago and she has taken on the role of being both mother and father to her children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is nine. Because of poverty, two of her children have only completed high school, but she has never lost hope because she has still one child who is studying.

After her husband died, Clarita focused much of her time on fish vending to move on and to provide for the needs of her family. She doubled up her work efforts because she did not want her children to go hungry or get sick. Clarita hopes that at least one of her children will finish college because she knows that it is very difficult to find work without a good education.

In 2009, Clarita had the opportunity to join ASHI when ASHI ANB opened an expansion program. Clarita’s dreams were the basic requirements of membership. Her first loan was for 5,000 PHP which she used to expand her fish selling business. 

Clarita is requesting a second loan of 10,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her business. The income that she will gain will be a great help to provide for her family and support her child who is still studying. Clarita also dreams that her business will improve with the help of ASHI and Kiva, and she hopes to expand her fish selling business to the wholesale level if she has enough capital.

loans.use: to use as capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Villa's Group

texts.en:
Villa F. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Villa is the leader for a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Villa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Villa prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Villa has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 2500 PHP each month.

Villa joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Villa is requesting her first loan, for 6000 PHP, to be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Eodosia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por 

La señora Mercedes  es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta  ya que gracias a los créditos recibidos de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha logrado sacar su negocio adelante,  además le gusta  la unión del grupo. Tiene 65 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene 8 hijos todos mayores pero dos de ellos son solteros y aun viven con ella. Su marido trabaja en una fábrica en Montecristi.

Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de productos de paja toquilla, en especial le gusta elaborar canastas, también compra los sombreros de paja toquilla ha artesanos de la zona para luego ella venderlos a mejor precio a los turistas y comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 15h00, dice que son muchos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que esto lo aprendió de sus padres.

Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla para fabricar las canastas y sombreros  para la venta. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'María Monserrate' community bank meets every fortnight in Montecristo canton, an area which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank and she is very happy since, thanks to the loans she has received from Fundación Espoir, she has managed to get ahead in her business.  She also likes the solidarity of her group.  Mercedes is 65 years old and lives with her partner.  From this relationship she has eight grown-up children of whom two are single and still live with her.  Her husband works in a factory in Montecristi.

Mercedes makes products from 'toquilla' straw and sells them.  In particular, she likes making baskets.  She also buys Panama hats (which are made from 'toquilla' straw) from craftspeople in the area and then sells them for a higher price to tourists and salespeople who take them to other cities.  She works every day from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She says that she has been in this business for many years and she learned it from her parents.

This loan will be used to buy 'toquilla' straw to make baskets and hats to sell.  Mercedes' dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy 'toquilla' straw and hats

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Y. is from the Barangay of Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with six children who are of adult and school ages. To make a living, she is presently engaged in selling dry goods, like blankets, and dried fish. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years already. This time she is earning an amount of not less than 3,000 PHP per month from the sales of her business. 

Just this year, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP as her first loan availment, which will be used for additional capital for her existing dry goods and dried fish vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for dry goods and dried fish vending business

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur T. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend a local high school. 

Enhtur operates a car tire repair service and a tire sales business at his own workplace. He started this business in 2006 and has built a stable and successful operation within this short period. For the future, he plans to expand his tire repair service. Enhtur is a hardworking man and is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to buy more parts and equipment for his tire repair business.

loans.use: To buy more parts and equipment

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen T., 38, is widowed and resides with her child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. She sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her child is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses.

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more vegetables to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with one parent and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He started his career at a very young age. In 2008, he started to work as a freelance electric specialist depending on customer’s requests. He helps his brothers with the family income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $400 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric compressor to improve his business and reach a higher financial level.

loans.use: To purchase an electric compressor

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Imelda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a retail store buying and selling flowers for birthdays, weddings & specials occasions in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of flowers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of flowers

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal K. 25 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Vusal yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas provivayer v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Vusal uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Yeqo mama delayet doma  iz moloka sir, yogurt, kefir i oni prodayut ix v magazini. 
Seychas Vusal nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yeshe korovi dlya uvilicheniya kolichestva molochnoqo produkta.
texts.en:
Vusal K. is 25 years old.  He is single and does not have any children.  Vusal is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in Fuzuli region.  Vusal has been working as a herdsman for three years.  His mother makes cheese, yogurt, and kefir from the milk and sells them to stores.

Currently, Vusal needs 2000 AZN to buy another cow so that he can increase milk production.

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Harrison Ayugi

texts.en: Harrison has worked in quarries in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. He is 54 years old, married to Mary Auma and they have four school-going children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time, and he plans to use this loan to buy another quarry site. In the future, Harrison hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport stones to different places.

loans.use: to buy another quarry site.

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is 36 years old and married with one child. Her child is currently going to school.  Ma. Jennifer works very hard to provide for her.

Ma. Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Ma. Jennifer has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, rice, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, curls, candies, shampoo, toothpaste etc.

In the future, Ma. Jennifer would like to improve her business and for her daughter to finish with a college education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Virginia le esta haciendo falta reparar el techo que actual mente tiene esta en muy malas condiciones, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que su esposo y sus hijos se encargaran de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Guadalupe de la pensión que recibe del gobierno. 
Desea que su casa este en mejores condiciones y mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia's home needs its roof repairing as it is currently in a bad state of repair.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan with which to buy the materials she needs.  Her husband and children will carry out the work.

Maria Virginia plans to repay her loan with the income that her husband Guadalupe receives from his government pension.  She would like her house to be in a better condition and safer for her family.

loans.use: to install a corrugated metal roof and do some finishing work

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 30 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri,  convive con Gladis de 23 años y fruto de esa relación tiene 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina. Juan es campesino, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, viene trabajando en sus propias tierras hace 10 años donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones. Sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la venta de estos productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos que están ubicados a 1 horas de caminata. Más adelante desea sembrar más plantas de cacao. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Le gusta trabajar en equipo por lo cual se siente satisfecho por  pertenecer a su banco comunal. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de madera y calamina ya que tiene planeado refaccionar su vivienda a base de material rustico.
texts.en:
Juan, age 30, is from the city of Quimbiri.  He lives with 23 year old Gladis, and they have three children.  They live together in their own house in the Villa Quintiarina community.  Juan is a farmer.  His parents taught him this occupation when he was a very young boy.  He has been working his own land for ten years.  He makes use of technology to grow cacao and coffee.

He has help from field workers during harvest time.  He well knows that the money he gets is for producing a good quality of crops.  He sells his cacao and coffee products in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri.  Those are the places where he can get better prices selling these products.

What he likes best about his work is harvesting the fruits.  He feels that the months of hard work compensate him with the quality of his fruits.  He considers the most difficult part to be transporting the products from the farm to the dryers, located two hours away on foot.  Later he would like to plant more cacao.

This is his 12th loan with MFP.  This support will really help him in the progress of his work.  He is prepared to make his payments on time.  He likes working as a team because it is happy to belong to his communal bank.  The requested loan is to buy wood and corrugated roofing material because he plans to repair his house with rudimentary material.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated roofing material

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza D. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12,250 PHP a month. In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin is very dedicated and has much experience in the livestock business. He supports his spouse and two children and also provides for their education. It is important to note that, thanks to his hard work, he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Muhidin is hoping for the support of IMON to obtain a loan of $3000 USD to purchase young cattle to increase his livestock and to earn more. Both Muhidin and his loving family will benefit from this loan.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Siline

texts.en:
Siline is 36 years of age and married with four children. Siline  owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Siline needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Siline  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Siline 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en:
Sisilia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For two years, she has operated a charcoal business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Sisilia dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en: Uranbileg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her younger son goes to secondary school while her husband works as a carpenter. She manages a wooden product making business with family help. She started her business in 2002 and has gained much experience. During summer her older son, her husband and Uranbileg work as interior decorators and during winter they make their wooden products such as chairs, tables and hangers. With their earnings they are planning to build a winter house for family use. They are all very diligent and hardworking people who are going to continue and expand their business. She says, "We are planning to complete construction work of our winter house in August." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for her business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Noussissi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUSSISSI est formé de treize personnes qui se connaissent de part leur activité, fréquentent le même marché et qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin.  La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Delphine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 53 ans, et vit au Bénin. Delphine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Vincent. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille,Delphine mène comme activité la vente de bijoux et de perles. Delphine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Delphine et les autres membres du groupement NOUSSISSI sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Noussissi group comprises 13 people who know each other through their businesses and attendance at the same market, and all live in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, named Delphine, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Delphine is 53 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an electrician named Vincent. The couple have four children, all in school and still in the care of their parents. To provide for herself and her family, Delphine runs a business selling jewelry and pearls. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. This is the first time Delphine and the other members of the Noussissi group are seeking a loan with ALIDÉ. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to the demands of their clientele.

loans.use: To buy pearls and jewelry.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a hardworking 22-year-old business lady. She is married. Since 2010, she has been selling cereals to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and her dream is to increase her stock portfolio. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy a stock of cereals. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances easily accessible to her.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Heroes Del Chaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HEROES DEL CHACO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Francisca. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Inicio de negocio de ganado, trenzado de mantas, ayudante de albañil, costura de chamarras, peluquería, venta de tostados.

La señora Francisca,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella pretende iniciar un negocio de crianza de ganado (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en su pueblo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el credito.
texts.en:
The “Heroes del Chaco” (Heroes of the Chaco Region) communal bank has launched its 1st loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro-Woman), as part of the Panamericana office. The group consists of 8 members and is managed by a directing committee led by Francisca. The businesses the members practice are varied, including launching cattle-raising, weaving blankets, apprentice brick layer, sewing jackets, a barber shop, and selling deep-fried tortillas.

Francisca reports that this is the 1st time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that the group was initiated at the invitation of a promoter in the zone. At present, she is attempting to begin cattle-buying and raising. She purchases her livestock in La Ceja and later sells them in her village. This type of work permits her to generate resources to help her family. Francisca is married and has 8 children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro-Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan system.

loans.use: buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Driscillar

texts.en:
Driscillar is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchasing of hair chemicals for the business.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon business, operating in a shop where her customers are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of products in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase hair chemicals for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Antonio Francisco

texts.es:
Antonio Francisco tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijo vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Antonio Francisco se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y ayudar a educar a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo los domingos con los hijos.
texts.en:
Antonio Francisco is 45 years old, single, and has two children.  He lives alone in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'El Placer' community bank is located in Chillanes canton, in San José del Tambo province, 60 minutes from our office.  The bank has 24 members who work in agriculture; growing bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soy and oranges.  They also raise farmyard animals.

Antonio Francisco grows rice, corn, oranges, soy and bananas.  He makes his purchases in San José del Tambo and makes his sales in the Sunday street market in Chillanes.

Antonio Francisco is requesting this loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.  This loan will support him in improving his harvest.  He does not face serious challenges in his business.  His dream is to enjoy good health so that he can continue working and helping to educate his children.

Antonio Francisco enjoys going out for walks on Sundays with his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Amanda De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Amada es una mujer de 60 años que se ha dedicado toda su vida a la cría y venta de pollos y gallinas y con este negocio a podido sostener su familia, ella además trabaja como empleada doméstica.

Ella quiere tener mas animales para la venta ya sí su negocio crece y podría dejar de trabajar como empleada, además se siente cansada y ya quiere solo dedicarse a su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 60-year-old woman who has spent her whole life raising and selling chickens and hens.  Through this business, she has been able to support her family.  She also works as a maid.

Amanda would like to have more animals to sell so that her business will grow and she will be able to stop working as a maid.  She feels tired and, from now on, would like to be able to devote herself to this business and her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is 24 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children aged 4 years and 7 months. They have not begun school. 

Divine owns a bar which she has run for 5 years. The loan will be used to buy inventory for her bar. She will use the profits to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her bar

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 59 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children. Pacita has a dried fish business and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to have a space in the market. She is a hardworking mother and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Norjamol

texts.ru: Норжамол жительница района Шахритус. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем. Она имеет четверых детей. Ее муж работает в хозяйстве. Норжамол сама занимается выращивание овощей. У нее при доме имеется участок земли. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и покупки семян лука.
texts.en: Norjamol lives in the Shahrituz region.  She's fifty-nine, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer, and she grows vegetables  She has a parcel of land by her house.  Norjamol is getting a loan to buy fertilizer and onion seed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and onion seed.

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es: La señora Estelvina, es una pequeña agricultora de la zona de Ticuantepe, habita junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen hijos a su cargo actualmente, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Estelvina desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura ahora ella esta innovando su plantacion con el cultivo de pitahaya la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para darle un mantenimiento agrícola adecuado  ya que la plantación carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor cosecha , el cual le permitirá sacar un producto rico en sabor y a un mejor precio para su propios bienestar .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva .
texts.en:
Estelvina is a small farmer in the area of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband who helps with the household expenses. They have children in their care. The plans for the future are to be able to improve their living conditions. 

Estelvina has for some years worked as a farmer but now is introducing her plantation to growing pitahaya [a night-blooming cereus, also known as pitaya, which produces a fruit commonly called dragon fruit]. Her major obstacle is that she does not have the funds necessary to give the required care of fertilizers and necessary farming supplies to have a good crop, which insures an end product rich in flavor and a higher market price, ensuring their wellbeing. 

She is grateful for the help given by Afodenic through Kiva funding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a divorced woman with two school-going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Gladys has operated a grocery for the past year; she also practices small scale farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, like tomatoes and onions, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of vegetables, like tomatoes and onions, for resale.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en: Musyoka is a 28-year-old married man. He has been distributing bread to retail shops to earn a living. He also practices poultry farming to earn extra income. He has employed two people to assist him in his business. He has managed to improve his business because he has been trained in good business management through Faulu Kenya.  He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru: С помощью предыдущего кредита Юлия значительно увеличила ассортимент товара. В этот раз Юлия берет кредит на закупку семян для продажи. Недавно она начала строительство своего киоска на рынке.  В семье все хорошо. Муж работает на Тепловой электростанции в Энергодаре. Дочь учится в Мелитопольской академии на 3-м курсе.
texts.en: With the help of the previous loan Yuliya has greatly increased the assortment of goods. This time, Yuliya is taking a loan for the purchase of seeds for sale. She recently started construction of its stall in the market. Her family is well. Her husband works at the thermal power plant in Energodar. Her daughter is a third year student of the Melitopol Academy.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, bracelets, necklaces, matemba, and wrist watches

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. He sells used clothes and has been in the business for the last year with a monthly profit of approximately KES 30,000.

He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of Kes 60,000, with which he plans to purchase skirts, trousers, blouses and bed sheets. He will save the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land.

In the future Peterson hopes to grow his business into being a secondhand clothes distributor.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 57 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de instruirse y desde niño ayudó a sus padres en las labores de agricultura. Está casado con María de 54 años, no tienen hijos y viven en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. Roberto reside en la Parroquia Luz de América de este cantón, un sector que es considerado como el portón de entrada a la Provincia, por la riqueza de su tierra ha sido el nido de varias empresas productoras de alimentos además que es la zona de mayor producción de papaya, fruta exótica exportada desde aquí. Es por esto que los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura, lo cual ha sido la motivación para que varios emprendedores de la zona fortalezcan esta actividad con su trabajo, experiencia y  esfuerzo.
En varias partes de la ciudad se encuentran terrenos produciendo todo tipo de cultivos, en uno de ellos se encuentra Roberto quien ya lleva 40 años en la actividad de la agricultura. Todo el día trabaja sembrando, cosechando, fumigando y realizando todas las actividades que la obtención de un producto final de calidad demanda. Con la ayuda de su esposa logra buenos resultados a pesar de las pérdidas de cultivos que se dan por los cambios de clima inesperados y los fenómenos naturales que llegan a la zona en ciertas épocas del año. El obstáculo más grande que siempre ha tenido Roberto es la falta de recursos económicos para invertir en su negocio, pero ahora encontró a Fundación Alternativa quienes a través de los préstamos de Kiva le han brindado la facilidad de acceder a un crédito que lo utilizará para comprar semillas e insumos para la siembra y cuidado de sus cultivos. Roberto espera que con este incremento en su producción sus ingresos sean mayores así suplir las necesidades de él y su esposa y además tener un ahorro para sostenerse en su vejez.
texts.en:
Roberto is a man of 57. He did not have the opportunity for an education, and from childhood he helped his parents in agricultural work. He is married to Maria, who is 54 years old, and they have no children. They live in Santo Domingo canton in the province of Santo Domingo of the Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo connects the mountain region with the coastal region of Ecuador. It is a city that has become a commercial axis with various growth sectors, and as proof can be taken a number of entrepreneurial families who began some years ago with little businesses and now are microentrepreneurs who contribute to the generation of employment. Studies reveal that the majority of all businesses began empirically and were welcomed by the passage of tourists, businesspeople, and travelers who move from one region to another, and in addition, the city has the third largest population in the country. 

Roberto lives in the Luz de America parish of this canton, a sector that is considered the port of entry to the province. Because of the richness of its land, it has been the origin of various food-producing businesses, in addition to being an area with great production of papayas, an exotic fruit exported from here. It is for this reason that the great majority of the inhabitants of this parish work in agriculture, which has been the motivation for various entrepreneurs of this zone to strengthen this activity with their work, experience, and effort.

In a number of parts of the city are lands producing all types of crops. On one of these is Roberto, who has already worked in agriculture for 40 years. He works all day, planting, harvesting, fumigating, and doing all the work that obtaining a final product of good quality demands. With the help of his wife, he achieves good results in spite of the losses of crops that occur because of unexpected weather changes and natural phenomena that arrive in the area at certain times of the year. The greatest obstacle that he has always had is the lack of economic resources to invest in his business, but now he has found Fundación Alternativa, which, through the Kiva loans, has offered him the convenience of accessing a loan that he will use to buy seeds and supplies for planting and caring for his crops. Roberto hopes that with this increase in his production, his income will be greater and will thus supply the necessities for him and his wife, and in addition he will have some savings to sustain them in their old age.

loans.use: to buy seeds and increase his production

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur   Gora   est   un  Sénégalais   marié   qui  vit  dans  une  des    régions  du  territoire sénégalais   depuis   longtemps.  Il  évolue   dans   le  secteur   du transport et conduit un taxi qui lui procure des revenus  grâce auxquels il parvient a subvenir aux besoins de nourriture de sa famille et faire face aux frais de transport et de paiements de location.   Il capitalise une expérience de 16 ans dans ce domaine. Il  a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur  au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre. Il sollicite actuellement un crédit de 700 000 frs prévu pour la réparation  de son véhicule qui est tombé en panne. Son objectif est de rendre fonctionnel son taxi afin de  maintenir l’équilibre  de sa vie familiale. Son projet futur consiste a acquérir une maison.

loans.use: réparer son taxi en panne

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Victorine âgée de 46 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Victorine est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Antoine. Le couple a deux enfants, un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Victorine vend de façon ambulante du savon. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Victorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du savon.

loans.name: Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thơm is 31 years old and married, with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for six years. Thơm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, and her job is unstable.

Thơm is the leader of the "Sisters" group. In this group, Mrs. Đào's circumstances are the most difficult. She is a single-mom and her family lives in a small house in village. Đào must work hard to send her son to school. Her main income is from a bricklaying job, in addition, she tries to rise poultry, and farm rice and vegetables for more income.

The main hardship that Đào and Thơm face is lack of capital. They are requesting loans to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in future. With the business profit, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her son. Thơm wishes to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jesica Patricia

texts.en:
My name is Jesica A.. I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for a year, and I make my sales to business like mini markets and small stores in the area, which helps me support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to improve production. With the profit I get I could help my mother and begin studying again.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jesica A. me dedico a la fabrica y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mi producto lo vendo en ciertos negocios como ser mercaditos y pulperias de la localidad, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder ayudar a mi madre y empezar a estudiar de nuevo.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, salt, water, matches, coal, wood.

loans.name: Rosaline Ambang

texts.en:
Born in 1967, Rosaline is a mother of four children. To her it was a dream come true when GHAPE outreached into her community and she received her first loan in 2004. With previous loans, she provided her community with fish, pork, manure and yams. Her goal is to build her self esteem and provide for her children.  

Given a loan of $400, she plans to increase her stock by stocking fish, reinforcing the pig fence and buying pig feed and medication. She plans to repay her loans with the sales from fish and her farming activities.  The hopes to save the money earned from her pigs. She is convinced her business will succeed because of her skills in the domain, the available market and the support from her group and center members.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first repayment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: the selling of fish and pig farming

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Che S. is 60 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. is a tailor and can make about $3 per day.  Her husband rents rooms from the family's house to nearby factory workers and can make about $2 per day.  Three of their four children work at a nearby garment factory and can each make about $30 per month, while their fourth child is still a student.  The family hopes to use this loan to build more rooms in their house which they will rent to factory workers.  In the future, they hope to build another house to use as a rental property.  Eventually, they hope that their child will be able to finish high school.

loans.use: To build more rooms in their house to rent to nearby factory workers

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina owns an impressive grocery store next to her home in a small neighborhood in Ayacucho, Peru. She sells a wide assortment of beverages, canned goods, and household cleaning products. She has owned and operated this shop for the past five years, building upon her inventory little by little. However, the majority of her business comes in the morning, when she also sells freshly baked “chapla,” which are small, round, hollow breads local to Ayacucho. This popular food is eaten at every meal, used for sandwiches or as an appetizer when filled with cheese. She spends all afternoon baking bread for the next morning, often with the help of her 3 children, ages 17, 14, and 8.

Bernardina was born in the nearby village of Huancavelica, and moved to Ayacucho when she became engaged. Her husband works for the city in the finance department. She hopes to receive a $550 loan, which she would use to purchase more “harina” (the flour used to bake bread), and continue to add new products to her store.

loans.use: Purchase more “harina” (the flour used to bake bread), and continue to add new products to her store.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So P. is 24 years old and lives with her 27-year-old husband and their daughter in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Her husband is a tuk tuk driver, earning $3 a day.

So P. herself works raising pigs and ducks, and she also earns $3 a day. She has applied for this loan because she would now like to expand her business by buying more pigs. This will help her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Husan

texts.en:
Husan A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 48 years old, married and has two children.

Husan is a taxi driver. He wants to repair his car. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Angele

texts.en: B. Angèle is 59 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are not able to care to her, so she sells various food and aroma products to care to herself. Angèle lives in Yopougon, a populated suburb in the north of the Abidjan District. She has been doing this business for many years and has been able to built a small house for herself. Angèle heard about the AE&I microcredit program from her cousin in July 2005 and she got her first loan from the Institution three months later. She has been an excellent performer since then, and plans to continue growing her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her inventory

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Koko A. is married and the mother of four children. At 40 years old, she has been trading for almost seven years. Thanks to good management, she has considerably increased her sales throughout 2007. She has also hired a young woman who helps her with her work. With help from this loan, Mrs. Koko would like to increase the size of her business.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer Liana Bianchi

Madame Koko A. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Agée de 40 ans elle exerce ce commerce depuis bientôt 07 ans. Grâce à sa bonne gestion elle a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaire au cours de l’année 2007. Elle a aussi engagé une jeune fille qui l’aide dans ses tâches. A l’aide de crédit, madame Koko désire augmenter la taille de son commerce.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and five bales of children's clothing for retail

loans.name: Shahodathon

texts.ru:
Shahodathon B. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 40 years old, has a Bachelors Degree, and previously worked as a teacher. She is also married and has 2 children. She has been in the business of selling food products for the past 3 years. She plans to use the loan towards a purchase of a larger assortment of goods. Since this business is profitable, she is able to provide for her whole family. She is planning to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Бадалова Шаходатхон проживает в городе Вахдат.Образование высшее, по профессии учитель ,40 лет. Замужем имеет 2 детей.Занимается торговлей продуктов питания,в городе Душанбе, опыт три года. Кредит планирует использовать для того. чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара.Данный вид деятельности является прибыльным, что позволяет клиентке обеспечивать свою семью.Кредит планирует погасить в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria has been part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua – for 9 years. Through the bank she learned how to save, prevent diseases and how to invest.

Candelaria is 42 years old. She is separated and mother of 2 children who are 19 and 17 years old. Candelaria has a small kiosk, in a stadium, in the city of Ayacucho. She sells candy, fruits, and beverages. She started in business many years ago with 50 soles little by little it grew. She has had the kiosk for 1 year. She is requesting a loan of 2200 soles. She wants to buy cookies, soda pops to diversify her kiosk merchandise. Candelaria plans on using her savings to send her son to the police academy. Her dream is to better equip her kiosk and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 9 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, como evitar las enfermedades, los valores y como invertir el dinero.

Candelaria es separada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos de 19, 17 años, Candelaria tiene un Kiosco en el estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende golosinas, frutas, bebidas, Candelaria inició su negocio hace muchos años con un capital de 50 soles, poco a poco fue creciendo, y hace 1 año tiene su kiosco.

Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas y para implementar su kiosco con mas andamios.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para los estudios de su hijo que postulara a la escuela de policía. Los sueños de Candelaria son equipar bien su negocio, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: She is requesting a loan of 2200 soles. She wants to buy cookies, soda pops to diversify her kiosk merchandise.

loans.name: Hadija's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Hadiaj is 43 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ages 8-29 years old. Hadija has a small business. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Hadija has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwandawa, who has a small business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Jamaludin

texts.id:
Jamaludin’s profession is selling used shoes. The shoes he sells are from returns from the surrounding Denpasar. Shoes that are damaged are washed then dried, and then the portions of the sole that are damaged are replaced, sewed and polished. Each day he sells his shoes in Kumbasari market. On every Wednesday and weekend he sells in Bringkit market. From this business, he is able to pay his motorcycle finance installments, and also cover his children’s education. Currently, together with his wife and children live in a leased home on Cokroaminoto road.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi Jamaludin adalah sebagai penjual sepatu bekas. Sepatu-sepatu yang dijualnya didapatnya dari para pemulung dari sekitaran Denpasar dengan membeli. Sepatu-sepatu yang sudah rusak tersebut kemudian dicuci dan dikeringkan, kemudian bagian telapak yang sudah rusak diganti, dijahit lalu disemir. Setiap hari dia menjual sepatu-sepatunya di Pasar Kumbasari. Tetapi pada setiap hari Rabu dan Minggu dia berjualan di Pasar Bringkit. Dari usahanya ini, ia bisa membayar cicilan kredit sepeda motornya, dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anak-anaknya. Saat ini ia beserta istri dan anak-anaknya tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan di Jl. Cokroaminoto.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun P., 25, lives with her parents on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of her children are still young and stay at home.

Mrs. Chanthoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her parents have been in the business of selling cows for twenty years. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to expand her parent’s business of selling cows.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and expand the business of selling cows.

loans.name: Taemanu

texts.en:
Taemanu M., 28, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

SPBD loans are Taemanu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend all the loan money on starting up her business. Her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer and spade, bush knives

loans.name: Fatma's Subira Ni Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 25 years old and divorced with one six-year-old child. She also takes care of another child who is three years old. She became a clothes seller in 2008 and works from 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. every day at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a 44-year-old widow with four children who have all completed school. She started trading twelve years ago and enjoys selling things; currently she trades in clothing materials. Rose believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained a great deal of marketing experience, making her one of the most successful traders in Obuasi market. She believes a loan would provide her with capital to purchase clothing materials to better serve her customers. Rose belongs to the community group called God First Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing materials

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thi Dục 47 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007. Các vòng vốn vay của gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào quán ăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 tiếp tục đầu tư vào quán ăn và mở thêm dịch vụ giải khát. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là kinh doanh hàng ăn, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị thu nhập 200.000đ từ quán ăn, chị có 3 con, 2 con còn nhỏ đang đi học, con lớn đi làm lương tháng 1.500.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đào Thi Dục - 47 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 2007. The family has used every loan to invest in their restaurant business. For this loan cycle, the family requests 9,000,000 VND to reinvest in their restaurant and into other commercial services business opportunities. The family's main source of income is the restaurant. The restaurant gives them an average daily income of 200,000 VND. Mrs. Đào has 3 children, 2 of which are still school-aged, whereas the eldest is employed with a monthly salary of 1,500,000 VND. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinvest in family restaurant business (food services).

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long P. was born in 1955 and now she lives in Damnak Trayoeng village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kong Nang, is a teacher in the local school. They are parents of three children who are enrolled in the school.

Even though, Mrs. Long P.’s family members have different jobs they still do not earn much money to live on. Thus, Mrs. Long P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise to add to her businesses. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cow to raise to add to her businesses

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.fr:
Madame A. Mawuli est née le 25 mai 1974 à Agoè, un quartier située au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois et de céréales dans son quartier. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1996, donc elle connait bien ce commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de charbons, 7 sacs de haricots, et 2 sacs de maïs afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawuli A. was born on May 25, 1974 in Agoè, a neighborhood located north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and the mother of one child. Her business is selling charcoal and cereals in her neighborhood. She began the business in 1996, so she is well versed in it.

This initial loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 7 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of corn (maize) so that she can build up her stock and make a lot of sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Đảng năm nay 45 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Chị Đảng tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, lương làm thợ xây của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của con trai làm nghề lái xe. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Đảng đang ngày càng phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn đựơc  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Hoàng Thị Đảng is 45 years old. She and her family live in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá province. Mrs Đảng is a TYM fund member since 2006. Her family income is from raising poultry, her husband's salary as a construction worker and their son's contribution (a truck driver). Their combined income is 3.000.000 VND a month and it keeps increasing. For this loan cycle, Mrs Đảng would like to borrow 9.000.000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens
